*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva. given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

bolormaa, 37 years old, lives with her husband, daughter and son in erdenet, the third largest city of mongolia. 

she has been working as a hairdresser at a barbershop since 2008. her husband runs a taxi service for local people. their daughter goes to high school while their son stays at home. 

she is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 mnt to buy planks in order to repair her fences. with time, the fences surrounding her land have become damaged and there are lots of gaps in them. after repair, the fences will prohibit any animal from entering her land and will protect the vegetables she grows.

bushra is a 31-year-old woman, living with her spouse in the area of muzzafargharh, pakistan. bushra has two children. her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family, but bushra has been running an embroidery business for 5 years to meet other expenses. her native language is punjabi, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks urdu culturally and for her business. they live in their own house made of brick that has drinking water, electricity, and plumbing.

bushra's embroidery business is very famous in the area, and that is the reason her business runs well. due to good relations her business has increased. bushra wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. that is why she wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance, to have in stock. she requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand. the challenge bushra is facing is to have sufficient capital to run the business and to be able to support her family in its present form.

therefore, bushra humbly requested a loan from brac pakistan. through this loan, she will be able to buy the thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors that she needs.

bushra and her family will be thankful to kiva, its lenders, and field partner brac pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

originating from sarkin fada village, shamsuddeen is a hard working babban gona maize farmer.\nas a babban gona member shamsuddeen has access to good seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and other quality inputs that will help him optimize his farm and attain yield up to 3.8 metric tonnes per hectare; 2 times the national average. even better yet, he will have the opportunity to increase his income earnings up to 2.8 times the national average. \nreflecting on shamsuddeen’s greatest memory as a babban gona farmer, a smile lights up his face as he remembers when he had a successful harvest season. shamsuddeen is confident that with babban gona, his future is secured and that he will have many more great memories and amazing accomplishments.

rainbow v. is from the village of kinoguitan in misamis oriental. she is 20 years old and married with 2 infant children. to make a living, rainbow has been selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community for more than one year now and earns approximately 2000 php a month.  rainbow has joined hspfi to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities, and is requesting her first loan, for 5000 php, to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

about hspfi:
hspfi is one of accredited partners of opportunity international in the philippines. it is based in cagayan de oro city and is reaching out to the poor households of northern mindanao.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

sok is a 25-year-old mother of five children, who all are dependents. her two oldest children are still in school while the other three are not of school age yet. she is a farmer in a rural area of the thmor koul district where the typical business is rice farming. she has been farming since she was with her parents when she was about 10 years old. her husband catches fish for sale. nowadays, she earns around 10 us dollars to feed her big family. 

sok leads a group of two female members. she and her group member have been with visionfund for 4 cycles and completely repaid the last loan with visionfund. now she is requesting for another loan to buy rice seeds to grow on her five-hectare farmland she leases from a villager.

she hopes this loan will enable her to increase her rice plantation and make more rice to earn more income to better feed her family and keep all her children in school.

virginie m. has run a restaurant in kigali, rwanda, for six years and now she has decided to take out her first loan to expand her business. she is 34 years old, married, and has four children. she employs two other people at her restaurant, but she still must put in long hours (7 a.m. till 8 p.m.) to keep it running. this 500,000 rwandan franc (frw) loan will help her to expand her restaurant.\r\n

ritah lives in kampala, uganda. she is married with four children, and all go to school. she operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. she has been in this business for the last eight years. she works seven days a week and gets additional income from providing outside catering.

she has requested a loan from mcdt – sacco to buy hair relaxers, treatments, hair oils, weaves and braids. her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. she lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

anhtuya, 38 years old, lives with her husband and a daughter in an apartment she owns in arhangai province, mongolia. her husband, banzragch, runs a taxi service. her daughter, sosorbaram, 16 years old, is a secondary school student.

since 2009, anhtuya has run an organic dairy production business. she previously operated a mobile organic dairy production business and now she rents a counter. she is well known to residential customers and has made many regular suppliers and customers. anhtuya is a friendly and open-minded person. she wants to expand her business in order to increase its income. anhtuya is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 mnt to purchase more organic products from herders to sell.

norah is a merchant from the rural part of samburu, kenya. she earns a living through her retail shop that she operates from her home, serving the community. she has been in this business for the last one year.

norah is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell such as detergents, flour, cooking fat, basic medicines, snacks, drinks, etc. with this loan, she will be able to enhance her stocks, thus allowing her to attract and cater to more customers and buyers in her store. 

in the future, norah hopes to expand her business and save money for future use and expenses.

gladys is a married woman with four children. she describes herself to be passionate.

she operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, flour, and other items. she has been involved in this business for eight years.

her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. she describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

she will use the 20,000 kes loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, flour, bread, and other items. she hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business.

this is her fifth loan with smep microfinance bank. the previous loan was repaid successfully.

tsagaanbaatar is a 55-year-old man who lives with his wife and daughter. his wife is a cook, but she has been helping her husband with his carpentry work since 2010. his daughter, who is 22 years old, graduated from university.

he started his business in 1990 by making small wood products. now his business is doing well. he is confident that his business will be successful. his dream is to teach the next generation about wood products and techniques. he is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 mnt to purchase more wood.

jasmin is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the philippines. 

she is borrowing php 10,000 through nwtf to buy additional sacks of rice to re-sell in her rice business.

jasmin has been in this business for 15 years. jasmin earns additional income from pig fattening.

jasmin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from nwtf. she dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

as a married parent of three children, lusvina works hard to support her family.

she has a fishing business in the philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. lusvina is borrowing php 10000 through nwtf to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

lusvina has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from nwtf. she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

ezekiel is a married man, and he has two children. he describes himself as good. he operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. he has been involved in this business for 7 years. his business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. he says his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. he will use the 80,000 kes loan to buy another motorcycle to add to his fleet. he hopes that, in the future, he will be financially stable. this is his third loan with smep microfinance bank, and his previous loans were repaid successfully. he will use the anticipated profits to buy more motorcycles.

lenie is 45 years old and lives in sangay diot, ozamiz city. she is married with three school-age children.

lenie has a general store business and earns approximately 10,000 philippines pesos (php) each month doing this type of business. she has a requested a loan of 40,000 php to purchase more stock for her general store.

lenie has been a member of pmpc for one year. in the future, lenie hopes to improve her living conditions.

thoeurn’s group lives in a rural village in kampong speu province in cambodia. thoeurn makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a factory worker to support his family. \r\n\r\nin their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help both of these members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

mirwais m. d., a resident of kabul, afghanistan, lives in a house requiring extensive repairs. married with six children, he lacks sufficient personal funds to effect the repairs, and is therefore requesting a loan of 50000 afghani for this purpose.  the repairs will allow him to live comfortably with his family members.  mirwais is glad that this kind of effective process exists in afghanistan to help support people. \r\n\r\n

elpedia is a 62-year-old married woman and a mother of six grownup children from ubay, bohol. she is a farmer and has been in the farming business together with her husband for more than 30 years now.\r\n\r\nelpedia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. elpedia believes that this loan could help her improve her business and makes it a success.

dionilin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the philippines. 

she is borrowing php 23,000 through nwtf to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

dionilin has been in this business for two years.  she also earns income from food vending.

she successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

dionilin has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from nwtf. she dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

mercy and her family live in the city of portoviejo, a place very affected by an earthquake which destroyed a large part of the city. on the night of the earthquake, her family was very afraid and pained upon seeing the walls of their house left with many cracks and the majority of the household appliances destroyed. she had a business selling ceviches [a traditional dish] which also suffered damages since in the retail space many shellfish were damaged, which due to the lack of electricity decomposed, in addition the dishes and the freezer broke down, in addition for some days she could not work due to the instability that there was in the city. after a time, she began with her sales and for this she has asked for another loan with which to purchase all the materials and products to continue selling her foods and, so, little by little with her earnings fix the walls of her house and purchase the supplies that they are lacking so much.

eunice is married and blessed with three children. her husband is a driver, and they support one another.

she is a motorbike operator and has been doing this business for a long time. she is also a fishmonger and has hired a rider, who works with the motorbike.

she gets a good income from the business and wants to buy another motorbike to increase her income. with a loan of kes 50,000, she will buy another motorbike and create employment as her income will increase. her profit will be used to pay her loan.

her dream is to be a prosperous business lady.

herman 28 years old, married with 3 children. he lives in duanguican,tudela, philippines.
herman is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. he has been doing this for 2 years. he has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other corn crops, chemicals such as corn rootworm protection, seed falters, insecticidal viruses, etc.
herman has been a member of pmpc for a month.  he hopes to use the additional income to prepare for future emergencies.

emelita is a 44 year old married woman from talibon, bohol. she has five children. the youngest child is seven years old. 

she manages a tricycle transport service. she has been operating a tricycle for more than 10 years. due to lack of capital to continue to serve her passengers, emelita  requested  a loan of 10,000 php to buy fuel, a tire and spare parts to avoid hassle and delay.

in the future, emelita would like to expand her tricycle transport services so she can pay her weekly expenses and improve her family livelihood status.

mr. vuthy p., twenty-one, and his wife, mrs. sreythy sorn, twenty-three, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from phnom penh. they were married in 2008 and have one young daughter. vuthy also has his parents and one brother living with him. his parents are very old.

vuthy has been a construction worker in his village for two years; it’s a skill he learned from his brother. his wife stays at home to take care of their daughter and his parents. vuthy doesn’t have his own motorcycle to drive to work so he is applying for his first loan of $600 to buy a motorcycle.

madalena is married, with five children (and none of the children goes to school). she takes care of additional family members. 

she sells charcoal at the market on both a wholesale and a retail basis. she has been in this business for 10 years. she works seven days a week.  she generates additional income through rental rooms and market vending.    

she has applied for a loan of ugx 3,000,000 from mcdt-sacco to buy bags of charcoal. her major business challenges include seasonality (the rainy season, which hinders her movements) and ever increasing prices of charcoal. 

she aspires of getting permanent business premises and also to buy a plot of land.  she resides in her own house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  her monthly expenses include medication and feeding the family.

brenda is a married woman with four children. she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. she is 36 years old and all four of her children are still in school.

brenda has a tricycle transportation business in the philippines and has been in this business for five years. she requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to buy spare parts and gasoline and to pay for maintenance for her tricycle. brenda would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

paulina is 53 years old and is married to demetrio.  they have four children and all live together in a house made of sun-dried bricks.  paulina comes from a poor background.  she mainly makes her living in agriculture but occasionally she collects plastic bottles to sell to large recycling plants.  paulina has a plot of land where she grows turmeric, organic cacao and other profitable products such as mullein.  paulina has been doing this work for 28 years and, with the money she has made over the years, she recently bought another plot of land.  when the harvest comes around, paulina hires local labourers to support her and collect the various fruits more quickly.  what paulina likes about her work is seeing that her harvest are good quality, which allows her to earn back the money she has invested.  however, one of her biggest problems is transporting her products from her land to sales outlets.  this is paulina's third kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial support provided, which allows her to continue moving forward.  on this occasion she is applying for 1000 nuevo soles in order to buy organic fertiliser for her crops.\r\n

with 30 years of age, mariam traoré is married and have two children, a boy and a girl. she lives in a nuclear family in medina, sikasso (third administrative region of mali). 
after running a few business activities without much success, over two years ago she started selling food condiments such as onions, a new market section where she has competence and her products are highly demanded for their quality. 
to face the increasing demand of her customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution soro yiriwaso a year ago. she is on her second loan that will enable her to improve her business in order and to buy 13 bags of onions of different seeds (a few bags of small seeds and a few of large seeds) from a wholesaler, who offers cash and credit payments. her products are sold cash to a clientele composed mostly by housekeepers. 
with this second loan, she expects to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000 fcfa which will be used primarily to contribute to family expenses and pay interests on the loan while the rest will be invested in the business.

in the photo are members of the “kalamera” group. they are small scale businesswomen based in makeni, a city in northern sierra leone. they have come to smt/kiva lenders in order to seek a loan of 1,400,000.00 sll. with this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

the leader of this group is rugiatu c.. rugiatu is age 33. she was born in makeni city where she is currently residing together with her two children. her children are attending primary and secondary school. for ten years now, rugiatu has been selling palm-oil and clothes. with her share of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying palm-oil and clothes in large quantities to add to her business.

naheed is the age of 45 and lives with her three children in the area of lahore, pakistan.

her husband is a bookbinder and binds books at home. she helps him after the completion of her daily tasks. her husband uses cardboard, loop wire, gum and thread for binding the books. he takes orders from book publishers and binds books on order. for the time being, he has been fulfilling many contracts but this time he has gotten a much bigger contract than before. the major problem is that he does not have enough cash in hand to buy the raw material for this book binding contract.

therefore, naheed requested a loan from kiva’s field partner brac pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy raw materials such as cardboard, loop wire, gum, threads, etc. to continue his business.

andrew lives in hoima, uganda. he is twenty-nine years old and has six children. his business deals in a local brew known as waragi. andrew also earns an additional income from farming. he started his waragi business in 1996 with the aim of earning a living and paying for his children's education. in his business, andrew faces a challenge of rainy seasons, which make transportation of stock to his customers difficult. he will use the loan to buy more waragi to sell.

imelda is 38 years old, widowed, and has six children, two of whom are currently in school.

she is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the philippines, and requested a php 12,000 loan through nwtf to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

imelda has been pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from nwtf to sustain her business.

in the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

nilda is a married woman with four children. she is a very hard working entrepreneur. she is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

she has a food-vending business in the philippines. nilda requested a php 10,000 loan amount through nwtf to purchase ingredients and additional materials for her business.

she has been in this business for five years. in the future, nilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

faisal is a 38-year-old married man living in ajloun, jordan. being a father of six, he has been the only provider for his family. faisal started selling baby pampers at his own shop two years ago, and his business is a good source of income for his family. now he needs to expand his business by adding more baby pampers to his shop so that he will raise his profit and be able to provide his children with the best education. but he doesn't have enough money to do so. for that, he has applied for this loan.

odonbileg, 29, sells casual clothes in a shopping mall which is located in ulaanbaatar, the capital city of mongolia. he has been running this business for 5 years with his wife and usually they have a lot of customers. now he lives with his family in his father-in-law’s apartment in the suburban district of the city.  \n\ninitially this couple started their business by retail sales from their home and sometimes sales by phone calls around the offices.  now he needs to increase the working capital for bigger sales volume.  it is beneficial to run their business successfully and raise their family's income. this loan he is taking will be dedicated to the purchase of more casual clothes from the suppliers.

kelis is a 26 year old woman who works making artisanal hats with the goal of paying for her son's education and bring food home. she's requesting a loan to buy canto-flecha reed which is the material out of which she makes the hats.

if you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from interactuar, you can join the lending team called: “friends of interactuar colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

lydia k. m. is married and the mother of two children who go to school. 

she has been in the cereals and fruits business for the last three years. she is requesting for a loan of 30000 kes to buy maize, beans, fruits and other food items. 

since joining faulu kenya, she has managed to educate her children. she describes herself as focused and hardworking and hopes to have a well established business in the future.

melecio d. is from the village of luinab, iliga city. he is 51 years old. melecio is married and has ten school-aged children. to make a living, melecio owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. melecio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.

in 2010, melecio joined hspfi to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. melecio is requesting a loan of 5,000 php which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. this will be his 1st loan from hspfi. he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children. 

about hspfi:

hspfi is one of the accredited partners of opportunity international in the philippines. it is based in cagayan de oro city and is reaching out to the poor households of northern mindanao.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

as the married mother of four children, charie works hard to support her family.

she has a fish-vending business in the philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. charie is borrowing 20,000 php through nwtf to buy boxes of fresh fish to sell to her local market.

she successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

charie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from nwtf. she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

saturnina is a married woman with five children. she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. saturnina is 59 years old.

saturnina has a blacksmithing business in the philippines. saturnina requested a php 13,000 loan amount through nwtf to buy additional items like iron bars and steel for her blacksmithing business.

saturnina has been in this business for five years. in the future, saturnina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

kumba is 45 years old, married, and lives in the community surrounding the airport of margibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in liberia, with her six children aged between 5 and 24. all of her children are living at home, and only four are attending school. 

for the past twenty years, she has been involved in business, and currently she is selling oil, rice, soap, etc., from a small provision shop. she uses the bus most of the time to get supplies for her shop. she likes how her customers can buy from her and she enjoys how supportive she is to her family. 

she learned business from other local business women. she is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, soap, etc., for her business. her plan is to build her house.

hello kiva lenders,

meet willis, a 21-year-old man very hopeful and focus. willis is an orphan who lives in babadogo-nairobi   (one of the largest slums in kenya).  education has been the main key aspect to his life, hoping always to move forward despite the life hardship of rather inclusion of living environment and poor background.  he has been looking forward to good life on realization that it is only after further education.

willis commenced his bachelor’s degree in information and technology in january 2016. this was sponsored by his employer, digital divide data (ddd) through the partial scholarship. ddd enables talented youth from low-income backgrounds to access professional opportunities and acquire higher education through a work-study program to its employees.  he humbly request for a kiva loan as a helping hand to his education and to meet his dream of becoming a successfully computer programmer in the near future.

victoriana is 70 years old and is known in aloran, misamis occidental for her delicious and palatable food. she delivers her food products for snacks to different school canteens and operates her snack inn just outside her house. she has expanded and had increased her production due to high orders from her local customers.

in order to meet the demand, she asks for a loan from paglaum mpc the amount of php 10,000 to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and other things.

victoriana believes having enough inventory of the raw materials will not hamper her daily operation.

adelaida is 51-years-old and has six children. she is married and has three children who are in school. adelaida is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the philippines. she requested a php 8,000 loan through nwtf to purchase additional feed for her pigs. she has been in the pig fattening business for 11 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from nwtf to sustain it. 

in the future, adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

m. jane is a promising business lady of 28 years old, married with 3 children. she sells clothes and she has been running her business for over 5 years. she is using the loan to purchase clothing such as dresses, skirts, blouses, and so forth for sale. she hopes for business improvement. her future plan is to work very hard and establish another boutique. \r\n

bernardita d. is a 44-year-old mother of two daughters who lives in culasi, antique province on the island of panay.  culasi is a beautiful coastal town, with the sea to the west and mountains to the east; it is home to madia-as, the tallest mountain on the island.  bernardita's husband bertito is a farmer.\r\nbernardita grows rice with her husband, and intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy materials for rice farming.  besides rice farming, bernardita earns extra income from working as a housemaid.\r\nbernardita's 18-year-old daughter is attending college, and her younger daughter, a nine year old, is in elementary school.  bernardita hopes to earn enough to help both of her daughters attain a college education.  she would also like to be able to afford to build a more secure and durable house for her family to live in.

kalpana is 43 years old. in 2001, she established her vegetable farming business. she has already received and successfully repaid ten loans from patan business and professional women. she used her most recent loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her business. in the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. she thanks you for your support.

veronica works hard to support her family. veronica is married and has a raising livestock business in the philippines.

veronica requested a php 20,000 loan through nwtf to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

veronica has been in this business for four years now.

veronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

bat-erdene is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in tuv province, mongolia. he and his family live together in a traditional mongolian nomadic tent, called a ger. his 23-year-old son trains race horses and his daughter works for her parents' business. they have been living in their current home for twenty-six years and have purchased two cars with the profits from their business.

bat-erdene started his grocery store in 1999, and his family helps him run the business. their grocery store has many customers because it is the only grocery store in their province. he has signed a contract to supply consumer products to local organizations, from which he receives payment every month.

bat-erdene is a very hardworking person who has a great business mind. he says, “i would like to expand my business and purchase an apartment for my family.” he is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to increase his working capital and purchase additional inventory for his grocery store business.

jorge is 21 years old, from santo domingo city in ecuador. he is single but lives in a civil union with 25 year old mariela. they have a stable relationship with a lot of communication. they live in the mulalo neighborhood at latacunga city. for economic reasons and lack of support from his parents he only finished elementary school. he has worked from a young age, and today he has a business selling clothing. he has worked with mariela in this business for 2 years.

jorge seeks a loan because he wants to increase his business and buy more merchandise to diversify his stock. he is looking to have more products to sell and thus improve his utilities and in the future have a family.

jorge is thankful to fundación alternativa in ecuador and kiva to make possible the growth in his work life and personal life.

esam is a 31-year-old married man and the father of two children, living with his family in a humble house. he studied an elementary education but couldn't complete his study because he got married when he was very young. he is the sole breadwinner of the family and his wife works as a housewife. his house lacks a refrigerator and he couldn't purchase one. for this reason, he applied for a loan of 100,000 yer from amb in order to purchase a refrigerator to keep water, drinks. and some foods in a cold condition.

esam hopes to provide his house with all home appliances.

robert used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle. he has been in the motorcycle transportation business for the last four years. after working at a hotel he saved some money that he used to buy a motorcycle. he has the responsibility of paying school fees for his children and caring for his family. he faces business challenges of weather changes, rampant motorcycle thieves and dust. in future, he wants to buy more land where he can build rentals. he wants another kiva loan to buy sand and cement to finish his house construction.

leah is 33 years old, married and has two children, who are in school. she is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the philippines. leah has been in this business for one year now and has borrowed six times in the past from negros women for tomorrow foundation (nwtf) to sustain it. leah requested a 15,000 philippine peso (php) loan through nwtf to purchase additional pigs to raise. she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.\r\n\r\n

shary is a hardworking and honest woman. she is 46 years old. all her life, she has been working the land, and is engaged in the cultivation of crops and livestock. she worked from early morning to night for the benefit of the family, but her income from this business is not enough to live on, and therefore shary and her family live in poverty. her three children and husband help her and they try to improve their living conditions. 

shary consulted with the family and decided to start a new business to bring the family benefit. to that end, she took a course "bring it on" organized by the association of business women and received a certificate. now, she is fully able to establish her own business and to become successful in this field. she wants to organize a business buying and selling dried fruit. she plans to use earned revenue to improve living conditions. 

she is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy goods for establishing a new business.

mateo is 37 years old, single and has a lovely family made up of three children between the ages of twelve and three years old. the family lives in a community in sololá.

mateo is very hard-working and dedicated. in order to earn an income and move forward with his family, mateo makes a living buying a selling groceries. he has had this business for ten years but, in order to earn more money, also works in farming.

some time ago, mateo started to build a house but he no longer has enough money to finish the work. he is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy cement, sand and iron rods.

mateo’s big dream is to be able to finish building his house.

lenie is 54 years old, married with three children, and lives in magsaysay, baliangao, misamis occidental. she wants what's the best for the family. her husband is a farmer. both of them are helping each other in their banana farming. she aims for a greater income because of the increased needs of the family.

lenie took out a loan and successfully repaid it. now she has availed a new loan of 13,000 philippine pesos to purchase organic fertilizer for her banana farming. lenie wants to save money from her business to improve their house building.

this is dorcas, a 32-year-old, hardworking woman who deals in the sales of general stuff such as brushes, polyethylene bags, plastic bowls, etc. originally, she is from accra. she has three children. she has been a client of id ghana for three years. she has taken out two loans with id ghana before.

she is applying for a loan to buy more general stuff such as brushes, polyethylene bags, plastic bowls, etc., to sell. her dream for the future is to expand her business in order to buy and sell on a wholesale basis.

she would like to thank all of her kiva lenders for their generosity and support.

joel is 34 years old and a responsible father of his three children. he raised his family in a rural community and makes their living through farming.

he aimed to construct a water-shield toilet beside their house in order to give his family a clean and safe comfort room. having insufficient funds, he wants to avail a loan of 30,000 php to buy the needed materials like hollow blocks, cement, bowl, gravel, and sand for its construction.

he believes that this financial assistance will enable him to construct a water-shield toilet to maintain a good sanitation in their home.

efrena r. is from the village of poblacion 2 clarin misamis occidental. she is 48 years old and married with five school-aged children. to make a living, efrena has a retail store selling street food such as banana cue, camote cue, and chicharon. she has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10000 php a month.

in 2008, efrena joined gdmpc to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. she has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 php from gdmpc and is requesting a new loan of 10000 php to invest in expanding the business. this will be the ninth loan taken out by efrena from gdmpc. she plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

about gdmpc: gdmpc is one of the most progressive cooperatives in mindanao, philippines. it has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of zamboanga del sur, lanao del norte and misamis occidental. its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

brenda is a woman who is always looking for a way to improve. she is 45 years old and single, and has three children aged between 20 and 28. this family lives in the las flores canton.

in order to earn an income and get ahead with her children, brenda chose an activity five years ago that would allow her to earn an income while taking care of her family. she works selling chickens and ice cream at the community's main square.

in order to continue getting ahead with her business, brenda has decided to ask for a laon to invest in her business. she will buy products such as chickens and different flavors of ice cream. her goal in life is to strengthen her business and improve her family's quality of life.

emelita is married with one child and works hard to support her family. she has a livestock business in the philippines and earns additional income from her sari sari, or general store.

emelita has successfully borrowed and repaid two prior loans from nwtf and more recently, through kiva. she is now borrowing 9000 php through nwtf to buy more livestock to add to her business. her goal is to use her increase in profits to repair and renovate her family’s home.

bolívar rents a house in a poor neighborhood of san lorenzo. he lives with his wife and his only daughter who is 4 years old. for many years bolivar has worked as a bricklayer. it is not steady work and at times he has had to wait for weeks to find work. his wife is 70 % disabled. fortunately she works in an office doing the cleaning. 

bolívar will use this loan to buy tools which will help him in his work as a bricklayer (a shovel, trowels, a drill, a grinder, a hammer, a saw and a tape measure). in the short term he hopes to acquire a mixer so that he can form his own bricklaying team, providing work to others and generating more income. 

he wants to give support to his daughter in a thousand ways. she shows promise as a news-presenter and bolívar hopes she becomes a great journalist.

additional information: bolívar belongs to the “la colmena” group which has 9 members who all have different work and who will receive between $500 to $1500 each, depending on their seniority in the group. it is worth noting that their previous loans have been paid on time and surely will repeat this with this new loan.

mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the philippines.

she is borrowing php 22,000 through nwtf to buy fishing netting and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

mercy has been in this business for 21 years. she earns more income from buying and selling fish.

she successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from nwtf. she dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

elena is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are still in school. she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

elena has a weaving business in the philippines. she requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to purchase additional fiber and materials needed for her business.

elena has been in this business for eight years. she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

yohanna, who resides in galadima village, is a babban gona maize farmer who manages a 2-hectare maize farm through which he supports his family.

despite working seven hours a day on his farm, yohanna was only able to eat two meals a day. however, this changed when he became a babban gona member. now, thanks to this loan, he will be provided with higher-yielding seeds that are locally adapted and widely accepted in his local community. yohanna will also have the recommended pesticides and fertilizers based on the results of his field assessment. this will enable him to optimize his yield, attaining yields of up to 3.8 metric tonnes per hectare, twice the national average in nigeria. not only will this increase his earnings 2.8 times the national average, but it will also ensure that yohanna never goes hungry again. \t

when asked to reflect on his greatest memory as a babban gona farmer, a smile lights up yohanna's face as he remembers opening an agro dealer shop. he is confident that, with babban gona, his future is secure and that he will have many more great memories and amazing accomplishments.

marina is 54 years old and has nine children.  marina is married and has three children who are still in school.

marina is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the philippines. marina requested a php 10000 loan through nwtf to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

marina has been farming vegetables for 20 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

in the future, marina would like to to expand her business.

dainer is a humble and charismatic farmer who has worked tirelessly to get ahead.

when he was young, dainer's parents taught him everything about working in the fields. thanks to that education, today dainer has a corn crop. he earns an income sufficient to meet his basic expenses.

the loan dainer is requesting will be invested in strengthening his business. he will use the money to purchase wholesale agricultural supplies, such as compost, pesticides and fertilizers. this will allow him to have a much more productive harvest and get him a better price when selling his produce. this, in turn, will increase the income he receives for his labor.

if you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from interactuar, you can join the lending team called: “friends of interactuar colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

mrs. ariungerel is 40 years old and lives with her three children in kherlen, an eastern town of mongolia. the family resides in a mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on fenced land. 

her eldest child studied mechanical engineering at university and now stays at home, looking for job. her second child studies at university and the other one stays at home. 

she herself has been running an aquarium shop for two years and has attracted numerous customers to her business. she is requesting a loan of 2400000 mnt to purchase fish, feed, aquariums and filters for a new branch. 

after opening her second aquarium shop, she can generate more income for her family and invest in her children's education. the borrower is a very hard-working individual, who is now carrying the entire family on her shoulders.

atilano is 29 years old. he is married and he lives with his wife and children in the town of callayuc, in the province of cutervo, in the state of cajamarca in perú. atilano has very good personal and work references from the residents in this area.

atilano has worked providing the service of cutting down trees with a chainsaw for 8 years. he is seeking a loan to invest in improving his work tools as well as the furnishings in his home.

atilano is a recurring member of our institution, edpyme alternativa. he has managed two loans which he repaid on time.

maria is 53 years old and has three children. she lives in maloro, tangub city, misamis occidental. to earn a living, maria owns and operates a motorcycle transport service while her husband drives the vehicle around their community. she has been in this business for many years and earns a good income from this activity. her previous loan was repaid successfully with the income she generated.

maria recently requested a loan of 13,000 php to purchase spare parts in order to repair and maintain the motor of her vehicle. she joined gdmpc in 2010 to gain access to financial services. in the future, maria wishes success for her children with their education.

celia belongs to the communal bank kantu san jeronimo. she works in a hotel. through this work she wants to get ahead. her dream is to expand her hotel business. she is asking for the loan to buy sheets for the hotel.
the member is very happy with the loan and is committed to meeting the payments.

maria is 45 years old and a single mother. she has a daughter who lives with her in the cofradia municipality in cortes.

maria has had a grocery shop for three years. the shop is in her house. she sells different goods, including dairy products, cold meats, chicken, oil, butter, bread, sweets, and more.

maria is applying for a loan of 21,000 lempira in order to buy staple goods, such as rice, beans, cornflour, chicken, bread, cleaning products, and other groceries to stock up her business. this loan will help maria to buy more stock and thereby attract more customers.

maria's goal is to increase her income, expand her premises, and increase the stock that she offers to her customers.

i am the group leader anila m. of three other women: saima m. who is borrowing for her husband who sells perfumes. bano i. sells cloth. rani b.’s husband wants to buy a new rickshaw.  \r\ni am 36 and a mother of six: three daughters and three boys. all my kids attend school except the elder two who are done with their studies. my husband works at a local company for meager income and i run a beauty salon. my salon has a strong client base and generates decent profits. earlier as well i have invested in a successful loan in my business, which served to increase my profits. with these increased profits i bought a fridge and tv for my house.

juana rafaela a. is 61 years old and she lives in the acahualinca region of the capital city of managua. she is married and has eight grown children. her husband is a taxi driver and her business is selling second hand clothing. she has been selling for fourty years, a business she started with her own savings. she sees a need to invest further. this loan will be used to purchase construction materials to finish building her humble home so that she might have a dignified home. her plans are to keep purchasing packages of clothing to provide her clients with the variety of clothing they seek at a good price.

\r\n\r\n

translated from spanish by erika lindig, kiva volunteer

mulinge is a widow with one child who has finished school. she lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

she has operated a beauty salon for the past three years.  her clients are the local community residents. she faces a major challenge of a lack of customers. she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

with the kshs10,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for her salon. she decided to join yehu because of easily accessed loans.

julita works hard to support her family. julita is married and has a pig-fattening business in the philippines.

julita requested a php 10,500 loan through nwtf to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

julita has been in this business for five years now.

julita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

victoria is a maize farmer and babban gona member. anticipating a good harvest this season, victoria has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 mt/ha, 5.5 times that of the average nigerian maize farmer. before joining babban gona, victoria would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. with the help of this loan, victoria can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. as a babban gona member, victoria will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. victoria is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to build a better house for her family.

sajeela is 43 years old, hardworking, and the mother of two children. she is a seamstress who makes clothing for her neighbors and is quite popular because of her many skills. her work brought her family out of a financial crisis that they faced, and she now has a good, established clientele. sajeela has requested a loan for 50,000 pkr to buy a new sewing machine, spools of thread, and lace to make more clothing for her customers. her goal is to save money so her family can have a prosperous future.

then’s group lives in a rural village in kompong cham province in cambodia. then makes a living cultivating rice and she works as a construction worker to support her family. in her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help then safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

sindiso is a 20-year-old business woman who lives in lupane district, zimbabwe. \r\n\r\nsindiso sells clothes at a flea market stall in her district. in addition, she volunteers as a community health activist and a camfed learner guide. with the requested loan from kiva, sindiso intends to purchase bulk quantities of clothing so that she can increase her sales and profits. with the increased profits, sindiso would like to pay her siblings' school fees.

mercidita is 42 years old and married with two children.

she earns a living by raising pigs in the philippines. mercidita is borrowing 15,000 php through nwtf to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. mercidita has been doing this work for 10 years now.

she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

mrs ly n. is a widow of 46 years old. she lives in phnom penh and has four children. she earns 2 dollars a day and has to take care of her children alone. she would like to purchase a motorbike to go to work because her workplace is far from her house and it is expensive to go there everyday.

kubra is 55 years old, married and the mother of seven children. she lives with her family in lahore.

kubra’s daughter runs a beauty parlor in her community. with ten years of experience in this field, her daughter is known for her quality services. she offers services such as haircuts, coloring and styling, facials and makeup. she is skilled and talented and has made many loyal customers.

currently kubra’s daughter wants to attract more customers and make sure she retains her existing clientele. she would like to add supplies to her beauty parlor such as creams, bleaches, dyes, makeup kits, a hair dryer, manicure pedicure kits, a warmer, etc. to help her with this, kubra has requested a 50,000 pkr loan from brac pakistan to do so.

wilfredo is in a relationship, and his partner is a homemaker. they have three children, who are going to school. wilfredo has been selling watches for more than six years. he works every day from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm. he will use the financing to purchase more watches to continue selling. wilfredo's dream is that his business becomes bigger and that he has fixed location to make sales since he now does it by traveling.

petronila, aged 46, is married to richard. they are blessed with four children: aged between four and 22 years. she operates a salon and beauty shop which has been in operation for eleven years. she earns a monthly income of kes40,000.\r\n\r\nthis is her first loan with kadet ltd. she will use the loan to buy hair and beauty products for her shop and salon. petronila will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her daughter, who is in the university. she hopes to start selling second hand clothes in the near future.

letecia works hard to support her family. she is married and has a bamboo weaving business in the philippines. she has requested a php 15,000 loan through nwtf to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

letecia has been in this business for three years now. in the future, letecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

julita is 68 years old and married with five children.

she earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the philippines. julita is borrowing php 12000 through nwtf to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

julita has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetable.

she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

mavjuda was born in the year 1975. she is a very hardworking and industrious woman. mavjuda is not married and has not got any children. for many years she has worked in a kindergarden. she is a cleaning woman. mavjuda does her job well. 

she has a small salary and it is not enough to have a good living standard. now she needs financial support because she must treat her teeth. she has suffered from toothache for the last month. 

she is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to treat her teeth. she awaits your mercy.

madame b. mansah was born december 31, 1966 at gape-centre. she is the manager of "foufou bar" across from the market of gape-centre. she is married and mother of six children. she wishes to refurbish her building and restauraunt in order to satisy client demands which have grown incessantly, and to do this she is asking for a loan of $700.00. she is loyal and honest in her re-payments. she deserves our encouragement as well as financial support.

translated from french by kiva volunteer, kristin connor.

madame b. mansah est née le 31 décembre 1966 à gapé-centre. elle est tenancière de « foufou bar » en face du marché de gapé-centre. elle est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. afin d’aménager son local et son restaurant afin de satisfaire les besoins sans cesse croissant de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de $700. elle est très dévouée et honnête en matière de remboursements. elle mérite donc nos encouragements et surtout un appui financier.

gladys p. is 50 years old.  she is a married mother of nine children.  according to her, her last two children are still in school – junior high school. the rest are out of school and running their own businesses. she lives with some of her children in a family house in nkawkaw, in the eastern region of ghana. 

she says though her husband is employed, she still needs to work hard to help herself.

gladys deals in smoked and fried fish.  she procures smoked fish all the way from yeji in the north.  she sells to retailers in her community. gladys has been in business since her youthful days.  she wants a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk.  gladys also deals in second hand clothes.  she aspires to give her last two children the best education.

adarna is 47 years old, married with seven children, four of whom in school.

she works hard to provide for her family. she runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 18000 loan through nwtf to buy more stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, etc.

adarna has borrowed and paid 10 loans from nwtf before this loan. she has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buy and sell fish.

she aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

song c. is married and lives with her husband in takeo province, cambodia, an area known for its pre-angkorean temples. c. is a weaver, earning an income of usd $2.5 per day. her husband is employed at a construction material factory, earning an income of usd $2.5 per day. each month, the family has to spend usd $20 on food and usd $50 on other necessary expenses. c. is requesting a loan of usd $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. in the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. this will be her second loan from credit, a longstanding kiva partner.

yonnis is 38 years old and owns a store located south west of the city, where he lives with his wife and their 3 children, ages 6 through 17. he has 4 years experience in running stores but it was just in 2010 that he began his own store, investing little by little and generating more income each day. initially, he sold products brought from a neighboring country which he distributed among many businesses and families in the surrounding areas.

at present, yonnis is beginning to sell groceries daily in quantities adjusted to what his clientele can pay, creating a good commercial opportunity. he purchases groceries and meats from the storehouses of ranches, and sells them in his store. these articles are the items most in demand in his store. he sells 80 % for cash and 20 % for credit, between the hours of 6:00 am and 10:00 pm, monday through sunday.  his principal customers are residents of the barrio, especially women, who daily carry home the purchases of the day, obtained from yonnis' store, to prepare meals for their families.

yonnis' goal is to increase sales, but his major challenge is to obtain sufficient working capital to achieve that. that is why he is presently applying for a kiva loan, his first financing through the fundacion mario santo domingo, to purchase a larger volume of groceries, soft drinks, liquors, and meals, in order to obtain discounts and diminish transportation costs. the frequency with which, until recently, he has been forced to make purchases, made his expenses higher. with this kiva loan, he will buy in larger volume and reduce the  frequency of purchases. this is what will make his present investment more successful.

helen is 36 years old and married with four children.

she earns a living by pig fattening in the philippines. helen is borrowing php 29,000 through nwtf to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

helen has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from food-vending and a general store.

she successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

alexandra candelaria is 34 and lives with her husband and children in cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

the members of the communal bank v.r.c. luchando por una misma causa  ("fighting for the same cause") reside in recinto la primavera, which is in cantón ventanas.  in this area the main economic activity is farming, specifically the short-season crops of corn and rice.

alexandra candelaria is a farmer and grows corn, rice and beans.  she buys her products in ventanas.

she is seeking this loan in order to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, fertilizer and other supplies.  with the help of this loan she will be able to buy the fertilizer she needs in order to be able to obtain good harvests.  her dream is to be able to grow cacao in large quantities.

she enjoys doing the cleaning and washing at home.

johnny o. is from barangay tucal, solano, nueva vizcaya. he is 37 years old, is married, and has two infant children. johnny owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. he has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 php a month. in 2009, johnny joined aski to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. he has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 php from aski. this previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. johnny is requesting a new loan of 10,000 php which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. this loan will be his second from aski. he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. about aski: aski is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the philippines. it has twenty-one branches covering the central and northeastern areas. its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva. given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

djaraba, who is sitting on the far left of the photo and wearing a two-tone black and yellow turban, is a member of a group of four farmers who live and work in the village of fogoba, which lies south east of bamako in mali. djaraba, who is 75 years old, lives in a family of 20 people. farming enables him to provide for his family's food. he decided to join myagro so he can master the new production techniques. in his first year with myagro, he has bought a packet of opv seeds and fertliser for growing corn in his 0.5 hectare field. through this purchase, diaraba hopes to be able to improve his yield so he can build houses for his children and pay for weddings as well as developing the village.

félix is a hard-working woman who struggles daily to maintain an income through the sale of live pigs and their products. as she's a widow, she has no-one supporting her financially. \r\n\r\nfélix has ideas for improvement such as, for example, her future goal which is to set up a canteen to sell food in the evenings and also set up a car wash with the support of her son; this will allow her to increase her income. she has maintained the business thanks to the support of the loans which she is again asking for, this time to buy two live pigs for her business.

ms. ghulamfiza is a passionate woman and doing a work of boutique and embroidery for the last four years. she has been working night and day making elegant dresses for woman in her community. her collection is very famous in her town. she offers a variety of clothes in different colors to her customers and makes enough money to lead a decent life.

she is a loving mother of three daughters and two sons. she is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. she has steadily improved her business by taking loans from the kashf foundation. now she has requested a loan of rs 40,000/- to buy a stock of more cloth of different colors in various designs and lace, thread and machines. she hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

lucila, 73, is a single mother; she has nine adult children and lives in the municipality of san antonio de cortes with one of her children.  she has her own business selling bags of ice, blended drinks and food like little cakes, tamales and others.

lucila is requesting her fifth loan for 7,000 lempiras that she’ll use to buy ingredients for her food preparation and for the ice sales.  her plan is to continue working with loans and to be able to get some things needed at home.

erlinda b. is from the village of mararigue. she is 52 years old. erlinda is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by aski. while each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. the official name of this borrowing group is erlinda's group.

erlinda is married and has two school-aged children. to make a living, erlinda owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 8,000 php a month for these activities.

in 2006, erlinda joined aski to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 php from aski. this previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. erlinda is requesting a new loan of 28,000 php, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. this loan will be the sixth loan taken out by erlinda from aski. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

about aski:

aski is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the philippines. it has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

lilibeth b. is from the village of eastern wao, lanao del sur. she is 35 years old. lilibeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. to make a living, lilibeth owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. while not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 php a month for these activities.

in 2009, lilibeth joined hspfi to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 php from hspfi. this previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 php, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. this loan will be the 6th loan taken out by lilibeth from hspfi. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

about hspfi:

hspfi is one of the accredited partners of opportunity international in the philippines. it is based in cagayan de oro city and is reaching out to the poor households of northern mindanao.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva. given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

emily is 55 years old, married and has one child.

emily is in the agricultural business of fattening pigs in the philippines. she requested a 15,000 php loan through nwtf to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

emily has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

in the future, emily would like to save money to expand her business.

teresita is a 41-year-old married woman living in enrile with her only child. her spouse works abroad. she established a small store to add to her spouse's income. she has been running her store for three years now. 

she would like to offer more products so she is borrowing a loan for p10,000 to buy bottled beverages, eggs and noodles to sell in her store.

teresita would like to provide a good education for her child, as the only legacy she can pass on to her.

sama, who is sitting in the middle of the photo and wearing a black scarf, is a member of a group of 12 farmers who live and work in the village of kouri in mali. sama is 59 years old and lives in a family of 60, four of whom are children. she became a farmer because she liked it and wanted to be able to feed her family independently. as a farmer she has to deal with difficulties such as the lack of farming equipment, quality fertilizers, rain and farming land.

sama rejoined myagro because of its payment system and farming techniques, as well as the agent's courage and myagro's reputation. in her second year with myagro, she has bought fertlizers to grow groundnut and gombo on her plot of 1/8th of a hectare. through this purchase sama hopes to be able to increase her returns so she can raise sheep and provide for her children's food and school fees.

jenalyn, a resident of sta. maria, is 39 years old with four children. she is in produce business where she has been selling products like pots for the last three years. the idea of starting the business was to get income to pay school fees for her kids.


thanks to aski and kiva, the previous loans helped her to have additional income and pay school dues for her children. jenalyn again requests another loan amounting php 11,000 to buy raw materials for her business.

rose is married with seven children, five of which go to school. she also takes care of additional family members (grand children). she has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. she has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 uganda shillings from mcdt sacco of buy more bags of charcoal. she generates additional income from a food stall, a bar and also selling firewood. she works from her home seven days a week. her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. she aspires to own a delivery van to ease in transportation, and hopes to build rental rooms. she resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. her monthly expenses include paying for electricity and water, school fees and feeding her family.\r\n

the communal loan group "esperanza y progreso" meets every fifteen days in the cantón of montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its craft items, which are recognized on an international level. it's also the home of the famous palm straw hats ["panama" hats]. 

this is where monserrate lives. she is 52 years old, married, and has three grown children. the youngest is studying in the university. two of their children live with them at home. her husband is a master bricklayer.

monserrate is a very determined woman who likes to work hard to get ahead. she takes in washing, but she also works in commerce. she sells all kinds of clothing, usually door to door. she does her route on the weekends and also sells in her house. she sells to her customers on credit and charges every eight days. she has been in this business for three years and through it she has been able to help her daughter continue with her studies.

she will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. this member is a founder of the the communal loan group and she likes it because the loans are very helpfu. her dream is to continue working.

eugenio is married and has seven children. he is 58 years of age, and he lives in canibungan, clarin, misamis occidental. he raises bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. each month, he earns about php 10,000 doing this type of work. he has requested a loan of php 10,000 to purchase fertilizers for his farm. eugenio been a member of gdmpc since 2008. in the future, he hopes to improve his business so that he can give a brighter future to his children.

ma'ruf is 54 years old. he is a resident of the city of istaravshan. he is not only a caring father, but also a loving grandfather. ma'ruf's family is close and he is very happy that he has such a wonderful and large family. for over 20 years, ma'ruf has been doing the work he loves. he is a taxi driver and he transports passengers. recently, ma'ruf went to the doctor because his health was declining and he needs immediate medical treatment. ma'ruf has decided to apply for a loan to buy medicine as he is not in a position to buy it himself. this medicine is expensive. ma'ruf needs to improve his health as he wants to work to support his family. he is grateful to you in advance. \r\n\r\n

elizabeth b. is a lady who cooks and sells a favourite dish of ghanaian society.  this dish, kenkey (dokono), is not often prepared in homes. she is currently engaged in this on a very small scale but wishes to expand due to the high demand. she is therefore seeking a loan of $725.00 from kiva to enable her do this. she is very hardworking and can pay back the loan.

judith is 51 years old and she has three children. she is married and has one child who is still in school.

judith is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the philippines. judith requested a php 16,000 loan through negros women for tomorrow foundation, inc. (nwtf) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

judith has been in pig-fattening for ten years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from nwtf to sustain her business.

judith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

a windowed mother of one dependent child, aged 38 years old, lives in battambang province. nowadays, ly grows cassava as her single main source of income to improve her living condition. she has involved her business for 10 years and she can save her daily income about 37,900khr per day. lacking of working capital of operating her cassava is the main challenge. \r\n\r\nfor ly, this is her first time with visionfund (kiva’s partner). as the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to support her cassava to produce more yields. she hopes that her cassava can gain higher yields with good income to upgrade her lifestyle.

aljon is 20 years old, single, and lives with his family and siblings in gata daku, clarin. aljon has owned and operated a transport service for a couple of years to earn a living. he has supported the family's daily needs with this income besides working in a private company. after his work, he does transportation services.

recently, he took a new loan of php15,000 to buy tires and repair his motorcycle to commute between his work and other villages. he plans to buy a sidecar for his motor for expansion of his business in the near future.

issifou is a 29-year-old man.  he is married to a retailer and has one child.  he has been working as a retailer since 2006.  he sells tires, rims, and nuts to customers in akodessewa.  he buys his products in the autonomous port of lomé, and works alone.  at the moment, issifou's main difficulty is in meeting all the demand.  issifou requested his first loan through wages in order to buy tires, rims, and nuts.  he wants to reinvest in his business.  in the next few years, issifou would like to expand his business.  he says that with the profits he plans to ensure a bright future for his family.

mrs. elizabeth g. is 42 years old and lives in the san caralampio neighborhood of la concepción. she lives with her husband who helps her with household expenses. her children are all married and living on their own. the plans for her family are to improve the standard of living so that in the future they can enjoy their efforts from twenty years of work in agriculture. she started with help from her parents. mrs. elizabeth's dream is to have 1.75 acres more of pineapples to have more income. she hopes to manage this with the loan she has requested. this is her fourth request at afodenic, which is very beneficial to her family, having financial support with a feasible payment for them.

translated from spanish by susan haynes, kiva volunteer

carmen is very experienced in the tailoring business, she has a sewing shop in her home and has been doing outsourced work for 25 years. she works all day long, and she would like to offer work in her shop to people who need it.

she learned this work from her mother, who taught her from a very young age. the advantage is that she is already recognized in the sector and the quality of her products is very good, which has allowed her to attract ever more clients as well as to receive good orders.

currently, her production level does not meet the demand from all her clients. she is therefore requesting a loan to buy fabric, threads, buttons, and more to increase the production capacity.
