she has applied for a loan from kiva partner asasah to improve her husband’s business. he will use the loan money to purchase iron and other required materials in larger quantities to make a larger number of iron boxes. this will help him fulfill orders on time and make more profit. kaneez is confident that an investment in her husband’s business will be a good step towards its growth and her family will be able to have a better standard of life as a result. she is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to asasah. 

note: “in the photo, the lady with a book (called asasah passbook) is kaneez”.

mwanaidi is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. she lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. her greatest monthly expense is food.

for the past three years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. she faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

with the loan that she is requesting of kes 15,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

janvier niyibizi has been our client since 2011. he is married and has four children, ages 1 to 7. his place of birth is bugesera, in rwanda. he is a member of the solidarity group called twunganirane dusabirana. \xa0his retail business involves farm products (beans, sorghum, goats...), and his loan is for buying his supplies. janvier wants to increase his capital to improve his commerce. his ambition and vision is to raise his children well and to do some good for his family.\r\n\r\n

this communal bank has 3 members. the coordinator is rafaela who is 50 years old and single. she buys and sells footwear. she started this business 20 years ago. her son helps her with her sales. the loan will be invested in her business buying sandals and shoes for women, children and men. she wants to be able cover the demand from her clients.

the other members of the group are heydi, who is 24 years old and sells fruit drinks and ice cream at her house and martín who is 56 years old and sells clothing in streets of masaya and diriamba and around his community.

rosario is married with three children. rosario is 55 years old and lives in napurog, tudela.

rosario is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetables to earn a living. rosario has been doing this for 10 years. rosario has requested a loan of 10,000 php to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops.

rosario has been a member of pmpc for 11 years. in the future, rosario hopes to expand her business.

this is yolanda. her previous loan was a big help in her business. she was able to buy all the needed products for her variety store. her store is in their house and it has been running for three years now. as a widow, she works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. 

she would like to apply for another 8,000 php loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. the more items displayed at the store the better. more items to sell will result in better profit. her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. she looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

yolanda hopes that her business will grow and expand even more. she dreams of being rich. she faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their life and businesses every week. she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of god she studies.

* all cct community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. a fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. the fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of god, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

john is a married man. he has one child. he describes himself to be responsible. he operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. he has been involved in this business for four years. his business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. he describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

he will use the kes 50,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. he hopes that in the future, he will be successful. this is his second loan with smep microfinance bank. the previous loan was repaid successfully.

emelinda previously accessed a 10,000 php loan that she used to purchase candy, calamine, pepper, garlic, plastic and other products to continue her business. her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

she would like to apply for another 10,000 php loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. the more items displayed at the store, the better. more items to sell will result in a better profit. her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. she looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

emelinda dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a better living. she meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of god. 

* all cct community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. a fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of god, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

maribel is 43 years old and married with two children.

maribel works hard to provide for her family. she runs a food vending in the philippines and requested a php 5000 loan through nwtf to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

maribel has borrowed and paid 6 loans from nwtf before this loan. she has been running the food vending for 14 years and also earns an income from general store.

maribel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

rosemary is 48 years old, married, and she and her husband have  five children. she is a fruit seller  which she has been doing for the last five  years. 


she learned about kadet ltd through marketing done by the kadet staff. she is a good client and this is her 1st loan which she is planning to use to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale. she hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest back into her business.

her hope and dream is to become a great business lady. she is a vigorous woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

a loan of rp 10,000,000 helps lusia to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community.  

lusia’s parents are farmers. as a child she dreamed to be a teacher but got married young so only completed high school.  she has two children and her husband works in construction. her first job was working in a private business at 22 years old.

to increase her income, lusia has joined kopernik’s tech kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. she will use the loan to buy stock and grow her income to pay for her children’s education.  she is excited about kopernik’s training program to learn about these new technologies, promote them to customers and improve her general business skills.

rustamjon is married with two children. he sells men’s clothing in the local central market of his region. this market is always busy with clients. he offers a nice selection of merchandise for sale and arranges it beautifully in his kiosk, which attracts many potential customers. he has been in this trade for many years.

rustamjon is requesting a loan of $2500 to increase the range of goods for selling. one of his business plans is to open a second vending facility and hire a sales person to work as a market vendor in the same market. with increased sales and profits, rustamjon will be able to open an additional vending facility and improve his family's standard of living.  

                                                                  
more about tajikistan and imon international

tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the silk road and the end of alexander the great's rule. it has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including rudaki, avicenna, ferdowsi, omar khayyam, jomi, and rumi. the country is home to communities that still speak the ancient sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium bc. and, even today, it is a complex mixture of the islamic faith, soviet culture, new west culture and central asian traditions.

but tajikistan is also the poorest of the former soviet republics. the civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the u.s.s.r., further damaged the already weak economy. in addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. these conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly russia. while the people of tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

imon's history

since december 2007, imon international has worked closely with kiva and kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. funds raised through kiva have already been distributed to thousands of imon international's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. to learn more about imon international's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

mrs. carmen c. is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two young children. she works as an assistant in a small business and her husband helps out driving his very own taxi cab, which they bought many years ago with some savings. carmen's house was affected by the 2007 earthquake and they have been re-building it little by little ever since. right now, they have to add a roof to the already built area, and to finish this construction, they need help. carmen and her husband are hardworking people who try to invest in the betterment of their and their kids' lives. their dream is to completely finish building their home. they are grateful for the support we can provide.

translated from spanish by violeta rubiani, kiva volunteer
ricardo is a responsible father from liloy. he is a new pensioner member of pmpc and has requested a loan to pay for labor cost and purchase housing materials for his house renovation.

melanie is a married woman and a mother of three young children from ubay, bohol. she has a business growing different kinds of crops like rice and bananas. her husband works as a fisherman.

melanie needs a loan to buy fuel for her boat and fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. 

in the future, melanie wants to expand her family's businesses and save money for the schooling of her children.

here is a 41-year-old mother who lives in a rural village in the ek phnom district of battambang province with two children, one of whom is still in school and relies on her. here sells cassava and corn as a main source of her family’s income. the current business, which she has been doing for 21 years, returns about 66,700khr per day and she can manage to save only 15,000khr after daily expenses.

this is the first cycle for here with visionfund (kiva’s partner).  she is seeking a loan of 800,000khr while her joint group member is requesting  1,000,000khr. 

as the leader, she will use this loan to buy cassava and corn to sell.  she hopes to increase her income to make a better living, and keep her children in school.

salimata is from mali and is illiterate. she is aged 46, married and a mother of 6 children aged from 16 to 28 years old, two girls and 4 boys. two of the boys are going to school. salimata is the one with her hand raised in the group photo.

salimata has turned to rmcr for a loan to develop her business of raising sheep. she has been raising sheep and doing a millet trade for 25 years. she gets her supplies in her locality and resells in the same place and often outside mali. her partner also does livestock trade between mali, burkina-faso and ivory coast.

this activity allows her to get a profit of 32,500 xof twice a month to fulfil her needs, those of her children and those of the family.

she is inspired for the future to give good help to her children to pay their schooling and provide clothing for her children.

saima is a 39 years old, widow, with 4 children. she is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. she buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. she has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

she has requested for a loan of 40000 pkr to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. she hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. saima expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

charlita is from mohon, panaon, misamis occidental. she is 55 years old. charlita is married and has 5 children.

to make a living, charlita owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. charlita sell it by door to door basis to her "suki" buyer. charlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 php a month from these activities.

charlita is requesting a loan of 4,000 php, which will be used to purchase raw materials in making "puto". puto is the classic steamed filipino rice cake shaped like an american muffin. its texture is spongy and slightly fluffy. puto is traditionally white, but can be colored pink, yellow, purple, even green. there are many regional variations of puto.
in 2010, charlita joined gdmpc. she plans to use the income generated to expand her business and portion of it will be save for her future.

this group is made up of two members, evelyn and grace. they have been together from 2011 to date. 

evelyn is a 49-year-old, single parent. she has been with id ghana for the past one year and is doing very well with her business and family. she has been a hairdresser for seven years. she used to do her business in the house from mondays through saturdays, but with consistent savings with id ghana, she was able to raise enough money to build a store, where she now serves her customers. she is grateful to id ghana for the training on savings, which motivated her to save to achieve her dream. 

this is evelyn's third loan, and she needed ghs 750 to buy more creams, shampoos, and wigs to sell to her customers. she has been able to educate her child to the senior high school level, with her profits from the business. 

evelyn and grace need a total amount of ghs 1,500 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

heth is residing in the tbaung khmum district of kampong cham province. she is a 32-year-old farmer who plants cassava to sell to earn a living. as a mother of two dependent children, heth has been occupied in the agribusiness for about 10 years already. the average income for the whole family is only 31,800 khr per day. 

she leads a group of two members to request a microloan from kiva’s partner, visionfund. the total loan amount is 2,800,000 khr, which will be divided into equal shares for heth and her partner of 1,400,000 khr each. heth will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and cassava trees to plant. she strongly believes that the loan will enable her to earn a better income to support the family and put her children in school.

dennis, a married man with four children, comes from fort portal, uganda. being a farmer, his family members inspired him to start up another income generating activity of a retail shop, and the fact that he had his wife to be in charge of it. the shop eventually has grown, having been in operation for two years, supporting them to meet the obligations of looking after their family.

the use of fake notes by some clients has been a challenge leading to big losses. he has a dream of buying land to construct his own house; hence he is requesting a loan facility to finish payment of land.

abalo m. has requested a loan of 500,000 cfa to purchase 17 sacks of corn for his cereal selling business. he has worked selling corn and other grains for about 11 years. abalo is 44 years old and married to another entrepreneur. he and his wife have four children. this is his first microloan from wages.

betty is a hardworking, married lady with four children living in fort portal, uganda. she is a farmer and at the same time earns salary from the local government. she is faced with a challenge of bad weather that destroys her banana plantation, especially heavy rains characterized by heavy winds. 

besides that, she is working hard to make sure all her children obtain education. betty needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

born in amou-oblo on december 31, 1966, ms. dodjiko m. is a widow with two children living in lomé. she is a dressmaker in agoè, a district in lomé, where she currently lives. she has always made custom clothing. when her husband passed away and she had to manage the household expenses on her own, she had the idea of making clothes with the traditional fabric that she would buy at the market in lomé. she sells the clothing at the market or in her workshop where she puts them on display. she is taking out the second loan to buy 20 pieces of fabric because these clothes are very valued and demand for them has increased.

translated from french by lucia franzese, kiva volunteer.

née à amou-oblo le 31 décembre 1966, madame m. dodjiko, veuve avec deux enfants à la charge vit à la lomé. elle est couturière à agoè, un quartier de lomé où elle vit. elle a toujours confectionné les vêtements sur commande. mais à la mort de son mari où elle doit faire face seule aux charges de sa famille, elle a eu l’idée de confectionner des habits avec des tissus pagnes qu’elle achète au grand marché de lomé. elle les revend ensuite dans son atelier où elle fait une exposition, et au grand marché. elle avait pris un premier crédit qui l’a aidé dans son innovation. elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes car ses vêtements sont très appréciés et la demande a augmentée

luz is 58 years old, her husband passed away several years ago. they had 4 children who are all now adults and live independently. she lives in portoviejo, a city that is rich in vegetables and tropical fruits that are sold within the country.
thanks to the loans she has received from the group, luz continues with her business. she sells clothing. she rents a location in the center of the city, where she works every day from 9:00am to 5:30pm. she has had this business for 5 years, which she has been able to continue to run thanks to the loans that have helped her in moments that she could not continue. thanks to the loans, she was able to continue her business and thus continue to earn a living.
this loan is to buy pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothes and many other items.
her dream is to have a boutique and her own location.

with two school-aged children to support and the obligation to provide for her home, mrs. dalia p. works hard to improve the living conditions of her children and she does this through improving her home. her home is suffering from weather damage and is in danger of being further damaged. therefore she has decided to make home repairs and she is seeking a loan from ceprodel for the money to buy construction materials. with this loan she and her children will benefit, and she needs it immediately so she can make her improvements to her home in masaya city.

translated from spanish by cindy kendall, kiva volunteer

ana is a 45 year old woman. she lives in the city of ica in the district of santiago with her 6 children. unfortunately, for various reasons, she has been separated from her husband for some years. since then, she has put all her effort into bringing up her family. she is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because she needed to work, she was not able to take the secretariat course that she wanted to, but she would very much liked to have done so. in her free time, she likes to watch the news and educational programs on tv and sometimes she cooks a delicious patasca stew to share with her family. 
with much persistence and dedication, ana was able to start her small business selling food. she sells breakfast, sandwiches, sodas, and other things. every day, she starts work in the early hours of the morning and works for about 10 hours and believes that things are going well due to her good flavors, dedication, and the kind treatment that she offers to her customers.
ana is very grateful to the kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have offered, she will be able to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, potatoes, drinks, packaging, and disposable table wares. in this way, ana will secure the supplies that she needs to continue working and she hopes to increase her sales and grow her income. this will help her a lot so that, in the not too distant future, she can grow her business and build her house and so offer a better standard of living to her family.

mylene is married, the mother of one child, and works hard to support her family by buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the philippines. she has requested a loan for php 10,000 from nwtf to buy more items to sell, such as dresses, shorts, pants, and socks. mylene has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income by providing tailoring services. in the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

ivonne de los ángeles c. v. is single and has three school-aged children. her last year of studies was the fifth grade. she runs a general store, and tells us that she has enjoyed working since a young age. for a time in her life, she decided to travel overseas. upon her return, and with the money she was able to save, she obtained her business in chinandega. she started her store upon the birth of her first child. she was quite young and her husband was out of work. she invested the money she earned abroad in the implementation of her store.

this young lady has worked with ceprodel for four years, and she feels very gratified with the 21 loans that have been granted to her. they have helped her stock her store and improve her quality of life.

translated from spanish by mary lynn, kiva volunteer.

ivonne de los ángeles c. v. , soltera, tiene tres hijos los tres están el periodo escolar, el ultimo año que cursó ella fue el quinto año de secundaria, el negocio de esta señora es una pulpería, nos dice que desde joven le ha gustado trabajar, tanto así que en un momento de su vida decidió viajar al extranjero, después regresó y con el dinero que logró ahorrar obtuvo este negocio de pulpería en chinandega. el negocio lo comienza cuando nace su primer hijo, ella era muy joven y su esposo estaba sin trabajo entonces con el dinero que ella recopiló en el exterior lo invierte en la implementación de la pequeña pulpería.

esta joven señora trabaja con ceprodel desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los 21 créditos otorgados que los utiliza para suplir el negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

kadiatu s. is 38 years and married with 6 children. she has been running her bakery business for 17 years on a very small scale. she was renting the bakery from other bakers but after her third loan, s. built a small bakery within her home. she does her housework in addition to the business, and it is really hard. with no one to assist her, she could not increase production. she would like to expand her business and hire 2 workers to assist her in the production. kadiatu is therefore requesting a $375 loan.

inda has big plans for her family and wants to improve their living condition. as a microfinance member of paglaum mpc, she availed herself of a loan to purchase housing materials such as sand, cement and galvanized sheet metal for house repair. in the future, she plans to begin constructing the fence of her house.

edna is 42 years old and married with four children.  she earns a living by farming peanut and corn in the philippines.  edna is borrowing 13,000 php through nwtf to buy seeds, fertilizers, and farm equipment.  edna has been farming peanut and corn for 2 years and has been earning additional income from raising pigs.  she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.\r\n

nancy is 60 years old and lives in the municipality of los palmitos. she’s a happily married woman who works making and selling food, but her specialty is frappes, which she sells a lot to children when they leave school, and she just started it this same year.

she dreams of living in her own house and she’s working hard so she can buy her own soon and because she wants her family to live more comfortably. she wants to increase the profits so she can make more money.

she’s asking for a loan to buy a cooler and supplies to prepare the food and the frappes.

support this talented woman and loan now.

if you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from interactuar, you can join the lending team called: “friends of interactuar colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

amelia is 41 years old and married with two children. she is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the philippines.

amelia requested a php 25,000 loan through nwtf to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. she has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from nwtf and more recently, from kiva to sustain it.

she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

juditha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the philippines. 

she is borrowing 29,500 php through nwtf to purchase materials to repair her fishing boat for her fishing business. juditha has been in this business for 5 years. she earns additional income from a general store.

juditha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from nwtf.  she dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to expand her business in the future.

josephine is 55 years old. she has one child and one adult dependent.  she has been running her hair salon for the last 4 years. she currently makes a estimated monthly income of kes.20,791.\r\n\r\njosephine would like to get a loan of kes.20,000 that she will use to buy beauty products like shampoo, hair oils, hair treatments, and hair conditioners to best serve her clients. in the future, josephine dreams of having a successful business where she becomes the most preferred hair dresser in her town.

genesa is a 47-year-old woman who hails from maribojoc, bohol. she runs a sari-sari (variety) store. her business started 6 years ago.

she is asking for a loan to buy additional stock for the store like noodles, soda, canned goods, candies and toiletries to attract customers and increase her sales. 

in the future, genesa hopes to expand her business to improve her livelihood status.

noli christopher v. and his wife are striving hard to overcome the hardships and difficulties in life. noli is engaged in selling different scrap materials like plastic bottles, old newspapers, metals, plastics and other recyclable materials.

on the other hand, his wife sells different food snacks like rice cake, pancit (noodles), banana and camote cue (fried potato with sugar).

as fruit of their patience and sacrifice, they can earn a net income of 1000 php a week which they use for their daily needs and to save for the future of their two year old son. they want him to be successful someday in his chosen profession and have a bright future.

in this regard, they want to improve their small business to earn a higher income. due to lack of financial capital, noli is now asking to borrow a loan from kiva lenders amounting to 8000 php to improve their small business.

they hope that lenders will grant their request so they can have a stable source of income.

karen is married with 4 children. she is 48 years old and lives in mailen, clarin misamis occidental, philippines. karen owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. she has been in this business for 5 years and earns 9,000 php each month. she requested a loan of 15,000 php to purchase farm chemicals. karen is a new member of kiva's partner, gdmpc. in the future, karen's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.\r\n

anita is 50 years old and married with eight children. she works hard to provide for her family. she runs a business directly selling a personal collection in the philippines. she has requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to purchase more stock of personal products to sell.

anita has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from nwtf before this loan. she has been running the business selling the personal collection for five years, and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. anita aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

this group is made up of three enterprising partners. it is lead by marya. she is 31 years old, married, and her business of eight years is the sale of new clothes in her community. 

she asks for a loan for the purchase of kahlua jeans, big time jeans, t-shirts, sports shirts, halter tops, boxer shorts, ankle bracelets, dresses, skirts, etc. with her earlier loans, marya has managed to get ahead beacuse the has an income and contributes to the household expenses.

the other partners are manuel, who is 52 years old, has a grocery store at his home and asks for a loan to buy bulk grains, and juan rafael, who is 36 years old, makes artisan baskets and asks for a loan to buy bamboo sticks.

sophea was born in 1967. she lives with her husband and 4 children in khan chroy changva, phnom penh. she has worked as a weaver for 15 years, and her husband has been a security guard for 5 years.

sophea wishes to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work and for her family to use to reduce traveling expenses. unfortunately, sophea cannot purchase the motorbike due to lack of funds.

after discussing the matter with her family, she has decided to apply for a loan from maxima microfinance.

zulma is 29 years old. she has not received an education. she is a single mother as her husband died seven years ago. she lives with her three children aged 8, 10 and 13. her children currently go to school.

zulma earns a living selling fish. she started this business 5 years ago due to the lack of financial income that she was experiencing at the time as, sadly, her husband died and it was difficult for her to support her children alone. she also works at producing staple grains for the family to eat.

she needs this loan to buy a cooler where she can keep her fish fresh to sell.

zulma's dream is that her children can keep studying and she works hard to be able to achieve this dream.

charles is a married man. he has two children. he describes himself to be honest. he operates a retail business where he sells phone accessories and also offers m-pesa services. he has been involved in this business for four years. his business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. he will use the kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of phone accessories. his business goal is to open another outlet within five years. he hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. this is his first loan with smep microfinance bank.

myrna is 50 years old and has seven children. myrna is married, and six of her children are still in school.

myrna is in the agricultural business of raising chickens in the philippines. myrna requested a php 13,000 loan through nwtf to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

myrna has been raising chickens for 17 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

in the future, myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

rubina is a 39-year-old married woman, shown in the photo with her husband. she has four children.

she is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. she buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells it to the people of her community. she has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

now she has requested a murabaha loan of 25,000 pkr to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. she hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

rubina expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

milagros in very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her.  she was able to buy spare parts for her tricycle and have it repaired and maintained as well.  her income from business is helpful in her everyday expenses at home.  she also sells some snacks for additional income.

she would like to apply for another 20,000 php loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.  her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs.  she looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

milagros hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to have a good life.  she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  at that time, she also draw strength and inspiration from the word of god she studies.

* all cct community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  a fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  the fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of god, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

purificacion works hard to support two children. she is married and has a fishing business in the philippines.

she requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

purificacion is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.

maruush is a 57 year old man who lives with his wife and 2 daughters in bayanhongor province in southern mongolia. his wife is a retiree. he started a food market business in 1992. then he started a flour business. but since 2000, he has been running a home furnishings and toys retailing business. \r\nafter long research on different types of businesses, he found out this is the right and profitable business by which he can provide for the family\'s needs and has a future to be widened. maruush is a good-natured man who says, "i would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the supplies in large quantities so that i can save the transportation expenses from china and trade them in good prices to my regular customers". the total amount he is requesting is 1,450,000 mnt to buy home products and new toys. \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\r\n

marguerite is a young woman, 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children, from 10 to 26 years old. everyone has been to middle school. marguerite opened a store and has been running it for two years selling take-out beverages. her business is doing well, but she often lacks inventory to sell, since her capital does not allow otherwise. she is always compelled to sell her entire inventory in order to procure more, thus the need for a loan enabling her to have more cases of beverages. the profit will allow her to expand her organization. she will save the rest of the money for her children's education.\r\n\r\n

merly m. is from the village of unidos. she is 38 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. merly owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. she has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 php a month. in 2009, merly joined pmpc to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. she has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 php from pmpc. this previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. merly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 php which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. this loan will be her 2nd from pmpc. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. about pmpc: paglaum multi-purpose cooperative (pmpc) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern mindanao. it reaches out to the rural poor using the grameen model. *note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva. given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

blas is a 44-year-old carpenter from albur, bohol, philippines. he has been in the carpentry business for more than ten years. 

blas is requesting a loan to buy materials such as saws, nails, hammers, a measuring tape, and other items. he will use his loan to improve his business and augment his income. in the future, blas would like to expand his business and explore other business ventures.

nora is 49 years old. she is married and has two children, and she lives in the town of macuelizo, santa bárbara with her children and husband. she has her own business selling clothing and other goods. she has been working in this business for nine years. she obtained a retail space in a nearby village and sells pants, shirts, blouses, lingerie, skirts, shoes, toys, and other products. she is requesting a second loan of 12,000 lempiras to buy new clothing and other merchandise. she hopes to increase her family’s income and expand her customer base. her dream is to grow as a businesswoman and increase her earnings so she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

hello kiva community!

the town of eldoret is famous for producing some of the world’s most renowned athletes. in the outskirts of the town, there are small villages occupied by small holder farmers. hyline is one of the experienced farmers living in a humble village near eldoret.

hyline has experienced many challenges, but she always finds a way to pull through. hyline is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. she is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience, despite personal challenges, and her passion for supporting her family as the primary caregiver.

for the past 10 years, hyline has been involved in mixed farming. her primary sources of income have been growing maize and vegetables and keeping goats and dairy cows. she has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

now hyline is requesting a loan to buy cereals to sell at the market in her village. her remote village has a ready market for cereals, but the main challenge is a lack of cereals. with this loan, she will be able to sell cereals and meet the local demand.

hyline awaits your kindness. be inspired to lend to her today to keep her big smile!

fortunato, 38 years old, is partnered and lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his spouse in the district of cañaris, ferreñafe province, lambayeque department, in the country of peru. he has very good personal and work references from the people in the area. the inhabitants of this place work primarily in agriculture, trade, and raising animals.

he works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, with over 30 years of experience in the field. the loan which will be granted to him will be used to pay for agricultural work, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and paying labor costs for his harvest. in this way, it will help physiological, morphological and productive improvements of his crop, and in the end he will have a greater yield and a better-quality product, for which he will have not problems in selling his product.

fortunato is a returning borrower with edpyme alternativa.

gemma is 52 years old, married and has six children. she is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the philippines. she requested a php 15,000 loan through nwtf to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

gemma has been in this business for 8 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from nwtf to sustain it. she successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her business.

in the future, gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

noravic is a married woman with three children. she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. noravic is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

noravic has a fish-vending business in the philippines. noravic requested a php 21,000 loan through nwtf to purchase more variety of fish to sell.

noravic has been in this business for six years. in the future, noravic would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

grace is a mother with two children. she is fifty six years old and she sells cloth and assorted meat in her village. she buys her products from kumasi and accra and retails the items in the western region of ghana.

\r\n\r\n

grace wants to use her loan to buy more assorted meat and cloth to increase her inventory and also to avoid price hikes. she a member of the group called animonyam (meaning "glory"). members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

hello kiva community!

meet david, who is a crop and animal farmer, and a father eager to provide the very best for his family. he states that with his small income, he hasn’t been able to provide sufficient lighting through the electricity in his home. his family has been using kerosene lamps, despite the toxic fumes that put the family at risk of contracting respiratory diseases.

david is kindly appealing for a loan to buy a solar lantern to provide adequate lighting, enabling his children to read better while at home and eventually to buy a digital television. with the lantern’s dual charging capability, his wife will also be able to efficiently charge her phone. kindly consider lending to him.

ma. luz works hard to support her family. she is married and has a general store business in the philippines. ma. luz has been in this business for five years now.

ma. luz requested a php 18,000 loan through nwtf to purchase additional stock to sell such as soap, sardines, and shampoo. she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

the "amanecer de san miguel" duo\r\n\r\none member of this duo is miriam alicia.  she is 45 years old and makes a living making and selling chocolate in san miguel village.  she delivers orders to antigua guatemala and part of chimaltenango and magdalena milpas altas.  miriam has been delicately producing this delicious chocolate for ten years.  she is now applying for a loan as it is at this time of year that she must prepare enough to sell and stock up so that miriam can sell customers chocolates of different designs and sizes.  miriam\'s wish is to keep growing and to keep improving her product.  with this she can help her family by bringing home an income.

kachulu, age 34, is an emerging small-scale entrepreneur in chibombo district in the central province of zambia where he runs a grocery store. kachulu is asking for a loan so that he can obtain an upright fridge for his store.

kachulu stocks a wide assortment of day-to-day consumer goods including bread, sugar, eggs, butter, cooking oil, fruit juices and detergent paste. with an upright fridge, kachulu will be able to expand his product range to include chilled and frozen foods and beverages like fresh milk, fish and various meat products that are in high demand in the surrounding community.

rent-to-own will deliver the upright fridge directly to kachulu’s store. rent-to-own will also ensure kachulu is trained on how to properly maintain the upright fridge so that it will continue to work for his business over the long term.

yan is 25 years old. he is a firewood seller. currently he is residing at rolung village, tuol khpos commune, tuek phos district, kampong chhnang province. his wife is a farmer. he and his spouse are earning a net income of about usd 5.50 per day. they have been involved in each career for more than three years now.

he is now requesting a loan from kiva via hkl to purchase a solar home system set to install on the top roof of his house. by doing this, his family will get light at night and will live in a safe place. he hopes that this first loan cycle will help to reduce his monthly cost for private electricity.

he plans to renovate his house and enlarge his farmland. he thanks all lenders for their financial support.

inomiddin together with his oldest son is in the business of buying and selling cattle. he is a butcher by profession and besides the resale he also had a vendor space where he sells meat. to get high profits inomiddin goes out to wholesale markets very far outside of where he lives and buys several heads of cattle in wholesale. if it's possible then he resells the live cattle, but if not then he butchers it and sells in his butcher shop. he has been working with microinvest for two years, and is very happy with the loan terms so he decided to apply for a new loan to buy a few heads of calves.

translated from russian by elena fedorchuk, kiva volunteer

mengnihol is a businesswoman from the vakhsh region. she is 56 years old, married, and has given birth to and raised five sons. mengnihol is a very responsible and energetic person.  she began her own small grocery business six years ago, and she continues it today with her family's help. right now,  mengnihol needs a loan. her youngest son is a first-year student at the state university in qurghonteppa, and she needs to pay now for the year's tuition. mengnihol waits with hope for support and promises to pay the loan back through her business. the loan will help her son continue studying at the university.

emily is a 46-year-old woman and has a nine year old child. she and her family live a simple life in balasan iloilo, philippines. to earn a living, she operates a rice retailing business. aside from this, she also sells vinegar.

emily dreams of having a water connection in her house, something that she wished for a few years ago. with the help of this loan, she will be able to make her dream a reality. she will use this loan to buy electric engine, hose, faucet, pvc and elbow. the remaining part of the loan will be used to pay for labor.

this loan will make a difference to emily since she will be able to conduct her daily household chores easier.

travelers throughout the world are drawn to the guatemalan state of sololá to visit the magnificent lake atitlán surrounded by volcanoes and quaint villages with warm friendly people who greet travelers with a hug and a smile! the microfinance organization, friendship bridge, has a number of trust banks in various villages. one is the maya kaqchikel group "mujeres el rancho" of seven women whose businesses are making jewelry (bracelets, rings, necklaces, beaded belts), selling tacos, tortillas and traditional candies. they are beginning their 1st loan cycle with kiva.

a very active member is isabel, who is 34 years old and has 3 children aged between 12-17. because she only finished the 1st grade, isabel is glad to have her children attending the 6th-7th grades. isabel makes beautiful beaded jewelry. due to a huge order, she is requesting a loan to buy multi-colored beads in bulk.

thanks to the partnership between friendship bridge & kiva investors, isabel and her friends are able to participate in the education and loans program "microcredit plus" that provides them with monthly training sessions in a variety of topics they can use on a daily basis. beneficial ones include business management skills (budgeting, expenses, saving, investing), disease prevention (good hygiene, nutrition), and women\'s issues (developing self-esteem). through the loans, kiva investors help the women create better living conditions for their families, as well as brighter futures. mil gracias!

morng’s group lives in a rural village in pailin province in cambodia. morng does work as a farmer to support his family. in his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help morng safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

mary jane is a 36-year-old woman from the town of talibon, bohol. she is married with four children, ages 7-14. she and her husband are engaged in fishing; she sells fish as a source of income. together with her husband, they work hand-in-hand to be able to meet the family's daily needs. 

mary jane is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials, such as a fishing net, ropes and fuel. 

in the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business to support the education of her children and increase business profitability.

agrivinah, 28, is happily married with one child, 4 years old. her husband is a driver and technician with an export processing company, and they support one another.

she is a hairdresser by profession and enjoys giving elegant looks to her customers. she has formed a good rapport with her customers, and they like her services very much.

she will use this loan to add stock of hair braids to offer better services. all her profit will be used to pay her loan quickly so that she may take another loan.

her dream is to own a hairdressing school.

samuel, age 46, is a simple hardworking gentleman. he lives in his own home with his wife antonia, age 51. samuel is willing to work extremely hard so that he can provide his family a better future. even as a young man, he knew that he had to put forth all of his effort into earning a living. samuel grows potatoes, peas, and gladiolas. when these products are harvested, he sells them at the wholesale market in tarma where he has customers who buy up his goods quickly because they are familiar with the quality of his crops. what he enjoys most about his work is protecting his crops from diseases. samuel has been farming for 28 years and considers the most difficult part to be carrying his harvest to the market to be sold because the sacks are very heavy. going forward, he wants to buy additional farmland so that he can plant more crops.

this is his ninth loan with mfp. samuel knows that he must submit his payments on time if he wants to access subsequent loans. he is an active participant in his communal bank. the loan of 2000 pen that he requested will be used to purchase potato, gladiola, and pea seeds. he will also buy compost and insecticides.

mr. mbemgue has a store located at the port of ziguinchor, where he sells sports equipment. he is asking for a loan to strengthen his business. this is because during the wintering period, it is a business that works extremely well.

translated from french by ivana kostic, kiva volunteer.

m. mbemgue a un magasin situe au port de ziguinchor, il y vend des equipements de sport. pour renforcer son activite, il demande un credit. car en cette periode d'hivernage c'est une activite qui marche fort.

lilibeth works hard to support her two children. she is married and has a meat vending business in the philippines.

lilibeth requested a php 9000 loan through nwtf to invest in a sanitary toilet.

lilibeth is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

born in 1968 in lomé, mrs. rose b. is married to an unemployed accountant and has two (02) dependent children. in this difficult situation, she chose to go into business and began selling fabrics. she is the only one taking care of the household needs, since her husband is unemployed and cannot contribute financially.

in spite of mrs. b.'s continued efforts, her family's financial situation keeps worsening, since her business is not profitable enough. she is asking for a loan of $800 for the first time, to increase her capacity of buying textiles in department stores at a reduced cost, which would result in a bigger profit margin that will in turn help her provide for the needs of her family.

translated from french by ivana kostic, kiva volunteer.

née en 1968 à lomé, madame b. rose est mariée à un comptable en chômage et a deux (02) enfants à charge. dans cette situation difficile, elle opta pour le commerce et commença la vente des tissus pagnes. elle s’occupe seule des besoins du ménage étant donné que son mari ne pouvait rien apporter financièrement car lui aussi est au chômage. malgré les efforts permanents de madame b., la situation financière de la famille ne cesse de s’aggraver, puisque ses activités commerciales également ne sont pas trop rentables. pour augmenter sa capacité d’achat des pagnes dans les grands magasins à un coût réduit afin de dégager une marge bénéficiaire importante et subvenir à tous les besoins de sa famille, elle sollicite pour la première fois un financement de $800 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce.

ms. blanca nubia h. c. actively works at the public school cerma as a primary school teacher. she has been working as a teacher for twenty years and is married with two school-age children. she has had eight loans with field partner ceprodel and she has used each one to purchase building materials to improve her house. she is requesting this loan to expand her home with a wall around her house. the loans with ceprodel have benefited her greatly because she has been able to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

our member has long had a business buying and selling clothing.  she sells pants, blouses and sweaters.  she is an enterprising woman and is working hard to secure a better future for her children.  she would like to have a store one day where she would sell her merchandise.  she is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with clothing that she will resell.\r\n\r\nour member is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

thelma g., a married woman who lives in purok 6, daan lungsod, toledo city, cebu, earns her living by operating three enterprises: a general store, a frozen products retail operation, and an electronic reloading business. her husband, jose g., 60, works as a winsman operator to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. they have eight children ranging in age from 22 to 37 years old.

thelma joined nwtf-project dungganon in 2002 because she aspired to something better for her family. with the help of her past 12 loans from nwtf-project dungganon, thelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. her previous loan of php 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of php 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. this time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing php 17,000 to purchase more stocks to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. thelma g. is a dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

about nwtf: in a world full of challenges, negros women for tomorrow foundation (nwtf) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through project dungganon (a hiligaynon word that means honorable). through the alleviation program, nwtf is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. they have taken a life path that will ultimately make them dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

help nwtf continue its mission to help the poorest in the philippines by clicking the link to the nwtf kiva lending team on kiva.org to join our team.

florencia is 50 years old and married with four children.

she earns a living in the philippines. florencia is borrowing php 11,000 through nwtf to buy additional pigs and sacks of feed for her pig fattening business.

she successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

jeannie m. is from the village of banga, wao, lanao del sur. she is 48 years old. jeannie is married and has three children. to make a living, jeannie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. while not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents, biscuits & beverages in the local community. jeannie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 php a month for these activities.

in 2011, jeannie joined hspfi to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. jeannie is requesting a loan of 5000 php which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages. this will be the 1st loan taken out by jeannie from hspfi. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

about hspfi:

hspfi is an accredited partner of opportunity international in the philippines. it is based in cagayan de oro city and reaches out to the poor households of northern mindanao.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

joão heitor elias m. was born in maputo, in the district of boane. he is married and the father of a one-year-old child. besides his family he supports his parents by sending them food. joão went to school until the 7th grade and then stopped due to lack of finances. he was forced to look for work early on, and found a job at an agricultural company that produces bananas, called bananalandia. his monthly salary is 1749.00 mt. joão lives in a house that belongs to the company, but with this loan he intends to purchase construction material and begin building his own house.

translated from portuguese by jill haring, kiva volunteer

cándida is married and her husband works as a truck driver at the san antonio plant.  she has 10 children who are all married.  she only has one dependent, a granddaughter who lives with her in a community near chichigalpa called guanacastal.  the majority of people living in this area are farmers and pork merchants.  she sells staple grains, chicken, meat, soap, axe, oil, and vegetables.  she has been counting on this business for 20 years.\r\n\r\nshe is a simple, hardworking, enterprising woman who dreams of having a bigger business and selling a large assortment of home products.

aysha is a 40-year-old married woman. she has been in the business of running a beauty parlor for many years. she offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. over time, she has established a regular list of customers so that she makes enough to contribute to the family income.

she needs to deal with more customers regularly. to do this, she requires hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan through brac pakistan. she is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. she is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the investment of the loan.

aysha thanks kiva and field partner brac pakistan.

27-year-old geraldine is a married woman with two children aged 8 and 2. she is engaged in fishing. geraldine helps her husband, who is a fisherman, by selling his catch at the market. she also makes dried fish to sell. geraldine works hard to improve their business and take care of their children.\r\n\r\ngeraldine requested this loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and other materials. in the future, she hopes to expand their business.

lucena is 56 years old and married with four children. lucena works very hard to provide for them.

lucena runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to purchase additional stock like eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, shampoo, etc. to sell.

lucena has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, shampoo, etc. 

in the future, lucena would like to save money to expand her business.

vincent is 40 years old and lives in the town of ggaba in the kampala north region of uganda. he is married and has two children who are both currently in school. for the past three years, vincent has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which operates in clinics and sells drugs. 

to help expand the business, vincent has requested a loan of 2,500,000 ugandan shillings from brac uganda. the loan will be used to purchase more drugs for his pharmacy, and will help vincent to generate greater profits and enable him to meet his customers' demand. vincent hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his existing pharmacy.

ratreysreytoch is a 19-year-old university student who resides in phnom penh city. she has an opportunity for an internship abroad for nine months. she will receive some money which is enough to support her living and savings of $10 usd per day.

she does not have the funds to prepare important travel documents. she is applying for a kiva loan via visionfund to pay for her passport and visa to support the internship. she hopes that this loan will help her to improve her skills and gain valuable experiences.

rodolfo, 41, is a hardworking and responsible man. he lives with his wife and four children who work and study. his wife works as a housewife.

rodolfo works in agriculture and also selling small farm animals. he sells pigs at the town's fair. he works buying piglets and fattening them to sell them at a good price to make good a profit. he has been doing this almost all his life and says that thanks to it he has managed to get ahead with his family.

rodolfo needs the loan to buy pigs, and flour and vitamins to feed them, fatten them, and sell them at a good price.

rodolfo dreams of giving his children a good education, and improving his family's living conditions.

phol's group lives in a rural village in the kampong speu province of cambodia. phol makes a living cultivating rice and works as a farmer to support her family. her village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

having a water filter at home will help phol safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

as a married parent of five children, jonalyn works hard to support her family.

she has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

jonalyn is borrowing php 20,000 through nwtf to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from nwtf.

she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

yit’s group lives in a rural village in kompong thom province in cambodia. yit makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. in their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

jane n. lives in the makerere neighborhood in the city of kampala, uganda.  she is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. she also takes care of her brother's daughter.    

jane has a business of selling newspapers. she has been in this business for seven years, and she works six days out of every week. she sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  jane has requested a loan of 500,000 ugx from mcdt sacco, which she will use to buy more newspapers. the main business challenges for jane include transportation and the rainy season. her goals and aspirations for her business are to become an agent for newpapers.  

jane lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

federico is 30 years old and lives in the city of cartagena. he sells a variety of merchandise and started this business two years ago. after finishing his high school education, he found it difficult to secure a job so he decided to generate income by engaging in an independent activity. his initial market consisted of relatives but gradually he was recommended to other people and today has built a stable customer base that he wants to expand. federico sells on credit towels, cleaning implements, pajamas, colognes, cosmetics, and anything else requested by his customers. this allows him to cover all of the possibilities. his greatest challenge is being able to respond to his customers in a timely manner. with each passing day, his operating capital becomes insufficient for satisfying his customers and generating more profits from his sales. this is why he is applying for a kiva loan, his first form of financing through fundación mario santo domingo.\r\n

\r\nhe will use the money to buy clothes, women’s accessories, and towels so that he can fulfill the orders his customers have made. with regard to the day of love and friendship (the colombian equivalent of valentine’s day), his customers want to show their affection for relatives and friends with gifts purchased from federico. therefore, he wants to be prepared for the spike in sales and make the most of his loan by injecting operating capital into his business. based on his experience, this will increase his chance of success as he takes advantage of this profitable market.

milagros is 54 years old and has one child.

milagros works hard to provide for her family. she runs a general store in the philippines and has requested a php 9,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like condiments, junk food, and other groceries.

milagros has borrowed and repaid five loans from nwtf before this loan. she has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fruit vending.

milagros aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

florencio belongs to the communal bank “manos juntas” in the city of cusco, perú. florencio is still working with his daughters in their family business as a tourist agent selling tourism packages. he is applying for a loan to make reservations, set up tourist programs, and buy tickets for trains, archeological tours, and museums. he thanks kiva for allowing him to continue working and developing his business.\r\n

the members of the " 16 de julio" communal bank meet every fortnight in san eduardo street on the road to santa ana in the city of portoviejo. it has been known as the city of the royal tamarinds since colonial times.

eulalia lives here. she is 59 years old, is married and from this relationship has 8 adult children, two of which still live with her. her husband is a craftsman. eulalia along with her family have a bakery in a store that they rent close to her house. there they produce breads of different kinds and flavors as well as cakes, sweet breads and many more products which delight her customers who buy daily from her store. they get up very early so that when the sun comes up they have everything ready for their clients. they have been running this business for more than 20 years which allows them to earn their living.

this loan is to buy flour, eggs, sugar and many other ingredients to prepare their breads. she has been in the communal bank since it\'s inception and likes it for the support the loans provide. her dream is to have her own store.

timotea, age 61, is a very likable and cheerful woman who lives in her own house together with her family, and who is willing to work very hard in order to get ahead in life. in the little room she sleeps in, timotea makes handmad. weavings which are the most colorful in the local market. she prepares weavings to order, since her weavings are very special and must be created by hand. in addition to filling orders, she also has a sales stall in the city of puno, where she offers her weavings each saturday to the people who visit the market. she has done this work for 20 years, and what she likes best about it is the weaving, which she carries out with great patience. she thinks the most difficult part is staying all day in her room filling orders. in the future, timotea hopes to be able to buy a sewing machine, since she would also like to branch out into other types of handmad. garments. this is timotea's third loan with mfp, and she expects to be very punctual with her payments, since she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank. she is very satisfied with her communal bank, and she knows it will help her to make progress. with the 1500 peruvian soles she is requesting, she will purchase more wool to create new handmad. weavings.

translated from spanish by patricia linderman, kiva volunteer

aniccia francisca is 22 years old. she is a young woman with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. she engages in running a general store. she has been engaging in this humble activity for more than 4 years. she is responsible for her 2 children and she fights every day to make ends meet. anniccia has encountered some problems because she lacked the necessary experience to offer her products to her customers, but she has improved in time and has thus been able to gain more customers. the loan she is requesting will increase her working capital and will be used to buy shoes, clothes and perfumes among other things. her wish is to make improvements to her house so that her children will have a place to live in the future.

36-year-old judith is married to herminaldo and they have six children, her eldest being 18. she desires that her children achieve a proper education which urges her to work hard.

judith owns a rice field and is engaged in rice farming. she envisions having a better income from her business and so improving her family’s living status.

judith applied to cevi and would like to loan php 5,000. this loan will be used to supply judith’s farm needs such as seed, urea (a fertilizer), pesticide, insecticide, diesel fuel and other items.

mrs. vuy t., 41, and her husband, mr. sophy an, 46, live on an island in the mekong river about 15 kilometers from phnom penh, the capital city of cambodia. they were married in 1982 and have six children: one son and five daughters. two of their children are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a silk weaver, and the other children are in school. 
 
vuy has been a weaver since she was 17 years old. she learned the skill from her mother. vuy buys raw silk from phnom penh and sells her finished products to the middleman in her village. her husband has built wooden houses since 1979. he works in his village and in a nearby village. vuy is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase cotton thread materials for her weaving business.

the member's name is marisol, she is 26 years old and single. the member still works in the business of selling handicrafts, she sells silver jewellery like earrings, necklaces and bracelets. 

through her business, the member wants to get ahead and expand her jewellery sales business.

the member is asking for the loan to buy jewellery like earrings, bracelets and necklaces.

the member is grateful for and values the loan received through this channel and is committed to fulfilling her payments within the established period.

for five years, ehrlyn and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business to earn a living. they live in san dionisio, iloilo, where most people in the community are involved in this livelihood. thus, she and her husband work hard in doing this business to provide and support the needs of their children. precisely, they have two kids, age 4 and a month-old baby.

ehrlyn’s goal in life is to improve their business for their children. with this, she and her husband want to borrow an amount to help them buy fishing net and a fishing boat engine. in this way, ehrlyn and her husband will probably improve their catch.

the communal bank "amor y paz" meets every fifteen days in the parish of calderón in the city of portoviejo. in this area the people work in agriculture, raising livestock and selling their products. 

paula, 39, lives here and is married to her husband with whom she has three children. one is of independent age and the other two are 16 and 14 years old. the oldest studies at a university and the two youngest go to high school. her husband makes a living in agriculture.

she works together with her husband and children in agriculture and the sale of their products. they grow plantains, cassava and peanuts. when they harvest their products they deliver them to merchants that come to the area and also bring them to manta, chone and portoviejo. they also sell by-products including cassava starch that they also deliver to the cities mentioned. they work in the land from 7:00 am until 3:00 pm. during the periods of difficult work they contract three workers whom they pay a weekly salary for their work. 

this new credit will be used to buy insecticides and agricultural supplies. she has been in the communal bank since it began and is a founding member. she likes the bank for the help that she has received. 

her goal is for her children to finish their studies and become professionals.

sarah is 48 years old and she is married with two children. the ages of her children are 10 and 23 years. sarah has one child who is presently in school, and both live at home. sarah attended school until 7th grade. she started to sell with her own money and learned the trade from her husband. sarah is a businesswoman who sells stationery on a busy road where many people pass to take a transport car.

for the past 10 years she has been doing this business and she says at time sales are slow. sarah sells 6 days a week and 10 hours per day. she uses vehicles to transport supplies to her business site. sarah wants to add on her business; therefore, she has asked for a loan through brac liberia, a kiva field partner. this loan will be used to purchase more stationary to sell.

she likes her business because she is able to handle her own money, and she feels proud of her business because it provides tuition for her children. in the future, she would like to increase her business and educate her children. she wishes to say thanks to brac and kiva.

mary jean has successfully repaid her previous loan from gdmpc used for buying fertilizer for her farm. she earns well from this. as a mother of three, she had to improve her farm to gain more produce.

she recently took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer, such as manure, to boost her farm. in the future, mary jean wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their studies.

yen s., 32, is widowed and resides with her three children in siem reap province, cambodia, an area known as the most favorite tourist place in the country. s. sells prepared food, earning an income of usd 3 per day. s. is requesting a loan of usd 300 to purchase utensils to start a business of selling food. in the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the studies of her children. this is her first loan from credit, a long-standing kiva partner in cambodia.

samoeurn, 62, is widowed and resides with two children in prey veng province, cambodia. she has been involved in growing rice and fattening cattle for over 20 years, earning approximately us $3 per day. two of her children are employed as a construction worker and a motor taxi driver, earning approximately us $5 per day. 

due to the family's transportation difficulties, samoeurn has requested a loan of us $1,500 to purchase a motorbike to commute. this purchase would enable her to use the saved money from her transportation expenses to support the family. in the future, samoeurn would like to run a motor repair shop for her son and build a new house.

lelina is a married woman, 53 years old, with six children, four of whom are still in school. she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

lelina has a rice retailing business in the philippines. she requested a php 15,000 loan amount through nwtf to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

lelina has been in this business for five years. she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

at 49, señor santos began to work as a leatherworker in the town of montería. since then he has made all kinds of leather accessories like leather cases, chairs, and bags, among other items.

today, he wishes to increase and expand his business. it is for this reason that he is soliciting a loan in order to set up a place where he can paint and upholster furniture, and to buy materials like a motor and tools.

if you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from interactuar, you can join the lending team called: “friends of interactuar colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

clendida, 32, is married and has two children. she and her family live in a community in santa lucía cotzumalguapa.

she wanted to help her husband cover the household expenses, so she started selling snacks. she also sells corn in the market in her community. she has been doing these two jobs for a year and they give her a good income.
