her demand has grown over time and she needs to buy food supplies such as vegetables, meat, bread, and oil. unfortunately she doesn't have enough capital, so she has requested a loan. that way she can continue making her delicious snacks and earning her income.

lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dress shop in the philippines. she is borrowing php 10,000 through nwtf to purchase additional materials for her dress shop. lilibeth has been in this business for five years, and she also earns income by raising pigs. lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from nwtf. she dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.\r\n

asima is 39 years old and married. she is a mother of two children. she is with her husband in the photo who is been in the business of manufacturing doors for many years. he has tremendous skill in doing it and has become famous in his community, catering to a large number of customers. he makes enough to provide for his family.

in order to expand his business, asima contacted kashf foundation and requested a murabaha loan of 40,000 pkr for her husband to purchase iron and a welding machine used in manufacturing and fitting doors to provide better and on time services to his clients, and to get boost in his net income and wishes to spend the profits on the betterment of his family.

nena is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. she was able to buy the ingredients needed in her canteen. her loan is also helpful in the education of her child, while her income from business is assisting their everyday household income. she continues to work to provide for their everyday needs.

she would like to apply for another 50,000 php loan for her to purchase ingredients like pork, eggs, rice, noodles, ham, and other products needed in her business. her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. she looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

nena hopes to be more successful in her business, and dreams that her child will finish his education. she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of god she studies.

* all cct community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. a fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. the fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of god, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

greetings from imara shg group in western kenya! alice is the facilitator of the imara shg group. this group joined one acre fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

alice takes care of 10 children at home with her husband. she joined one acre fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. in the recent 2011 season, alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 23 bags on 1 acre of land. before joining one acre fund, alice was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

with this loan, one acre fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to alice and her group during kenya’s next planting season in february 2012. the distribution of farming inputs is part of one acre fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

with income from maize sales, alice will educate her children and ensure that her family can afford day-to-day necessities.

in 2012, the members of imara shg group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

picture: alice is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

elsa is a married woman with four children. elsa is 33 years old and resides at libertad, sapang dalaga: philippines. elsa owns & operates a business selling fish to the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for five years. each month, she earns 5,500 php doing this type of business. she requested a loan of 11,000 php to have additional capital for fish production to purchase bicycle with sidecar to carry the container. elsa has been a member of gdmpc for a year. in the future, elsa wants to build a house and to finish the study of her children.\n

greetings from liberia, this is 44-year-old siah, married with 3 children, ranging in age from 10 through 29 years. they live at home while going to school. siah runs a business in a shop where she sells tomatoes, milk, charcoal, sardines, lunch meat, cream, and other home use items. siah started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned how to sell from her step-mother.

siah has been a trader for 7 years now and she considers herself to be a strong business woman. she uses a wheelbarrow to transport supplies to her business site twice a week. she sells from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm. siah likes her work because sales are fast. she feels proud of her business because it has empowered her life.

to add to her business, siah applied for a loan through brac liberia, kiva's field partner. the loan will be used to buy more tomatoes, milk, charcoal, sardines, lunch meat, cream, and other home use items to sell. she would like to deal in international business in the future. she is grateful to brac liberia and the kiva community for their financial support.

the member narcisa is an enterprising and hardworking woman. she works raising small animals and sheep. thanks to this occupation she is able to raise her family.

she belongs to the communal bank “hatun sayhua”; she is 46 years old. her dream is to progress and increase her animals; for that reason she applied for the loan.

narcisa applied for the loan to buy corn and alfalfa.

the member is grateful to kiva investors, since they will help her achieve her goals. she agrees to pay the fees within the established timeframe.

a married mother of two children, leonora works hard to support her family. she has a business selling seafood in the philippines and also earns income from pig fattening.

leonora is borrowing php 11,000 through nwtf to buy more seafood to sell to her customers.

leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from nwtf. she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

emelia is 49 years old. she is a widow and has six grown children living with her in aurora, zamboanga del sur, philippines. big businesses start small - that is what she always bears in mind. for six years, emelia has owned and operated a sari-sari (variety) store in her place of residence to earn a living for survival and enhance hidden capabilities in managing a satisfactory business. the store exists till the present time. she gets php 6,000 a month from this activity.

earlier this year, emelia became a gdmpc member. she began her loan application with the cooperative at the amount of php 5,000. the money is borrowed withe the intention of purchasing a few sacks of pig feed to sell retail. she believes she will earn more from this because most residents grow pigs. the probable revenue will be used to gradually buy necessary store facilities such as refrigerators, stock shelf and more.

leonardo robinson, 40, lives with  his common-law wife and they have two children.

he is a member of the vrc luchando group that is located in the la primavera area of the ventanas canton.  this branch has farmers who work with short cycle crops such as corn and rice.

leonardo robinson plants corn and rice, and also raises animals like chickens and pigs.

he is requesting a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, urea, insecticides and balanced food.  the loan will help him purchase the fertilizers that he needs for his crops.

he will buy the supplies in ventanas.  his dream is to be able to plant 6 hectares more of fields this coming year.  the challenges that he faces is to continue getting his family ahead.

in his free time he likes to watch tv.

as a married mother of three children, grace works hard to support her family. she has a fruit vending business in the philippines. grace is borrowing php 15,000 through nwtf in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from nwtf. she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

alda is a 51-year-old married woman with two children. she lives in clarin misamis occidental.

to earn a living, she owns and operates an agriculture business. she plants and harvests vegetables for sale in the local community while her husband works as a security guard. 

in 2009, she joined gata daku mpc and successfully repaid her previous loans that she used to purchase fertilizer. recently, she requested a new loan to buy fertilizer, such as manure, to be used for farm expansion.
 
she wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

lina is 61 years old and has five grown dependents. she lives in the town of alburquerque, bohol. for the past year, lina has been raising hogs. she has no adequate funds to sustain her business.

lina is requesting a loan to buy piglets and feed. her loan will help her to expand her business and she will be able to raise and sell more hogs in the coming months. lina’s income will improve and she will be able to set aside some savings for emergency use. in the future, she hopes to properly manage her business and have it become sustainable.

leslie is a very hard-working woman with great aspirations in life. she says that her last loan went well because with it she was able to buy more merchandise for her clothing business, and fortunately this investment was a great success. she is requesting a new loan to buy agricultural supplies and coffee plant seeds to plant for the coming season, as she lives in a very fertile region. her aspirations in life are to strengthen her crop and her business, and also to increase her family's income.

noemi’s goals in life are having more custumers, growing her business more and saving some of her profit for the future, since she is getting older. noemi is married, now in her fifties, and has four grown up children.  

she manages a vehicle spare parts business.  she wants a loan of php 40,000 to buy more vehicle spare parts to maintain her customers.  she hopes that she will able to maintain the business well towards the attainment of her goals through the help of this amount of the loan requested.

aventina is a businesswoman. she is a 41-year-old widow, and the mother of six children, one of whom is and adult and works abroad. the remaining five study. she is also responsible for a daughter-in-law who lives with her in a house she owns.

with the requested amount, she will buy zinc sheets, cement, and bars to build her own store; the one where she works now is rented.

her dreams are to finish building her store in order to decrease her renting costs, expand her business in order to fulfill her customers' demands, and buy a minivan to transport students and increase her family's income.

the greatest challenge she faces is the lack of funding. she grows food in order to overcome it and guarantee a stable food intake for her family.

jonalyn lives a simple life in baybay, leyte. she is 36 years old, married, and has 5 children. the oldest child is 12 years old, while the youngest child is a months-old-baby.

to help her husband augment their income, she started her own business selling coconut wine.

now, jonalyn is very concerned with the welfare of her family as she and her family currently uses a makeshift toilet that is made of light materials.

now she wants to improve this facility for them to have a good and safe toilet. to make this possible, she has asked for a loan through financial services, offered by kiva's field partner cevi, that promotes safe water and proper hygiene.

from this loan, she will buy materials such as concrete blocks, rebar, cement, sand and gi sheets.

as a married parent of two children, johnamay works hard to support her family.

she has a general store business in the philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. johnamay is borrowing php 29,000 through nwtf to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

she successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

johnamay has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from nwtf. she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

mwanaisha is a kiva borrower. she has three children. she describes herself to be honest. she operates a retail business where she sells construction materials. she has been involved in this business for 10 years. her primary customers are locals. she describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. she will use the kes 50,000 loan to buy more construction materials. she hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman.

there are a lot of divorced women in tajikistan for the last time. unfortunately, mahina is one of those divorced women. she was born in the family of workers in 1984. she has three children and it is not easy to raise them. she participated at startup training which was provided by imon. she has practice and wants to open a new business at a shopping network in the centre of city. she has an idea of trading stationery products. she is asking for a loan of 20,000 tjs to open a new business. she hopes to be supported by kiva lenders.

musarrat is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. she has been running a business selling milk for the past 5 years. she has two buffaloes for milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  she looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. they are happily doing this together to support their family. 

she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and education. in order to make bigger profits, she requested a loan of 40,000 pkr to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. in addition, it will allow her to increase her sales and profits.

mukhtaran is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of lahore, pakistan. mukhtaran runs a small boutique at home. she sells garments at very reasonable rates. she purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it and then sells it at a higher price in her community. the ladies of town like her garment collection and selection a lot. the demand for her cloth garments has increased due to attractive designs and colours. her husband affords all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings. \r\n\r\nmukhtaran wants to increase the variety of clothing on a daily basis, which is the reason she has requested a loan so that she can buy a greater variety of cloth to fulfill the demand. mukhtaran wishes for a bright future for her family. she is very thankful to kiva and field partner, brac pakistan.

the client lives in the city of libertad.  she started some time ago, selling household items and various products around the neighborhood. as it went well, she decided to buy more products to expand her selection. this business has been very profitable for her since then. she works on her own every day, making the rounds in accordance with the orders she receives. \r\n\r\nshe is married and her husband is a fish vendor. she has two minor children and they go to the the public school in the area where they live. someday she wishes to have her own natural food store. now she needs the loan to buy natural products to sell.

financial constraints, alongside the want for a better life and good quality education for her 4 children, are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged aasia to start her business selling animals by taking a loan from kashf foundation.  

aasia is 42 years old and married. she is shown in the photo with her husband.  

aasia buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. she makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. she also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

she needs to improve her business to handle her household expenses. for this reason, aasia contacted kashf foundation and applied for a murabaha loan of 40,000 pkr  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. she is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. with this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

roquita has been engaged in farming for 35 years. she grows rice and corn crops to sell. roquita works hard to help provide for her family. she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. roquita hopes that this loan will help to improve her harvest and her earnings.

joram is a married man who has been running his club for the past five years. he has many clients, but has not been able to meet the market needs. to do this he requires a loan of kes 50,000 to increase his stock and provide more variety beverages as the market demands.

mary rose operates a motor transportation business for her neighbours and local community. she earns a minimum of 300 php in sales every day. she needs 35,000 php to purchase spare parts to repair her vehicle. she would like to own additional motor units and be able to provide for the family.

risper is a married woman with two school going children. her husband is a fisherman and contributes financially to provide for the family's basic needs. risper has a house with neither electricity, nor piped water. her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees her children. 

risper has operated a cafe for the past two years. her potential clients are the local area residents. she faces a major challenge of seasonality, where demand is low during the dry season because of lack of food. she dreams of establishing another café in the future.

with the kes 40,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. she would also like to expand the café structure. she decided to join yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

a 50-year-old hardworking single woman by the name of theresa, who did not go to school at all, is living with her four children. the ages of the children are 32 to 21 years old. all four of her children have been in school for the past eight years. theresa has been selling dried fish. according to her, she will use the money to buy enough dried fish to sell. she transports her goods by car to her business center and sells nine hours per day. she started this business with the help of her sister and learned this trade by herself. she likes her business because it gives her money. her future plan is to get a big business. and thanks was her last statement.

lan’s group lives in a rural village in siem reap province in cambodia. lan makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farmer to support his family. in his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help lan safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

leah is a responsible, respectable, hardworking, honorable and honest woman who dedicates her life to raising her children, who mean everything to her. leah is a very hardworking woman who enjoys animal and crop farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 10 years. through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village.

because of her immense knowledge of farming, leah offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. being a caring and loving mum, she has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming.

leah has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. she is requesting a loan of 10,000 kes, which she will use to start the shop. her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions.

through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

margarita is 45 years old and married with three children. she works very hard to provide for them.

margarita runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf in order to buy more groceries to sell.

she has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, sugar, personal care products and other groceries.

in the future, margarita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

erica jharly is 19 years old and in a civil partnership.  she has one child, and lives with her partner and child in ventanas, in the los ríos province.

she is a member of the vrc divino nino community bank, which is located in the cachely grande district of ventanas canton.  the members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, and pigeon pea beans.

erica jharly works in agriculture growing corn and beans.  she makes her purchases and sells her products in ventanas.

she is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, pest control liquid, and supplies.  with the help of the loan, she will be able to grow corn.  she faces challenges such as infestations of budworm and locusts.

her dream is to have a better quality of life by increasing her income.  in her free time she likes to raise animals and go for walks with her child.

marelou works hard to support three children. she is single and has a general store business in the philippines.

she has requested an 8,400 php loan through nwtf to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

marelou is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors, as well as promoting environment protection.

regina is a smallholder farmer from eldoret, in one of the poorest villages in her region. she is a tireless, married woman with seven years of experience in farming. regina is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer. she is involved in dairy, poultry and maize farming. her efforts bring important provisions to her household, and she is able to feed her family.

she lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 kes to buy poultry. being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as juhudi kilimo via kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. through the loan, regina will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. you can help this mother with a loan and let her be closer to her goals.

norma is a 63-year-old from south cotabato. she earns a living through providing tailoring services to local residents in her town.

this time, she is bothered by her toilet that is in grave need of repair. but her main challenge is acquiring funds for that kind of project.

upon knowing that cevi caters financial services on water and proper sanitation, without delay, she applied for a loan for toilet construction.

it will be used to buy materials like hollow blocks, cement, steel bars, a toilet bowl, g.i. sheets, pvc pipe, and door hinges, and to pay labor costs.

with the help of this loan, norma will start to build a decent toilet, one that is comfortable to use daily and helps keep the surrounding area clean.

as a maried parent of three children, natividad works hard to support her family.

she has a food vending business in the philippines, and also earns additional income from boarding house renting. natividad is borrowing php 20000 through nwtf to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

natividad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from nwtf. she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

verna is a married woman with seven children. she is a very hard working entrepreneur. verna is 36 years old and has five children who are in school.

verna has a fish vending business in the philippines. verna requested a php 9000 loan amount through nwtf to buy variety of fish to sell.

verna has been in this business for 15 years. in the future, verna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

a married woman of 33, adjo lives in sanguéra with her four dependent children. adjo sells traditional dresses on a mobile basis and buys her stock at the market.
adjo is requesting this loan to make an order for the dresses, in order to meet her customer's needs and also to reach a comfortable financial position to help her children with their education.

tohir is involved in transporting passengers in his passenger car.  he has been in this business for three years.  tohir is 27 years old, married and has one child.  he is requesting this loan in order to install equipment for natural gas.

rebecca a. is from the village of bulwa, medina, misamis oriental. she is 56 years old. rebecca is married and has 12 adult-aged children. to make a living, rebecca owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. while not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to wear clothes and also dealing natasha and avon in the local community. rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 php a month for these activities.

in 2008, rebecca joined hspfi to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 php from hspfi. this previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. rebecca is requesting a new loan of 10000 php which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. this loan will be the 6th loan taken out by rebecca from hspfi. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

about hspfi:

hspfi is one of accredited partners of opportunity international in the philippines. it is based in cagayan de oro city and is reaching out to the poor households of northern mindanao.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

armie is 59-years-old and married with three children.

armie works hard to provide for her family. she runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 8,000 loan through nwtf to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

armie has borrowed and paid four loans from nwtf before this loan. she has been running the general store for twenty-three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock and farming sugarcane.

armie aspires to save money to expand her business.

this group is made up of three hard-working members.  sobeyda is a good example.  she is a married 26 year old woman who has a young three year-old child and works making and selling pizzas that she makes in her own home.  she sells them in the schools near her home.  she also has another activity which is selling new clothes, used clothes, used shoes, and used wallets.  she has been working in that field for four years.  she will invest her loan in the purchase of a cart for selling fast food in order to sell her pizzas while walking.   rosibel is another member whose business involves selling pots for plants, corn grinding stones, and piggy banks in a market in the capital  the other group member, josé félix, sells toys and imitation jewelry in bulk and individually in the municipal markets close to the capital.

leonar is 37 years old and married with three children; she works hard to provide for her family. 

she runs a buy and sell accessories business in the philippines, and requested a php 14,000 loan through nwtf to purchase more stock of accessories to sell.

leonar has borrowed and paid 14 loans from nwtf before this loan. she has been running the buy and sell accessories business for ten years, and also earns an income from computer gaming.

leonar aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

ruth shares her life with her two children. she covers all of their expenses. for many years, ruth has run a business where she sells staple goods. she started it based on her desire for self-improvement, and works there from six in the morning until seven at night. it gets hard for her when sales decline. her plan is to invest her loan in the purchase of canned goods, oil, beverages, snacks, bread, eggs, etc. which will help to offer new merchandise to her clients. ruth hopes that her sales and customers will increase. her dreams are to grow her business, and to have better food, clothing, and health for her and her children.

mariam is a married woman with one child who attends school. she owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

she has operated a firewood-selling business for the past six months. in addition, she sells fried potatoes which contributes to her income. she has been selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. mariam faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. during the rainy season, firewood becomes less available in the market.  

mariam decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business. with the kshs 20,000 loan, she plans to purchase a bundle of firewood for resale.  mariam hopes to expand her business in the future.

aprilyn is a married woman who does domestic work for a living. she engages in food vending. she sells fresh fish to the locals in her place.

she lives in her own home with her 8-year-old son. her husband's occupation is bus driving. she resides in the rural town of maribojoc, bohol.

she is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish and purchase a boat. these items are very vital. these items will improve her profitability and allow her to continue to sell a variety of fish to her respective customers. thus, she will be able to pay her obligations and invest in other sources of income to become sustainable.

she is grateful to kiva for the support.

maría rosa, 42, lives with her husband and their six children in the santa rosa district. it is a fishing district, which is located 20 minutes from the city of chiclayo. like all families who depend upon fishing as their primary source of income, they find that this activity is not enough to support them because they work only in season. that is why she runs a small business in her house. she sells daily consumption products (rice, sugar, oil, etc.) and other basic needs items. she has tried to support her family with this business during closed fishing season. this small business does not bring in enough income to cover their daily needs. that is why they see the need to ask for a loan for 2,500 pen. they will buy a “mototaxi” (a motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers). this investment will allow them to increase their daily household income. maría rosa wants her children to complete their education. she wants them to be able to study for professional or technical careers, which would allow them to earn a stable living as opposed to seasonal work like fishing. she has had three loans with the institution, and she has paid them back punctually. therefore, she is considered to be a responsible client.

translated from spanish by ginny kalish, kiva volunteer

eden is 41 years old and has engaged herself in direct selling.  she sells different products such as empty spray bottles, perfumes, face powder, and whitening soap. she has been operating this source of income since 2000 and she is very much thankful for its great help to their living. 

now that her four children are increasing their educational needs, she wants to also increase her income to meet all the needs of her children. 

to yield higher proceeds, she is requesting additional capital in the amount of php 10,000 to purchase bottled water, bottle spray, a variety of perfumes, lipstick, and whitening soap. she wishes that the funds provided will increase the inventory of the business as well as its income generated.

jasmin is a 59-year-old married woman with two children. she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

for 10 years, jasmin has operated a business selling beverages in the philippines. she has requested a php 6000 loan through nwtf to buy a variety of beverages and other supplies needed in her enterprise.

in the future, jasmin would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

soledad is 24 years old and single. various obstacles that have brought failure to soledad have not stopped her from trying again and moving forward with her plans. she now wants to start her own business: she wants to raise and sell pigs. her problem, however, is that she does not have enough capital to open this business. she is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy pigs and pig feed in bulk.

soledad hopes to expand her business, to formalise it, and to generate jobs for those who most need them.

soledad dreams of having a pretty house as her current home is not in good condition.

soledad knows that, with the help of interactuar and those at kiva, her dreams will become a reality.

ethel is 30 years old, is married and has three children. she lives in sapang ama, sapang dalaga, misamis occidental. she is a farmer, who cultivates cassava to earn a living with the help of her husband. they both work hard to cover the daily needs of their children.

she applied for a loan from gdmpc microcredit for the amount of 7,800.00 php. the loan will be used to purchase additional organic fertilizer for her farm to increase her harvest. she wants to have an abundant harvest in order to save a portion of her profit for the educational needs of her children.

isabel, aged 64, is a very energetic widowed mother, living in a house she owns with her daughter and her son-in-law. she engages in retail: she runs one of the busiest shops of her neighborhood, and she has become her neighbors’ favorite thanks to her kindness and the pleasant manners she uses when tending to them. and so she starts tending to her regular customers very early in the morning, and she very much enjoys their company and their conversation. she has been engaging in this activity for more than 17 years, and to her the most difficult part is to keep standing all day long, as she suffers from varicose veins in her feet. for this reason her daughter helps her in the shop, so that she avoids making too many efforts. in the future she hopes to widen her shop’s space in order to have more products to sell. this is her 15th loan with mfp, and she already knows this loan will be very useful for the development of her activity. she is also the leader of her communal bank, and she likes organizing and leading the meetings. the loan she is requesting will be used to buy more edible products, in order to augment her stock.

luduvina is taking a loan of $ 600 to improve her business. she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as fanta, coca cola, sprite, beer, body lotion, oils, sugar and soap.\r\n\r\nshe opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 300. luduvina is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

shahida, 64, is married and an energetic woman who is living with her spouse and six children in the area of lahore, pakistan. her husband runs a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. he derives his household necessities from his own store, and some of his relatives frequent his store as well.

shahida’s husband’s store is well-known in town, and he has many customers. he speaks in an impressively monotonous tone that allows him to easily win the trust of others. due to his excellent salesmanship he has built up very good relations with his customers.

ironically, because of his success shahida’s husband does not have sufficient inventory to cope with his customers’ demands. therefore shahida has requested a 100,000 pkr loan for her husband so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, cookies, etc.

shahida hopes that her husband will use the loan in a strategic way that will help him to meet both his customers’ demands and the needs of her family. she gives thanks to kiva and its field partner brac pakistan.

afiwavi is a divorced 32-year old woman. she lives in the tokoin neighborhood and has one dependent child. afiwavi owns a mill she uses to grind  condiments for local households. she is seeking this loan to bolster her capital so as to cover operational costs and give her business a boost. thanks to this she hopes to overcome financial instability.

mary ann is a married woman with three children. she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. mary ann is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

mary ann has a fruit vending business in the philippines. mary ann requested a php 11,000 loan amount through nwtf in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

mary ann has been in this business for four years. in the future, mary ann would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

rizza is 40 years old, married, and has two children. she works very hard to provide for them. she runs a general store in the philippines and applied for a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell, including shampoo and groceries. rizza has been in this business for five years. in the future, rizza would like to save money to expand her business.\r\n

the group niètaga is composed of seven women of the first district of the city of koutiala who have been neighbors for a long time. they average 37 years of age and are married mothers of at least five children each. they generally live in extended traditional families and do different work (selling firewood, local beverages, ice, meals, fruit and vegetables, salt, etc.)

with the goal of expanding their businesses, the group members joined the soro yiriwaso loan program this year. their loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs cfa for the first loan to 100,000 francs for this third loan, which they plan to use to buy: a truck-load of firewood, sacks of sugar and of rice for making meals, and some salt. what the women offer is in great demand in koutiala. experienced in their sectors of commerce, they get their supplies in different towns and marketplaces and have diverse and varied customers.

with this new loan, they intend to realize an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs that will be used to repay the loan interest and to help cover common family expenses.

translated from french by dan kuey, kiva volunteer

katani,70 year old is married. he has 7 children with ages ranging from 28 years to 37 years old. he describes himself to be hard working and ambitious.

he operates a agricultural farm where he sells farm produce. he has been involved in this business for 27 years. his business is located within a productive area and his customers are residents from local  environs. he describes his biggest business challenge to be sometimes drought and floods that hit the area which leads to crops drying. 

he will use the loan kes 11,100 loan to purchase a water tank that will be used by his nine family members for water storage.

falalu is a maize farmer. he is married and lives with his wife and children in a modest mud house in a small village in kaduna. thanks to his last input loan from babban gona, he gained access to high-yielding seed and fertilizer, and now expects to double his harvest.

as a babban gona member, falalu will now receive a harvest advance loan, providing him with a cash advance. he will use this loan to build a better house for his family.

additionally, babban gona will support falalu by storing the harvested maize to sell later in the year. as a result, he will not have to forfeit making a profit by selling his maize at low harvest prices.

falalu can now generate earnings of up to four times the average nigerian farmer’s annual income. his happiest memory as a babban gona farmer has been gaining better yields.

this group is comprised of three successful members, one of whom is migdalia, 45, who is married and has two children, ages 19 and 14.  for eight years she has been running a grocery store in her community.  she is requesting a loan to buy 100 lbs. of rice, beans, sugar, a case of detergent, bath soap, disposable diaspers, cigarettes, yogurts, etc.\r\n\r\nthe other members are ileana, 40, who raises and sells pigs, cooked beans and ice, and julia, 52, who has a tortilla, soft drinks and ice cream business.

solidario sembradoras de sacatepequez\r\n\r\nthis group is formed by odilia, who is 54 years old and has three dependent children of 15, 13 and 17 years of age. odilia has been working in agriculture for several years, planting snow peas, zucchini, among other products. she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and zucchini seeds. she wants to keep growing her crops because her idea is to deliver a good product to her customers and better the standard of living for her children since all three are studying at different levels. she hopes that you can help with the loan requested so she can to get ahead in her business and support her family.

maria is 39 years old. she is happily married. she has four children: carlos is 13, dylan is 8, and keira and kiara are 5 years old and are twins. they go to a school in the area. her husband works as a mason. 

she decided to take on her business idea due to different needs that come up at her home. for five months, she has worked raising chickens. with this income, she has paid the educational and food expenses of her family. 

to move forward with her business, she needs to buy balanced feed, corn, vitamins, and other supplies necessary for her work. this way, she will manage to increase her production and output in raising these birds. in the future, she wants to build a shed to expand her business and to continue saving in order to ensure her family’s future.

josé is 39 years old and is a farmer. he is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. the other works. his wife takes care of the home.

josé works in agriculture. his parents taught him this work after he quit school. he farms a hectare of corn close to his house. he also likes to take care of cattle.

with the support of his prior kiva loan he was able to invest in his farming. with effort, he paid off the debt punctually. he will use this new loan to buy cattle, which he will raise to make a profit when he sells them. this will allow him to continue helping with his son's schooling. josé wants to support his children in all ways necessary so that they have better opportunities.

martha elena, who is 50 years old, is from the town of chinandega. she has three children. this entrepreneur's business is selling a variety of products such as soft drinks, hot dogs, grains, candies, and other items. she began this business 10 years ago to help with the household expenses. the business is located in her home. now she has moved forward with the help that the foundation leon 2000, together with the kiva program, has offered her, since it has allowed her to invest and stock her little business, which generates earnings for the support of her family.

frank k. is twenty-nine years old. he is married with three kids who are currently in school. he is a dealer in electronic parts like speakers, transistors, transformers, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas etc. he also provides repairs and servicing work for his customers. he buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices from kumasi and sells to his customers at retail prices. he is requesting this loan to enable him to procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. he hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators and parts.

robert intends to use the requested loan facility to buy more bulls for fattening for resale. he has been involved in a cattle selling business for the last 10 years and that is how he has been able to raise income to pay school fees for his 6 children. he also does farming and mainly growing of food crops like cassava, bananas and maize for additional income. he is however challenged by foot and mouth disease which at times kills the animals hence leading to looses.

maría is a young woman, 23 years old and single, who lives with her parents and siblings in a community in the village of pochol.

maría, with the desire to get income and help her parents with the household expenses, works offering her services milling cornmeal. she has been doing this work for 5 years, her business is located on one of the principal streets of her community.

despite being too young to be worried about her family's well-being, maría has realized that one of her family's needs is to remodel its humble house, so she has considered it necessary to ask for a loan to purchase materials such as cement, concrete block, sand, and gravel. she hopes with her whole heart to get the loan and be able to achieve this goal.

katherine is 31 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom attend school. she works very hard to provide for them. katherine operates a general store in the philippines, which she has been doing for two years, selling a variety of items.

katherine requested a loan from nwtf for 12,000 php, which she will use to buy items to sell such beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home product care, and other groceries. in the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

felismina abraão m. was born in maputo, south of mozambique. she is 29 years old and a single mother to a boy who's 10 months old. she finished 12th grade but had to drop school due to financial difficulties. she lives in her own house with her son and doesn't support anyone else. she never left maputo. she runs her own business selling beer, wine and soft drinks for the past 10 years. she learned this activity from her parents, she has no employees and works from 7am to 6pm every day.\r\nshe makes around 2.500,00mt (u$80) per month which she uses for household expenses and saves some every month. she has never had loans with other banks and this is her 3rd loan with hluvuku. she is asking for 10.000,00mt (u$350) in order to buy more merchandise (soft drinks, beer, wine and other alcoholic beverages) to diversify her products and improve her business. her previous loans were also for $350 and for the same reason. she is hoping to pay this one in time like she did with the others so in the future she can ask for another loan to open her own liquor store and improve her business.\r\n

translated from portuguese by mariana dauwe, kiva volunteer

alfreda is a married woman with two children. she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. alfreda is 41 years old and has one child still in school.

alfreda has a fruit vending business in the philippines. alfreda requested a php 9,500 loan amount through nwtf to buy more fruits to sell and other supplies needed in her business.

alfreda has been in this business for four years. in the future, alfreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

agnes operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. she faces stiff competition from other vegetable stall operators in her business. the previous loan helped her a lot and she appreciates that.
 
with the kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale. she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

rose is a 46 year old woman from the migori region in the western part of kenya. she supports 3 people in her family; she is a widow, and was left with 2 children who are 13 and 15 years old respectively. she sells second hand clothes, which she has been doing for the last 5 years, and earns a monthly income of kes 30,000. rose has applied for her third loan with kadet ltd, which she will use to increase the volume of her stock. she will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. her dream is to become a successful business lady in the region and have a good life for her family.

pablo is 29 years old.  he is a cabinet maker and works in his own workshop.  he lives in an urban area which is considered a suburb of guayaquil and is noted for the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are merchants.

his father taught him how to make furniture from an early age.  as he grew up, at the age of 13, he began to make his first pieces of furniture with his dad's help.  after a while he decided that his profession was going to be that of a cabinet maker in a family business.  he currently works from contracts that his customers make with him.  he doesn't work fixed hours because he works with his father in his own workshop.  he makes doors, shelves, living room sets, dining room sets etc.

to continue in his business he would like to use this loan to buy paint, lacquers and thinners to finish furniture which he has made.  in the future, he would like to continue working as a cabinet maker and help his parents financially.

hello lenders, meet mary, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman who hails from the chuka area of kenya, an area that is near the famous mount kenya. she is 42 years of age and has been doing farming for the past 22 years and through those years, she has gathered so much experience she is considered among the best farmers in her village. she has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some small businesses that she does so that she can make ends meet. mary is very passionate about farming and she loves cultivating her farm. that is why everyday she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.

although mary makes profits through farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. that is why she is seeking a loan to buy cereals. the chuka area is one of the regions that is populated and has a high demand for cereals. that means that mary will make more profits and be able to satisfy the demand that is there. accessing funds has been a challenge for mary, but she feels relieved because juhudi kilimo is partnering with kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

mary believes that this loan will be of much help and she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there for cereals. she believes that the extra income will allow permanent change to her life and increase her business. increased profits will allow mary to repay the loan and secure the future of her school going children

azenith is 35 years old and married with two children. azenith works very hard to provide for them.

azenith runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries.

azenith has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

in the future azenith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

daveat’s group lives in a rural village in kampong speu province in cambodia. daveat makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor and construction laborer to support her family. in their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.\t\n

gledis is 28 years old and lives in the municipality of valencia. she’s a single mother who has a little son. she is raising him alone, and it hasn’t been easy, but she’s a loving and responsible mother.

she works as a farmer, something she started 7 years ago with her parent’s help. her parent taught her not only to do this job but to love this profession, which she does.

she expects she can give her son a great education, and therefore she wants to improve her business. she’s asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, and a hose to improve the irrigation of her plantain and papaya trees.

support this single mother and loan now.

if you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from interactuar, you can join the lending team called: “friends of interactuar colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

susan is 57 years old, married and she and her husband have been blessed with three kids aged 16,14 and 10 years. she is a farmer and she has been in business for 5 years and right now her monthly income from the business is kes 50,000.\r\n\r\nshe is borrowing kes 100,000 which she intends to use to expand her agricultural farming activities by buying seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to be used in this new planting season. she plans to plough back the profit into the business. this is her first loan and her dream is to prosper in life.

anabella c. is from the village of ramon magsaysay, zamboanga del sur. she is 25 years old and single. to make a living, anabella works in someone else's business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. while not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. anabella has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 15,000 php a month for these activities.

in 2008, anabella joined gdmpc to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. anabella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 php from gdmpc. anabella is requesting a new loan of 20,000 php, which will be used to repair the existing vehicle for better service. this loan will be the sixth loan taken out by anabella from gdmpc. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

about gdmpc:

gdmpc is one of the most progressive cooperatives in mindanao, philippines. it has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of zamboanga del sur, lanao del norte and misamis occidental. its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

marina is a married woman who lives in aborlan, palawan. she earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, food vending and fishing. her husband godofredo, who is 51 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  they have 10 children who are between 7 and 32 years old. marina joined nwtf-project dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. with the help of her past two loans from nwtf-project dungganon, marina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. her previous loan of php 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of php 11,200, uplifting the family's standard of living. this time, for her third loan, she is borrowing php 15,000 to buy stock for the store and a new fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for future improvement of her business. marina is a dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

about nwtf: in a world full of challenges, negros women for tomorrow foundation (nwtf) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through project dungganon (a hiligaynon word that means honorable). through the alleviation program, nwtf is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. they have taken a life path that will ultimately make them dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. help nwtf continue its mission to help the poorest in the philippines by joining the nwtf kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

olga and her family have had to overcome many great adversities in their lives, but she has always known how to persevere and continue getting ahead every day.  her husband used to be the one who earned a living for the household, and olga took care of the two children, but one day her husband had a work accident and left him an invalid.  since then, olga has had to assume responsibility for the household economy.  with the the money her husband received from the accident they set up a general store where they sell family shopping basket items and can earn enough to survive.  because the business is well established and customer service is very good, olga is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle and begin offering delivery services, which her eldest son will carry out.\r\n\r\nin this way her store will grow larger and continue to provide a good income for the household.  her greatest goal is to provide a good education and college degree for her two children, while also providing economic stability to continue progressing despite the adversities.

marybel works hard to support her three children. she is married and has a food vending business in the philippines.

marybel has requested a loan of 7,000 php through nwtf to invest in a a sanitary toilet .

marybel is aware that by using the sanitary toilet she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks and hazards to her family.

the lending club “jovenes ecologistas” is located in the santa ana district in la convencion province, in the department of cusco.

celia, 48, is single and has 4 children. she works in her restaurant where she makes dishes like baked chicken, soups, and beef stir fry. she works from 8am to 6pm. she's been running this business for 8 years and its going very well. her dream is to have a restaurant.

other lending club members have business including animal sales, clothing sales, a grocery store, and food sales. the loan recipient is grateful to everyone who is part of her dream through this project and promises to make her payments on the established time frame.

erlinda v. is from the village of flores, naguillan, isabela. she is 49 years old and married with eight school-aged children. to make a living, erlinda plants and harvests vegetables for sale. she has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,200 php a month. 

in 2010, erlinda joined aski to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. she has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 php from aski to purchase  seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise and is requesting a new loan of 7,000 php for the same purpose. this will be the second loan taken out by erlinda from aski. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

about aski: aski is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the philippines. it has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

lorna is 57 years old and married.

lorna works hard to provide for her family. she runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 18,000 loan through nwtf to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her variety store.

lorna has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through kiva.

lorna aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

meet 45-year-old adama from waterloo branch. she is married with three children between the ages of 10 and 30 years.

adama sells dried and smoked fish to her customers from a table near a busy market place. the fish is smoked on a grate while small pieces of wood burn underneath. certain fish smokes better than others, and adama tries to run her business in tune with local demand and whatever fish is available from the ports.

she has been in this business for the past nine years now and works 10 hours per day and six days a week. her other source of income is from her husband. she says she has no challenge.

adama requested this loan from brac to purchase more fish and palm oil to increase her business. she says that the extra income from this loan will improve the life of her family and pay her children’s school fees. in the future she wants her business to expand. she says thanks to brac and the kiva community for their support.

jelly is 51 years old and married with two children.  she works hard to provide for her family. 

she runs a general store in the philippines, and requested a php 35,000 loan through nwtf to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.  jelly has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from nwtf before this loan. she has been running the general store for 11 years, and also earns an income from raising livestock.

she aspires to saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

virginia is 51 years old. she is from sinacaban, misamis occidental, philippines. she is separated and has 13 children. virginia used her last loan to purchase motor accessories and supplies needed to expand the seating capacity on her motor transport. her transport business is successful, and she's now taking a new loan for her other business, to purchase tools and equipment to expand the business. in the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.\r\n

this is the manuela ramos communal bank. it comprises five hardworking members.

one of them is marcelina, age 62 and married. she runs her own business, selling vegetables like potatoes, sweet potatoes, celery, onions, and other varieties. she has been in business for fifteen years, and has always wanted to be able to expand. she is requesting this loan to buy potatoes, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and sweet potatoes.

the manuela ramos group wants to thank kiva lenders for their support and promise to keep working earnestly.

marcelina is the first woman from the right in the picture.

betty, a member of the group, is thankful for the financial support that the kiva lenders though ugafode have rendered them. they had been tossed up and down in all areas for not having collateral but thanks to the kiva lenders, they are able to acquire loans. betty will use the loan to pay tuition for her daughter in high school. she is hardworking.

bibiana is single and 36 years old, she has a son who loves her very much. she lives in her parent’s house, they help her with her business.
bibiana works daily selling beauty products, she works for three lines selling by catalogues, she is a very high spirited woman, and what she sets her mind on she conquers.
this is why she decided to start this business, because it seams profitable to her, she works all day and has one year on this business. what she likes the most is to socialize with other people. business is good and currently she is leader on one of the lines she works for. bibiana works to help her parents with daily expenses and for her son’s education.
with the loan she is asking, she wants to improve her business, and buy a showcase to keep in good condition her products and to exhibit them.

translated from spanish by n.d., kiva volunteer.

bibiana es soltera, tiene 36 años, es madre de un hijo que la ama mucho. ella vive en casa de sus padres quienes le dan la mano en su negocio. la venta de productos de belleza es el trabajo diario que tiene bibiana, trabaja para tres líneas de productos de belleza por catálogo, es una mujer de armas tomar y lo que se propone, lo cumple. por eso, decidió incursionar en este negocio, ya que le parece rentable, trabaja todo el día desde hace ya un año. lo que más le gusta es socializar con otras personas. le va muy bien, actualmente ya es líder de una de las líneas para quien trabaja. bibiana trabaja para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos diarios y para la educación de su hijo. con el dinero que solicita quiere implementar más su negocio, así como también comprar una vitrina para tener en una buena condición y exhibición sus productos.

andresa o. is from the village of kanitoan, initao, misamis oriental. she is 44 years old. andresa is widowed and has five adult children. to make a living, andresa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. andresa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 php a month for these activities.

in 2010, andresa joined hspfi to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. andresa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 php, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. this loan will be the first loan taken out by andresa from hspfi. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

about hspfi:

hspfi is one of the accredited partners of opportunity international in the philippines. it is based in cagayan de oro city and is reaching out to the poor households of northern mindanao.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

carmen h. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  general store, rice dealer and cafeteria businesses. she lives in brgy. 4, himamaylan city, negros occidental.  she has been a member of nwtf-project dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from nwtf and through her own efforts.  

by working hard in her general store, rice dealer and cafeteria businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  she now earns an average monthly income of php 23,000.  carmen is now borrowing php 18,000 so that she  can purchase more stock to sell.  this will be her 8th loan from nwtf-project dungganon. her previous loan of php 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

carmen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the dungganon way.  

about nwtf: 

 in a world full of challenges, negros women for tomorrow foundation (nwtf), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through project dungganon (a hiligaynon word that means honorable). through the alleviation program, nwtf is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. they have taken a life path that will ultimately make them dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  help nwtf continue its mission to help the poorest in the philippines by clicking the link to the nwtf kiva lending team on kiva.org to join our team.

ena is 37 years old and lives in the municipality of san andres de sotavento. she has 2 sons who are her biggest motivation to work and to be happy. she has worked making handcrafts and raising chickens to sell their eggs since 2006.

she dreams of her sons being professionals and she expects she can do that for them. ena wants to sell more to make her business sustainable. she’s asking for a loan to buy caña flecha to make more handcrafts, and to buy chickens to raise. support this loving mother and loan now.

if you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from interactuar, you can join the lending team called: “friends of interactuar colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

ana belén is a professional stylist who began her own business with the goal of being a successful micro entrepreneur. in april 2000 she began to offer different services including hair styling, beauty treatments and a gymnasium.

her primary goal is to acquire the property where her business is located and improve the infrastructure, as its capacity currently is limited. her clients are people from the area, and with the passage of time, the equipment and machines that are in the gym are too few for the demand. for that reason she is seeking a kiva loan as an opportunity to buy a heavy duty treadmill and improve her service.

ana belén is the mother of a son and lives with her spouse in a neighborhood of bogotá. her principal motivation for continuing on in her business is the wellbeing that she can offer to her family as a result of her work.

osman lives with his wife and son in a small town within santa cruz de yojoa, which is a community in the central region of honduras. for over three years he has worked in a factory in villanueva, earning minimum wage and conducting his work efficiently.

osman is requesting a loan to buy sand, cement, rods, and more, which he needs to construct his own house. he hopes that the loan helps greatly since he does not yet have the necessary funds to build a room. he hopes to finish this project and give his family a decent home, as this has been his biggest dream. he bought the land with great effort, and now he needs to finish building his house.

santa cruz de yojoa, honduras – february-2017.

khy’s group lives in a rural village in kampong speu province in cambodia. khy makes a living cultivating rice. he works as a farmer to support his family.

in khy's village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help khy safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

as a married parent of three children, rosyl works hard to support her family.

she has a fish vending business in the philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  rosyl is borrowing php 30000 through nwtf to  purchase more fresh fish to sell.

she successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

rosyl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from nwtf. she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

a wonderful and kind man by the name  of hakim lives in a house which is in bad condition. he has been busy with growing potatoes and wheat for more than 5 years. he is a owner of a private farm. he has additional income from animal husbandry. his lovely wife helps him with the business. they try so hard to earn enough money for repairing their house but can’t get enough money. hakim’s child wants to live in a house which is in good condition and that’s why hakim is asking for a loan of 1500 tjs to buy building materials as cement and paint for repairing the house.

in this way he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. each month he will make his payment on time. he awaits your support and mercy. please, help him and his family if possible.

rosalie manage a small retail store within her local community.she is 22 years old, married and has two children.she wants to increase her stock of grocery items but she doesn't have enough capital. for this reason, she would like to borrow php 7,000. she will use the loan to buy merchandise such as seasonings,candies and canned goods to sell.she knows that this amount will enable her to generate better sales and income.

agnes is 32 years old, married, and has four children. she lives in masindi, uganda. she sells drugs, which she has been doing for five years. agnes started her business after realizing that her husband could hardly support the family with his earnings. high license fees and inadequate capital to meet the demand pose a challenge to her business growth \r\n\r\nagnes is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy drugs to sell. she hopes to educate her children up to university and to start other income generating activities to earn more income. she also dreams of owning a pharmacy.

ayisha is 23 years old who financially helps her family. five years ago, she took the initiative in her area and started a school that offers educational services to poor students at cheap rates so they can have a better future. her business is beneficial for her household and society as a whole. \r\n\r\nayisha requested her third loan from kashf foundation for 40,000 pkr, which she will use to purchase furniture such as chairs and tables to accommodate more students. she hopes to have more students in her school in the coming days.

jesús is 58 year sold, in a common-law marriage, and lives in the countryside in the area of carmelo, on the border between ecuador and colombia. he works at the agricultural tasks, with crops and raising cattle for milk production. this is the work of his entire life, with which he has managed to survive. jesús characterizes himself as being respectful and responsible with his obligations.

he asks for the loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of a purebred dairy cow with which he will be able to increase the milk production, improving his income to support his household.

cecil is 35 years old, married, and has two children. she lives in liloy, zamboanga del norte, where she has owned a sari-sari store to earn a living for four years. each month, she earns 5,000 php.

cecil has requested a loan of 7,000 php to purchase more basic commodities to restock her store to sell at retail. a new member of pmpc, she hopes to expand her store in the future.

rea is 36 years old and married with five children. with five children in school, rea works very hard to provide for them.

rea runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 8,000 loan through nwtf to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, personal care products, and other groceries.

rea has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, coffee, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, etc.

in the future, rea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

peter n. k. is 61 years old and married. he has seven children.  

he has been selling eggs since 1990. he has sustained his business for these years through faulu kenya. his living standard has also changed since he joined faulu kenya in 1994. he hopes to open an outlet of his business in the future. he also dreams of buying a piece of land.  

he has requested 80,000 kes to buy more eggs.

robert is a 40-year-old man married with 5 children aged 22, 18, 12, eight and one; three of them attend school. he is a mechanic in the market dealing in fridges, he also earns from farming on a small scale. he is faced with hardships of limited capital, besides that, he hopes to expand his business to new areas. \r\n\r\nrobert needs a loan to buy iron sheets in order to roof his house.

victor is 21 years old. he's a young man who's very dedicated and responsible with his work. he's single and lives with his parents. for five years, he has been raising and selling pigs.

victor needs the money to be able to buy more piglets and continue increasing his income with the goal of helping with household expenses.

albina is a hardworking, 77-year-old woman. she lives with her husband in the town of sibayo which is located in arequipa.

she works selling dried grains, a job she does from her home. she seeks a micro loan in order to buy more dried grains to increase her sales. in the future albina wants to be able to rent a stand in the market to increase her economic earnings and live comfortably with her husband.

ben is a hardworking middle-aged man who lives in the eldoret area of kenya. he is married to a lovely, diligent, 39-year-old wife who gave him four children. he has been doing dairy farming for a living for the last seven years. his primary income source is milk.
 
ben has always wanted to do poultry farming as a business. he has a few birds that give him eggs for food, but he feels it is time to upgrade it to becoming a business. 

he is seeking a loan of kes 65,000 to purchase a brood of hens for egg production. he will be selling the eggs he collects to neighbours, institutions, hotels, and to retail shops. 

income from this business will help him deal with the high transportation costs that are eating into his profits. he will also use the increased income to meet his family's basic needs.
