musayamhuja is a hardworking man. he is married and has two children. he has a 22-year-old son and a 15-year-old daughter. musayahuja works as a cashier in imon, and he is one of the best employees of imon. musayamhuja always strives for the well being of his family. his wife is a housewife and that’s why musayamhuja is the breadwinner of his family. 

musayamhuja’s son is a student of the tajikistan state university politic and business school. he studies at the magistracy. musayamhuja must pay for the education of his son but he does not have the money. he is asking for a loan of 1,100 usd with this aim. he awaits your support.

the member, zoraida, continues with her grocery store business.  she is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay on time.  zoraida continues selling her products such as rice, sugar, milk, and other items to her customers that request them.  she has been engaged in this business for a long time, and it brings her personal satisfaction because this is the way she supports her family.  zoraida is requesting the loan to purchase milk, sugar, and other items.

fátima is 34 years old and only studied through the fourth grade because her family had limited financial resources. she is married and her husband is a pastor of a local church. they have two children, ages 15 and 7, who are in school.

fátima has been selling clothes in her community and the surrounding areas for the past six years. she previously had a shop where she lived, but she closed it down due to social problems and safety issues. fátima also raises pigs. she sells clothes three days a week by going house-to-house with her daughter helping her.

fátima will use this loan to buy clothing for adults and children so that she can continue her sales. she will also buy women’s accessories. as a result, she will have income so that her children can continue studying. her dream is to provide for her children’s academic studies and to continue improving in her businesses.

greetings from liberia. this is 33-year-old mamie. she is married with 4 children, ranging in age from 8 through 18 years. all of her children are in school while living at home.

mamie is a hardworking businesswoman who sells dried fish. she started this business with financial help from her husband, and her mother taught her how to sell. she has been involved in this business for 5 years now. she uses vehicles or bike to transport supplies to her business site. mamie often sells from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm, monday to saturday.

to maintain her business, mamie has asked for a loan through brac liberia, a kiva field partner. this financing will allow her to buy more dried fish to sell. she likes her business because it gives her money and also helps in supporting her children.

in the future, mamie hopes to build a house and educate her children. she wishes to say thanks.

thomas is 51 years old and married. he supports his five children, who are between 20 and five years old. he is a contractor and has been in this line of work for six years. he gets a monthly income of kes 40,000.

he is borrowing a second loan of kes 70,000 from kadet ltd and wishes to use this amount to buy modern equipment like a gauging trowel, plumb line, etc. and to pay school fees for his children who are in secondary school. 

the profits he earns will be used to pay the loan. his dream is to ensure that his children get the best education.

alfredo josé is 37 years old. his financial activity is the sale of general merchandise. he has a lot of experience in this activity. he began through the necessity of having a working tool and to support his father in the business as he could no longer continue in the business. currently he has shown himself to be responsible, hardworking, and creditworthy. he is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise in order to sell to his customers, and to take advantage of the mother’s day celebration season in our country which has had a large demand from his clients for products such as: shoes, perfume, cosmetics, facial creams, and clothing for men and women.\r\n

fe s. is from the town of solinog, calamba misamis occidental. she is 34 years old. fe is married and has three school-aged children. to make a living, fe operates a specialized retail store, where she primarily sells soft drinks and other products to the community. fe has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000.00 php a month for these activities.

in 2008, fe joined pmpc, a kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 php from pmpc. fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 php, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. this will be the third loan taken out by fe from pmpc. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

about pmpc:

paglaum multi-purpose cooperative (pmpc) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern mindanao. it reaches out to the rural poor using the grameen model.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva. given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

jose is 45 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has one child. he lives with his family in the district of nueva arica which is located in the province of chiclayo, lambayeque region, on the north coast of peru. life in his community is quiet and the people work principally in agriculture and raising animals.

jose works offering agricultural services as a laborer. he has his own work tools and he has more than 3 years of experience in the business. his business is located in the district of nueva arica. he is requesting loan to buy more work tools to carry out his business as well as doing maintenance on his existing tools as they are in poor condition. doing this jose hopes to offer better service to his clients which will allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of living.

sherlina s. is from the village of country hill iligan city. she is 45 years old. sherlina is married and has 2 adult-aged children. to make a living, sherlina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. while not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cooked food in her carenderia and she also had her sari sari store in the local community. sherlina has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5000 php a month for these activities.

in 2009, sherlina joined hspfi to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. sherlina is requesting a new loan of 5000 php which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. this loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by sherlina from hspfi. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

about hspfi:

hspfi is one of accredited partners of opportunity international in the philippines. it is based in cagayan de oro city and is reaching out to the poor households of northern mindanao.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

titus, age 20, is a single hardworking man who comes from a family of four children. he is a professional farmer who enjoys tilling the land and growing food for his community. titus has been involved in this business for many years and enjoys making a profit.

he will buy cabbage seeds and tomato seeds to plant on his farm to earn a profit, which will be used to repay his loan. his dream is to have a stable business and a secure future.

violeta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

she runs a clothing retail in the philippines and requested a php 30,000 loan through nwtf in order to buy more clothing to sell.

she industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

violeta dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

ms. kou g. is an unmarried senegalese woman who is currently a counselor. she’s requesting a loan from imcec and kiva to get started in the commerce of cosmetics. with the revenues from this new enterprise, she hopes to support herself better and to be independent. she was waiting for her loan to be financed to buy merchandise, so no merchandise appears in the photo. ms. g. lives in diourbel, a rural town located 150 km from dakar, the capital of senegal.

translated from french by dan kuey, kiva volunteer

abena is married with six children. although she has received no prior formal education, she is an entrepreneur who sells rice in enyaadze, near cape coast. abena has run her business for the past three years. her husband is a farmer. the proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

abena is requesting a loan to buy more rice to sell to increase her business. in the long term, she plans to reinvest her future profits into her business to help her expand and meet rising customer demand.

mrs. emelita is a good citizen of brgy. sibul, san miguel, bulacan. she is 61 years old and happily married to mr. bartolome who is managing their videoke rental business. they are blessed with 4 children and all of them are settled in marriage.

mrs. emelita has been engaged in the business of a sari-sari store for almost 30 years. her business is located at the front of sibul elementary school and most of her customers are students of the school. at her age, she hasn't stopped dreaming that someday her business will expand and grow to become a mini grocery store.

she has been a good client of alalay sa kaunlaran (aski) inc. for almost 7 years, and she was granted 6,000 php of loans. the loan proceeds will use in purchasing grocery items needed in her business.

benita, 53, is married and lives with her husband in their home in the community of san lorenzo.  an adopted daughter is dependent on her.  for two years she has had a grocery store where she sells soft drinks, dairy products, juices, staples, vegetables, cards, and other things.

benita is requesting 17,000.00 [hnl] to buy corn, beans, rice, lard, detergent, eggs, sausage, dairy products, and soft drinks.  with the support of this loan she plans to improve her income, and her business will grow as well.

benita is the leader of the solidarity group.  her colleagues (lidia, who sells food and candy, and santos, who sells used clothing in the neighborhoods of san lorenzo) have done well in naming benita the leader because she is the one who takes care of their payments.

benita's desire is to improve her business and for her family to be well, because after the death of her father and the hospitalization of her son for more than five months she has been in a bad way and off her stride.  her dream is to improve and for her colleagues to improve.

san lorenzo, honduras–july 2012

aasia is a 44-year-old hardworking woman who has five children. she has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality and is quite popular for her skills in stitching. aasia’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing, and over the years, she has established a good clientele.

aasia has requested a loan of 75,000 pkr. she intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and lace, to meet the demands of her customers more consistently. she aspires to save money for her family's prosperous future.

theresia, age 65, is a farmer. she and her husband farm mixed crops to earn a living. theresia earns a monthly income of kes 8,000, which she uses to support her family. this loan request marks her third loan term with kadet ltd. after having repaid her previous loans successfully. 

theresia would like to start a business raising and selling poultry to improve her income. with the loan she has requested from kadet ltd., she will be able to purchase one-day-old chicks and chicken feed. the additional income generated from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. in the future, theresia would like to buy dairy cows. 

she hopes to save enough money to expand her farmland.

careyl  operates a transportation business for a living. after three years of running her transportation business, careyl is happy to say that this helps her family a lot while awaiting the harvest from their crops. she has been able to sustain the business  and has plans to improve the services. she borrowed a loan from gdmpc micro finance to buy new tires to replace the old ones and accessories like helmets and raincoats. in the future, she wants to have a better standard of living with her family.

angeline has a retail shop in machakos town and has been running this business for five years. she is 32 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children. 

she will use this loan to expand her business by buying more goods such as flour, cooking fat, rice, sugar and cereals to sell. she will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

this is her first loan from visionfund kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

susan is 29 years old. she is married and has one child. she operates a welding business, making metal doors, window frames and wheelbarrows. she has been in the business for 5 years. 

this is her first loan with visionfund kenya. she will use the loan to buy metal for making doors, window frames and wheelbarrows and hopes this will enable her to make more income. she will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her child and buy food for the family. 

her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and become financially stable.

mansueta is single with 1 child. she is 53 years old and lives in rizal, zamboanga del norte. mansueta owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. she has been in this business for 4 years and earns php 3,000 each month. she has requested a loan of php 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. mansueta is a new member of kiva's partner, gdmpc. in the future, mansueta's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a car.\r\n

it is challenging to be young and starting a new family with a small parcel of land in the nyamira area of kenya. violet, a mother of one, has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past two years. 

violet, an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most kenyans that farming is for the older generation. she passionately loves dairy farming and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. violet's primary source of income has been selling eggs, crops, and milk. she also has a posho mill business to supplement her meager income.

violet wakes up early and milks her cows. the humble mom has been selling milk to her neighbors and the local market. she is known for having the best quality milk and through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. currently, she has more demand than she can supply. 

violet is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients. a dairy cow will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk daily. this will allow her to satisfy the demand for her milk. violet attended training sessions and learned financial management skills through kiva's field partner, juhudi kilimo. this loan will help her save money to fully repay the loan and to improve her living conditions.

this is 31 year-old marie. she is married and has 1 child aged 4. 

in 2008, marie established her stationery and printing shop business. she began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living and also assist her husband in running the home. working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about sll 1,723,800 every month from this business.  

she would like a loan in the amount of sll 5,000,000. marie has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stationery for resale. these loans have helped her a lot in paying school fees and taking care of some domestic problems. she hopes that this loan will enable her to meet her target and increase her monthly profit, which she feels good about.   

in the future, marie plans to expand and improve the business, and to continue to assist her husband and to educate their child. she thanks you for your support.

yeny is 28 years old and married with two children. she lives in the municipality of choloma in the department of cortes.  for the past three years, she has had her own business, which is a small grocery store that sells cleaning products, canned goods, rice, sugar, lard, vegetables, ham, condiments and other items. 

yeny is requesting this loan for 25,000 hnl to increase her inventory in order to improve her income. she will use the loan to buy rice, beans, lard, pet food, soft drinks, dairy products, sausages and other items to sell. yeny says that her plan is to expand her business so that she can give her children a good education.

shamim y. owns a boutique in a market near her home in multan, pakistan. she started this business because her husband’s income was not enough to cover the basic needs of the family. she has been doing this work for the last six years. she creates and sells stitched and embroidered clothing in her boutique which she prepares with the help of her daughters. they all work hard to show their work in all its variety to attract more customers.  

as her boutique is placed in the market, she faces high competition with other clothing shops. for this reason she always needs variety in her clothes so that the customers come to her.

she has applied for a loan from asasah (a micro-finance institution in pakistan and a partner of kiva) and will invest the capital in her boutique. this will help her to buy required materials in bulk such as fabric, thread and sketches and will increase her income. 

note: "shamim is showing her embroidery work in this picture".

carlos is 22 years old, single, and lives in his parents' house in nueva arica district, an area dedicated primarily to agricultural activities like ranching and tobacco farming. it is located one and a half hours away from the city of chiclayo. for two years, carlos has worked raising and selling animals. he raises poultry and small animals in pens behind his house. when they have reached a good size, he offers them for sale to businessmen who frequently visit the area to resell the animals in cayaltí district or in chiclayo. the income he receives from this business allows him to cover his personal expenses and help his parents with the family's expenses. carlos wants to expand his business by buying more animals and balanced feed. for this reason, he has for the first time asked edpyme alternativa for a loan of 1500 new soles. carlos is a calm and responsible young man. his neighbors and acquaintances hold him in great esteem and have a lot of confidence in him; they always find in him someone who is ready to help them.

translated from spanish by danielle maxson, kiva volunteer

jane is a married woman. she has six children with ages ranging from 12 years to 31 years. she describes herself to be a time keeper. she operates a farm where she keeps cows that produce milk for selling. she has been involved in this business for seven years. her primary customers are small scale. she describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. 

she will use the 50,000 kenyan shillings loan to buy a dairy cow. this is her fourth loan with smep microfinance bank. the previous loan was repaid successfully.

a rice grower originally from banteay meanchey province, pol is 47 years old and married. she is blessed with five children (three schoolchildren and two paid-workers). her current business returns her about 23,700 khr per day. pol is in the fourth cycle and formed a group of two to apply for a new loan with visionfund (kiva’s partner). she has fully repaid her past loan, which she utilized wisely to better support her business. \r\n\r\nnow, she is seeking 300,000 khr while her co-borrower is applying for 500,000 khr. as the group leader, pol will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees. she hopes to double her income so she can sustain her lifestyle.

everline is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. she rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

everline operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. she sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. she faces the challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation.

with the kes 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

batsayhan b. is 42, married and the father of two. his family lives in ulaanbaatar, the capital city of mongolia. his spouse, sarantsetseg, is unemployed and stays at home. batsayhan's eldest daughter is a university student, and his youngest attends elementary school. 

in 2005, batsayhan started his retail business along with a taxi service. when he began his business, he had only one vehicle and drove it himself. from his profit, he has been able to buy two more cars, which he rents out to other taxi drivers. 

his daily income per car is around 12,000 tugrug ($1.00 usd=1450 mnt), and his monthly income can reach over 1 million tugrug. with this loan, he will buy a refrigerator for his home. batsayhan is a hard-working person who wishes a happy life for his two daughters.

business description

ms. alexandra began her business four years ago, selling her products as a traveling saleswoman. she travelled between different sectors of her city, but decided in the end to place her business in her home. she sells basic needs items, and her sales increase evey day.

loan use

she is confident that this loan will allow her to purchase more merchandise for her store. with her customers continuning to ask for new products, she needs to stock a variety of items in order to satisfy the demand so that her customers don't take their business elsewhere.

personal information

she is 44 years old, her home is made of cement and her goal is to have a larger store within her home so that she can better tend to her customers, but this has been difficult as she has not had the capital to invest.

translated from spanish by kiva volunteer, kristin connor.

descripción del negocio

la señora alexandra empezó su negocio hace 4 años con un capital producto de venta de mercadería ambulante, ella recorría diferentes lugares de la ciudad pero decidió ponerse una tienda en su propia casa, vende productos de primera necesidad y su actividad en cuanto a las ventas han aumentado cada día mas

uso del préstamo

ella confía en el préstamo que se le entregue para de esta manera poder comprar mas mercadería para su tienda ya que los clientes cada día hacen nuevos pedidos, pues quiere tener variedad de productos para que así sus clientes no tengan que comprar en otros lugares.

información personal

tiene 44 años y un hijo, su vivienda es de cemento, sus metas siempre es tener un local grande en su casa para de esta manera poder atender la necesidad de sus clientes pero le ha sido difícil ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario.

gladys estela sánchez q. is 33 years old.  she lives in the town of la concepción together with her parents and siblings.  her future plans for her family are to bring drinking water to their home since they currently have to use barrels, buckets and a cart to make use of this vital liquid.  gladys has been working as a farmer for twelve years.  her parents support her in caring for her citrus crops and the other crops that she sows in order to survive.\r\n\r\nthe biggest problem that gladys faces is people stealing her produce since there is nobody looking after her crops at night-time.  gladys feels happy with the trust that afodenic has placed in her through their kiva funds.  she is a very humble person of limited financial resources but she is very hard working and responsible.

lolita is married with five children. lolita is 55 years old and lives in barra, tudela.

lolita is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. lolita has been doing this for three years. lolita has requested a loan of 30,000 philippines pesos (php) to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

lolita has been a member of pmpc for seven years. in the future, lolita hopes to improve and expand her business.

paul is a happily married man who lives in thika. he is a businessman and works together with his wife in the business to support the family. paul enjoys his job and likes serving his clients and meeting their needs. this business earns him good income, and his clients like the quality of his goods.

paul desires to grow his business, and he is requesting a loan of 70,000 kes. he will add stock of more potatoes, and his business will grow. he intends to use his profit to pay his loan and support his family. 

his dream is to educate his children to university.

zubaydullo is a resident of the hamadoni region. he is 34 years old, married, and has six children. 

zubaydullo works as a taxi driver. he has four years experience in this area. 

zubaydullo is taking a loan to repair his automobile.

the kind and gentle woman featured on this photo is named mehrangezi.  she comes from the hamadoni district, located in the khatlon province, in the southern part of tajikistan.

mehrangezi is not married yet and, at the moment, she is planning to expand her professional activity, in which she has been involved for the past seven years.  her business consists in producing various types of dairy products at home and reselling them at the local market.  thanks to her work, she helps her parents and she contributes to the budget of the family.

mehrangezi needs to buy a couple of dairy cows in order to produce large quantities of dairy products for resale and increase her income.  this loan means a lot to her and she is awaiting your help.  please support her.

gulsara d. owns a food stand, conveniently located at the spitamen food market in tajikistan. she sells a variety of groceries but specializes cookies and sweets. she has grown her business and developed strong relationships with loyal customers. she urgently needs a loan to be able to meet the increased demand, for food and sweets in her community, caused by the holiday season.

nilo is 47 years old, married, and lives in lawis, sindangan, zamboanga del norte. as a microfinance member of paglaum mpc, he is given priority in financial services to alleviate his present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other training in which he actively participated. nilo had seen the changes in his general living conditions from the moment he signed up for membership with the cooperative.

this time, he ask a loan of php 45,000 to purchase materials for boat making, such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

meet mamusu, a 48-year-old married woman from jui western rural area in freetown. she has six children. 

for more than 20 years, mamusu has been establishing her traditional clothing material business. she began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. she works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., seven days per week. she says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand it.

mamusu requires a loan in order to purchase more traditional clothing material for resale. she hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and increase her business. in the future, mamusu plans to expand her business to a higher level. she thanks you for your support.

mrs. martha b. is originally from bluefields. martha is 50 years old and her life long mate, mr. benacio quintero, is 51 years old. the two of them have five children, three of which still live at home. mrs. balladeres owns a grocery store, which she has had for more than 15 years. her clients range from children to men and women of all ages and they appreciate that she sells a wide variety of products (basic necessities, canned goods, school supplies, and personal hygiene).mrs. b. wants to purchase 2 glass display cases so that she can better exhibit her pastries, sweet breads, and cosmetics. this will allow her to increase the variety of the products she offers. each window costs $139.00.

translated from spanish by casey unrein, kiva volunteer.

la sra. martha b. es originaria de la ciudad de bluefields, tiene 50 años de edad, su pareja de vida es el sr. benacio quintero de 51 años,ambos tiene 5 hijos, 3 viven con la pareja. la sra. b. es la propietaria de una abarroteria , teniendo más de 15 años de experiencia, siendo sus clientes niños, hombre y mujeres de todas las edades prefiriendola por ofrecer variedades de productos (productos basicos, productos enlatados, productos escolares, productos de cuido personal). la sra. b. quiere comprar 2 vitrinas de vidrio para poder exhibir productos de reposteria o de pan dulce y de cosmesticos de esta manera poder aumentar la variedad de productos que oferta, cada vitrina cuesta $139.00 dolares.

rheami is 30 years old and married with two children. with both children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

rheami runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 25,000 loan through nwtf to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

rheami has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as candies, canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, etc.

in the future, rheami would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

anthony is married with three children. he has received some schooling till the end of middle school. currently, anthony sells meat and prepares kebabs in ve-golokwati (near hohoe). he has been involved in this industry for about 11 years now. his wife is a petty trader. anthony’s income goes toward helping his wife pay for the family's general expenses. \r\n\r\nanthony will use the loan to increase his existing meat supply. with the new profits from his expanded enterprise, anthony plans to develop his business further by venturing into newer markets.

jean claude is a 34-year-old man from the rulindo district in the northern province of rwanda.

he is seeking a loan of 30,000 rwanda francs (rwf) to purchase 10 rechargeable led lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 rwf.

jean claude started selling lights in august 2012 and has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. he is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife marie chantel, and their 3 children.

amadu, a babban gona maize farmer, is married and lives in a modest mud house with his family in farinji village. amadu is a meticulous farmer who has invested time and resources in his farm and like every parent, hopes to see his four children work twice as hard and become successful in the future.

previously, despite toiling for long hours on his farm, amadu was only able to feed his family 2 meals a day. now that he is a babban gona member, amadu can improve his yield and, as a result, feed his family, through access to high quality inputs, such as fertilizers, herbicides and better yielding seeds. luckily, as a babban gona member, amadu will be provided with a full suite of the best inputs to optimize his farm and increase his yield up to 3.8 metric tonnes per hectare, 2 times the national average.

with increased yield and income of up to 2.8 times the national average, amadu looks forward to using his additional income to purchase more farm lands.

amadu is a happy babban gona farmer and holds the moment when he gained good yield as his best memory as a babban gona member. amadu looks forward to a brighter future with babban gona as he too has joined the fight against poverty.

marife is a married woman with four children. she is a very hard working entrepreneur. marife is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

marife has a food vending business in the philippines. marife requested a php 11000 loan amount through nwtf to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, margarine, etc. for her food production business.

marife has been in this business for 5 years. in the future, marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

césar, 55, lives with his wife and four children in a house of his own.  he’s carried out a variety of occupations throughout the years.  césar works growing such things as corn, tubers, quinoa and wheat on land he leases with partners.  once harvested, each crop is sold in the city of lima where he earns good income.  as a result of this, he got the idea to sell green grains and together with his children started this business which in time became very profitable.  now, he earns steady income from this business and he’s sure it will increase.  but what he likes best is raising animals.  he owns cows, bulls and goats that he cares for very diligently and when he’s going through an economic tight spot he sells them to whatever butcher offers him the best price.

this is his 3rd kiva loan.  he feels grateful for the financial support he gets to continue moving forward and commits to make his payments punctually.  césar will use the 3,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish his next crops.

efua grew up in poverty without an education but this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. currently, she is an entrepreneur who sells rice porridge in esiam, near cape coast. her business has grown substantially since she started a number of years ago. efua uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their child. she has identified growing customer demand but is unable to meet it due to her limited inventory capacity. 

efua is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to make and sell more rice porridge. with the profits from her loan, she wants to buck the trend by ensuring that her child will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

faith n. is the leader of her group in lugazi. she is a friendly and hard working lady with a retail shop business in sabwa that she has owned for 20 years.

faith says that when she had just started there was very limited competition in her business, hence she made more money from many sales, but now due to a lot of competition her profits keep on deteriorating and this is why she takes loans.

she would like a loan to help increase her stock of goods in her shop so that it could become a one-stop shop for her customers. perhaps in future she can turn it into wholesale. she would also like to build rental houses for future developments.

faith is a married lady who takes care of 12 children aged 28 – 13 years, as she takes care of her siblings. she would like to ensure that she educates all of them. her previous loans have helped her keep a steady supply of goods in her shop and to pay school fees for her children on time.

gemma is 49 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are currently in school.

gemma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the philippines. she requested a php 12,000 loan through nwtf to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

gemma has been pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from nwtf to sustain her business.

in the future, gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

kasichana is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

she is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, maize flour, and sugar that will help her to provide inventory for her business. she is grateful for the new support she has received.

rose is a happily married business lady.  she operates her business in a village in kisumu town where she also lives with her family.  rose enjoys her business which she has been doing for many years now.  she delights in selling food to her clients as she interacts with them in the process.  she sells sorghum, millet, rice, beans, eggs and other cereals.  she likes this business since it earns her daily bread and keeps her busy throughout the day.  she has been meeting many clients who have been requesting services from her.   she has been challenged with a low working capital.  with a kiva loan of kes.20,000, rose will add stock of sorghum and millet to boost her business.  this will increase her daily income and profit which she intends to use to pay her loan.  this is her first loan with eclof kenya.  her dream is to send her children to university and grow her business.

mr. polo t. (in the photo with his wife) is 38 years old and his wife, mrs. srung hoem is 44 years old. they have been married since 1992 and have four children--three sons and one daughter. two of them are in school and the other two are still young and stay at home. the family lives along national road number one, about seventeen kilometers from phnom penh city. 

polo and his wife are farmers. they grow vegetables such as green beans, cucumbers and cauliflower on their farmland in the village. the couple does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their vegetable farm.

hence polo is asking for his first loan of us$ 500 to provide his capital.

maria was born in maputo city, maputo province in southern mozambique. she is single and has one child who goes to school. maria finished teacher education for elementary teachers but did not continue because she did not have enough time. she lives in her own house with her family and supports her parents, who live with her.

she has been a teacher for more than 12 years. she teaches in boane district and has a salary of 5,640 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. she also saves some in her bank account (at bim).

maria has had loans from other banks (bim), and she was able to pay them back with no problems. she learned about hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. this is maria's first hluvuku loan. she is asking for 20,000 meticais so she can buy materials (planks, beams, sand, stone, iron and other items) to continue construction on her home.

maria promises to make her payments on time. she plans to finish her house and furnish it one day. to do this, she will ask hluvuku for more loans.

maribel, is aged 37, a single mother of two children. she has owned and managed a retail store in her town for almost two years and earns a net income of php 600 daily. her net income on this business is usually spent on the school allowances of her children.

due to insufficient capital for her business she would like to request a loan amounting to php 30,000 to purchase canned goods, rice, juices, food seasonings, beverages, and noodles to sell. she's hoping that her business will continue to grow profitably.

erlinda is 59 years old and married with six children. erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

erlinda runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 11000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, beverages, liquor, personal product care and other groceries.

erlinda has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items. 

in the future, erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

filoteo is 52, married, and the father of one child who is 16 years old. he knows that he has to work hard for the future of his family and does this by raising hogs. the profits he earns from selling them supports his family, and he believes that he has a big future in this kind business. that is why he is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise, feed, and sell to people who live in his town. he believes that with more capital, he can expand his business and pay for his child's education. filoteo is from ronda, cebu.

kanini is a 46-year-old farmer. she is a single mother of two children. she has been practicing mixed farming for the past two years with a monthly income of kes 5,000 which she uses to support her family. kanini is applying for her first loan term with kadet ltd after she was recently introduced by a kadet staff member. 

she will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings to yield more produce. with the anticipated profits from the business she will purchase more dairy cows. 

her dream is to venture into large scale farming and improve family's living standards.

mercy n. lives in the kisaasi neighborhood in the city of kampala, uganda.  she is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  mercy  has a restaurant business.  she has been in this business for 5 years and she works 6 days out of every week. mercy sells her products in a shop on a  retail basis.

mercy has requested a loan of 500,000 ugandan shillings from mcdt sacco, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice and beef.  the main business challenges for mercy include transportation and the rainy season.  her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel.

mercy lives in a home that she rents.  she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

ricardina is a borrower who belongs to the “inmaculada concepcion de echarati” communal bank. this bank is located in the district of echarate, province of la convención and department of cuzco.

ricardina is a hardworking person. she is 42 years old, married and has two children. she starts work very early, caring for her crops. she grows vegetables and yucca. she has worked hard at this since she was very young in order to give her family a better quality of life and a better education to her children.

she is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, compost, seeds and insecticide.

this borrower if grateful and committed to making her payments on time.

thelma is a humble woman, hardworking and persevering. she is 68 years old and works selling vegetables from her home. thelma began her business nine years ago as she is retired and needed to have another source of income to cover all the expenses.

thelma wants her business to grow which is why she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, fruits, soft drinks, and other items. thelma can generate more income and improve her quality of life with the support of kiva lenders.

s. muhiba describes herself as a hard-working, enterprising and happy married mother of two children. her husband is a laborer. she decided to start a tailoring business to help him with household expenses. she wanted her children to get an education and that wasn't possible on her husband's salary alone. she started by helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop. after she learned the business well, she installed a small shop in her home. during the last 20 years, the business has gone very well and grown. \r\n

\r\nnow muhiba is requesting a loan of 2500 somoni ($750). she plans to use the loan to purchase modern materials so she can fulfill her customers' requests for national dresses. muhiba and her family are very grateful for your support in helping this business grow and move ahead.

margarita b. is a very hard-working woman who sells bananas in her stall in the mayoreo market daily. she starts her work day very early in the morning and continues until dusk. she is asking for funding to buy bananas from her suppliers so that she can continue to sell them in her stall in the market.

translated from spanish by michael bujazan, kiva volunteer

emelyn is a 59-year-old widow with seven children.

emelyn has been agricultural business raising pigs in the philippines for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from nwtf to sustain it. she is now requesting a php 12,000 loan through nwtf to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

in the future, emelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

saira is 31 years old and has three children (ages 10, 5, and 2). the house in which she lived collapsed during the earthquake and only rubble remains. she lost a few things and now she currently lives in a shelter she put together that is covered by plastic tarps.

saira sells clothing through catalogs. her husband is a seller of general merchandise. with this new loan from fundación espoir, she will be able to purchase clothing from the catalogs so that she can fulfill her orders since she lacks the money to accomplish this. part of the loan will be used to buy food products that her husband can sell as a street vendor.

blanca is a 56-year-old independent businesswoman who seized an opportunity to provide a better quality of life for her family. she is a mother and the head of her household, which includes her three grown children. at a very young age, blanca began working at the neighborhood pharmacies.

this entrepreneur decided to become her own boss by selling medicines at the pharmacy she manages. she has two years of experience as a business owner. blanca wants to invest in a large inventory of medicines with high turnover. for this reason, she is applying for her first kiva loan through fundación mario santo domingo. blanca will use the money to buy medicines in bulk such as acetaminophen, a broad spectrum of antibiotics, antacids, and other products. please support her with this microloan.

andrea is 33 years old and married with three children. with one of her children in school, andrea works very hard to provide for them.

andrea runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 11,000 loan through nwtf in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

andrea has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

in the future, andrea would like to save enough money to expand her business.

mwanasha is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

she has operated a fish-selling business for over five years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. she faces a major challenge of seasonality and perish ability leading to losses.

with the kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. she dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

tafadzwa lives in a district in zimbabwe with her family. she has been successfully selling second-hand clothing and bags. when she got her first loan, she also expanded into selling new clothes. tafadzwa successfully repaid the first loan. 

during her spare time, tafadzwa volunteers as a community health trainer at the local schools, teaching students about health issues. 

with the requested loan tafadzwa intends to buy more clothing and bags so that she can boost her sales and increase profits to enable her to build her own clothing shop.

candida lives in ermera. she is married and has three children. she has been involved in business activities since 2010; she started with her own working capital of $500. her husband is a driver. 

now she is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business, so she is taking a loan from tuba rai metin. she will use it to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including slippers, detergents, cooking oils, milks, sardines, biscuits, aqua, sugar, salts, candles, cigarettes and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

she is happy because with the loan from tuba rai metin, she can run her business to be bigger in the future and her income can be increased. 

she has animals at her house like pigs, chickens and dogs.

nigora is a lady from khujand city, the city where she grew up and where she now lives. she is a very peaceful and responsible woman. she completed a sewing course and has been working at sewing for 2 years. she has great interest in and passion for her work. she is a married and careful mother of two children. she works with great desire and has been working very well. she has regular customers. 

nigora's sewing machine has broken and she is requesting a loan to buy a new one and continue her business. since her family's expenses have increased since her child was ill, she doesn't want to lose a source of income and is trying to pull herself out of this situation.

sarah used her last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. her business has grown and become successful. sarah is requesting a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. in the future, she hopes to be able to continue to expand her business.

jocelyn g. helps her husband ramiro run a motorcycle taxi business. he drives the moto, earning the income needed to meet the needs of their family including the education of their children. they are doing their best in sending their children to school. three of them are in high school and the youngest is still in elementary school.\r\n\r\naside from assisting her husband, jocelyn also serves as a barangay health worker in their village of banquero reina mercedes, isabela. she works as a preschool teacher and has a monthly honorarium of php 1,000 from the village funds which is also a big help in providing their basic needs. when there are no classes during summer, jocelyn sells barbecue, boiled eggs, and snacks in the village to earn extra income. to help her husband in the maintenance of their taxi business, she would like to take out a loan of php 5,000 from the kiva lenders.

elenita is married and has three children. she signed up for membership with pmpc and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. she is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her.

elenita was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. she wants to take advantage of the good fortune. recently, she took a loan to restock her store with items like canned goods and other basic commodities. in the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

recardina fernando r. was born in the district of magude, in the province of maputo in the south of mozambique. she is 35 years old, is divorced, and has 3 children who are 15, 10 and 4 years old. the two older children attend school. recardina only studied through 7th grade, and didn't continue because of a long illness. she lives with her children in a house provided for her by family members and helps support her siblings by sending them money to help with household expenses. she left magude for boane with her parents in 1987, in search of better living conditions. she has had her own business for more than 16 years, having started after her separation, and has one employee who helps her with her work. she has a monthly income of around 6000 meticales. she uses this money to cover household expenses and she is also able to save some in her bank account. recardina has never taken out a loan with another bank. she found out about hluvuku [the kiva field partner] through friends who also work with the institution. this is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 9000 meticales. she plans to use this money to buy construction materials (metal plates, beams, cement, iron, sand and other items) in order to continue working on the construction of her home. her earlier loan was for 9000 meticales and was used for the same purpose. she promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. in the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish her house and offer her children a more comfortable life.

translated from portuguese by catherine fountain, kiva volunteer

bilquis baji is the wife of mr. a. and resides in the city of pakpattan, pakistan. pakpattan city is famous for its shrine of great punjabi sufi poet, babar fareed ganj shakkar. she has been living in this city for the past 10 years. she is the mother of two sons, both of whom are auto-rickshaw drivers (the local three-wheeled motor vehicle). bilquis baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. she is applying for a loan to buy another rickshaw for her eldest son, so that he able to increase his profits as a transit driver.

this is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by four other members. the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. kaneez baji wants a loan to buy a mirror and chair for her beauty salon. zafran baji also wants a loan to buy a rickshaw. mukhtayar baji wants a loan to buy tools for her vehicle repair workshop. saima baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes for her cigarette selling business. the members mutually guarantee one another's loans. if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

estrella l. is from the village of lubid, aurora, zamboanga del sur. she is 49 years old. estrella is married and has five adult children. 

to make a living, estrella makes and sells food and drinks for passengers in the bus terminal. estrella has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 php a month.

in 2011, estrella joined gdmpc to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. estrella is requesting a loan of 5,000 php, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook snacks for sale. this will be the first loan taken out by estrella from gdmpc. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

about gdmpc:

gdmpc is one of the most progressive cooperatives in mindanao, philippines. it has seven branches covering the provinces of zamboanga del sur, lanao del norte and misamis occidental. its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

iluminada, 56 years old, is a patient mother with three children who are presently working and have own families. iluminada manages a hog fattening and breeding business to earn a living. she doesn't want to rely on her children's remittances so she keeps improving her sales. iluminada is now asking for a loan of php 30,000 to buy vaccines, medicines and feed to maintain her hogs. the vaccines and medicines given to her hogs will ensure good nutrition and allow her to offer them at a higher price upon disposal. iluminada hopes to someday make her business grow very well to achieve income stability and the desired success in her life.

joyce is a kiva borrower. she has four children. she operates a retail business where she sells clothes. she has been involved in this business for four years. her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. she describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

she will use the kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. this is her fifth loan with smep microfinance bank. her previous loans were repaid successfully.

pov is 50 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are employed in various positions and two are going to school. pov earns a living by farming in kandal province. with the support of her husband, she owns and manages a two-hectare farm for growing khmer longans and mung beans, which she sells in the local markets. pov is borrowing usd 800 loan to hire laborers to work on her plantation. she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

norma, 47, is the one who supports her household. for four years she has been running her own kiosk selling beverages and fast food at a university in esteli.

norma came to micredito to request a loan to restructure her home. through a kiva loan she was able to build a bathroom.

now norma is requesting a second loan to buy products such as rice, chicken, vegetables, oil, etc. for the upcoming university season. she is confident she can continue counting on kiva to grow her family economy.

shahida is a 42-years old married woman. her financially condition is not good. her son has been driving moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw). this rickshaw is being drive over local roads and for small distances. its body made by polyester which is not enough strong to bear jerks over roads. now the rickshaw body needs to be replace because it has rattled during driving. this is the reason her son wants to buy a new body for moto rickshaw.

shahida requested a loan of 50,000 pkr so that her son can buy the rickshaw body, so that he could drive it smoothly. shahida thanks kiva and field partner, brac pakistan.

agripina, 40, is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband and their 3 children in the village of orcopampa, located in arequipa. she sells groceries, and is asking for this loan so she can buy soft drinks, increase sales and raise her earnings so she can afford to send her children to school. agripina hopes to be able to make improvements to her home in the future, so she and her children can live comfortably and in good health.

januaris is 27 years old. he is married and blessed with one child. his business is photography, farming and livestock keeping. he has been in the business for five years.

he earns a monthly income of twenty two thousand kenya shillings. this is his first loan term with visionfund kenya. he will use the loan to buy fertilizer and animal feeds.

he will use the profits from expanded business to increase his savings as well as educate his children. his hopes and dreams are to expand his business.

bulgamaa d. is a 30-year-old widow living in bayanhongor aimar, one of mongolia's central provinces. her husband passed away a few years ago and now she lives with her 12-year-old son who is a 6th grade student in a local secondary school. bulgamaa sells various food products in a small stall that she rents in a local market. she has been in the food retail business since 2000 when she first bought a small container - a place to hold her products to sell to the locals. since her start in 2000, she has been successful, and her small business is the only source of income for her family. with her business profit, she was able to purchase a small piece of land, on which she currently lives with her son.  in the future, she hopes to build a small store where she would be able to sell her food products. she requests a loan to build up inventory for her business.\t\t\n

lourdes is 45 years old and married with two children, and works very hard to provide for them.

she runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 13,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, snack foods, noodles, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

lourdes has been in this business for 3 years.

in the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

catherine is the group leader of her group in kakamega north district, and she is representing 14 farmers, including herself. she is married and a proud mother of three children. catherine joined one acre fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for more than 20 years.

like many other farmers, catherine decided to work with one acre fund in order to earn enough to feed her family. she hopes that by joining one acre fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of one acre fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. she plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

catherine's group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 8 acres of land. they will also receive a total of 8 solar lights, as, even though catherine decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

awa dialbang, age 53, is the mother of three children. she's married, and she's been a member of the village bank of kadior for seven and a half years and already benefited from 15 consecutive loans. she transforms mil into porridge that she sells. her profits enable her to take part in covering the various expenses of her family.

translated from french by patrick stadelmann, kiva volunteer

christine, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and is now proud to represent her group of four farmers in teso district. she is 75 years old, is married, and has 10 children.

christine likes to think of herself as a very resourceful person. she has been working alongside one acre fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of one acre fund farmers. she says that being part of the one acre fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. christine plans to use the profits from this coming season to repair her home.

in total, christine’s group will receive inputs to cultivate 2.75 acres of land. given that one member of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive 1 solar light.

this is the "caminando juntos" group, made up of 7 members wishing to improve their quality of life.

this is virginia\'s story, who is 52 years old and single. she makes a living selling women\'s and men\'s clothing. she has been working in this business for over approximately 10 years, and is doing well. her greatest wish is to be able to expand her business. she is seeking a loan to buy blouses, bermuda shorts and polo shirts.

the members of the "caminando juntos" group want to thank kiva\'s investors for the support they have given. virginia is one situated second from the right,

mariam is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school. she doesn’t take care of any additional family members. mariam has a business of selling green bananas and has been doing this for 10 years. she has applied for a loan of 2000000 ugandan shillings from mcdtsacco to buy more bunches of green bananas. mariam works six days a week at the market, and sells on a retail basis only. her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. she aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. she resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying for utility bills.

esmeralda is 40 years old and married with two children, who are in school. esmeralda works very hard to provide for them.

esmeralda runs a general store in the philippines and has requested a 15,000 philippine peso loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home-care products, and other groceries.

esmeralda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. in the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

nasreen is 53; she is married, living with her husband and three sons in the area of lahore, pakistan. she is pictured with her son.

her financial condition is neither good nor bad. her son does not earn enough to contribute to the household expenses. he is a furniture maker and makes very fine furniture such as wooden beds, chairs, tables, and cots. he has been doing this work for years and has a lot of experience. now he has a contract for making speaker boxes but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy the raw material to fulfill the contract on time.

therefore, nasreen has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner brac pakistan, so that her son can buy raw material such as wooden planks, nails, glue, and chipboard to continue his business.

nasreen thanks kiva’s field partner brac pakistan and feels happy about this loan.

mrs. mohan maiya r. lives in tangal, located in lalitpur district, an area where most people are engaged in small business. mohan has two sons, one currently studying in grade 12 and the other passing his slc (school leaving certificate) exam this year.

both she and her husband operate a small restaurant, a business they started nine years ago. they sell a variety of items, including tea, coffee and newari food for which there is a high demand. now mohan is requesting a loan of rs 30,000 loan to both expand her business and purchase necessary food materials.

shirly works hard to support her family. she is married and has a business selling pork rinds in the philippines.
shirly requested a php 22,000 loan through nwtf to purchase more pork rinds to sell.
she successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.
in the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

janet del socorro has been a teacher in one of the public schools in the city of león for more than 25 years, giving her students the bread of knowledge.  this job has been a calling as well as the support of her family for a long time.

janet del socorro is the mother of two children, one of whom is in school.  it has become difficult to buy school supplies and pay tuition because of her low income.  she's already a ceprodel client, so she went to request support to defray these expenses.

melba is 26 years old. she is a hard-working woman who started selling paper goods to help with the household expenses.

now she has a small shop in the front part of her home. she sells paper goods and household items from 7 a.m to 8 p.m. she has great aspirations for her business, and for this reason she wants to increase the inventory she has in her paper goods shop. with the loan, she wants to buy display cases, notebooks, pens, etc. 

in the future, she wants to have a large paper goods store, to generate more income and give her two children the economic foundation they need.

rocio is a women who is dedicated to her family and her work. her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead, overcoming the various obstacles on her way.

sixteen years ago she started her own business, a beauty salon which is located in a space in the house she resides in. she also offers service to homes according to the needs of her clients. she works 12 hours per day.

this allows her to generate sufficient resources to help her husband with the household finances and cover the needs of their three children.

she will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of a hair dryer and supplies wholesale (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioner and nail polish amongst others) furniture and renovations to her shop. this will allow her to continue with her work and offer a more complete service to her clients, in a more flexible and efficient manner. this will benefit the margin of profit that she gets from her labor.

rocio says that her greatest wish is to be able to continue her work, position and strengthen her business in order to become more competitive in the market and thus have the capacity to provide a higher quality of living for her family.

lillian is a 30-year-old married woman with one child. she owns and operates a retail shop, where she sells sugar, bread, sweets, maize, flour, and wheat flour. she has ten years of experience in this line of business.

\r\n\r\nas a prudent businesswoman, she has been saving her money with machakos mwangaza group members in faulu kenya. the group members also guarantee each others' loan. she previously took out a loan in the amount of 30,000 kes through the group. she used that loan, which she promptly repaid, to improve and expand her business. by doing so, her group members now have faith in her. hence, she has been allowed to seek another loan, this time in the amount of 50,000 kes ($625). with the loan proceeds, she would like to buy sugar, maize, flour, and sweets for re-sale purposes. lillian hopes to expand her business to generate more income so that she can pay school fees for her child. she is ambitious and dreams of expanding her shop into a wholesale store.

mizaaj lives in a mid-sized city called vehari in pakistan with her family. she has six children; three of them are getting their education while two of the other three work to support their family and one of them is jobless and looking for a job. 

mizaaj has applied for a loan for the third time from asasah to financially support her husband who sells animals. he has been doing this business for the last thirty-five years. he buys young animals, goats and buffaloes, raises them, and sells them to earn an income. 

with the loan amount, her husband will buy more animals for selling. mizaaj is hopeful that this investment will give them good returns and improve their living standard.

doung s., 28, is a grocery seller from her house in her village and her average income is $1.5 per day. her husband is a farmer and can make around $1 per day. they live with two children in chan sery village, pursat province. now s. seeks a loan of $100 to purchase grocery stocks for her business.

mrs. suong k., 50, is a widow and lives with her single daughter in kampong cham province, cambodia. to supplement her household, k. works selling traditional khmer cake and generally earns around $3.50 each day.\r\n

she intends to open a small grocery store for her daughter so that she will be able to help generate additional income. mrs. suong k. has recently applied for a loan to help her and her daughter to open and run the small grocery store.

safaraly is married and has four children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. it’s for this reason that ten years ago, he began his own business with taxi driving. thanks to the good service, he has managed to gain many customers. since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving, now his children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. 

safaraly is asking for a loan to buy new car. 

in this way, safaraly's business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income. this will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

song’s group lives in a rural village in kandal province in cambodia. song works as a farmer to support his family. in his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help song safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

karina lives with her common-law husband and has two children who are in school. karina rents a store where she sells spare parts and car accessories. she started doing this four years ago. karina is a member of the "las golondrinas" ["the swallows"] communal bank and she is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy timing belts. karina dreams of building her own house, because she currently lives in her in-laws' house. she also dreams of expanding her business by opening a workshop.

translated from spanish by katie kavanagh, kiva volunteer

comfort is thirty-three years old. she is married and has given birth to five children who are between the ages of one and seventeen years. she lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the community. her husband is a security man.

comfort is a hard-working woman. she is into the palm oil production business. she has been producing palm oil for the past twelve years and has acquired rich experience in her business. comfort buys her raw materials (palm nuts) from nearby communities. it is her desire to give all her children a good education.

comfort is the leader of a six-member trust bank group called ‘james’. the group is made up mainly of traders. they are requesting the loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

meet teresia, a farmer living in kisii, a prime area for banana and sugarcane growing. she is married and has three children; she has practiced farming for 21 years.  she produces and sells milk, tea, and eggs. she says that farming is her source of funds, and that's why she enjoys doing it and producing the best out of her farm. her major challenge is poor roads, which leads to difficulty in accessing the local market.

teresia chose juhudi kilimo for this loan because they help small-scale farmers to grow economically, and they always train farmers before giving out loans to them. and their loans are always at a low interest rate.

this loan will help her purchase a dairy cow, which will lead to an increase in milk production and thus an increase in income.

this will ensure that her children receive a good education, and also improve her family's living standards.

mariluza is 30 years old and is a single mother with 2 children. they live together in her own home, located in the district of pichari. the business that she runs is a document photocopying service. she began with a small photocopier in very small premises, but, thanks to loans from mfp and money that she had saved, she bought herself a professional machine and now she can complete jobs in a shorter time and she can scan and enlarge. during the school season, she works next to a high school in rented premises, and this is a good location for gaining customers and this means she generates good income. she works alone during the day, but her eldest daughter takes her place in the afternoons. she is happy and grateful to mfp, which was the organization that gave her a hand to be able to grow her business. in the future, she wants to build a house. this will be her second loan from mfp, and she promises to make her repayments on time. she will use the $375 to buy bond paper and printer ink. \r\n\r\n

lesbia is a hard-working, elderly woman who is devoted to her family.  she currently works in an elementary school as well as working as a seamstress which has been her profession for years.  she is a single mother and has been improving her house little by little with the help of loans from our organization.  for example, she really needed to put up partitions in one of her rooms and managed to do this.  with this loan she will improve her house's hygiene.  she will buy a toilet to install and also other materials such as sand, cement, adhesive, etc.

n. teddy is the leader of her lending group in lugazi. she is a widow with six children; three of them are at the university and three have completed their studies and have their own families. \r\n

\r\nteddy has a restaurant in najjembe that she has been running for a long time. she has been able to win many clients because of her experienced cooking and good customer care. her customers are mostly the traders in the najjembe market and truck drivers who rest in the area. teddy usually buys her foodstuffs in large quantities at a less cost, and she wants to stock more foodstuffs for her restaurants.

marlinda is a resident of the town of ubay, bohol. she is married and has three dependents. she runs a barber shop for a living. she has been in this business for three years now, serving locals in her town.

she wants to have a concrete toilet. that is why she has decided to join kiva's field partner cevi and use a loan to buy materials for toilet construction, such as hollow concrete blocks, coco lumber (a sustainable alternative to rainforest lumber), steel bars, nails, a toilet bowl, sand, and cement.

through this loan, marlinda's family will enjoy a comfortable toilet that they may avail themselves of in the coming months. in addition, it also boosts safety, especially when the need arises during nighttime.

mely works hard to support her family. mely is married with four children and has a water-refilling station business in the philippines.

mely requested a php 7,000 loan through nwtf to buy more materials for her business.

mely has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

she would like to save money to expand her business.

mwanarusi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. she owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. her greatest monthly expense is school fees .

she operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. she faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

with the kshs 35,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

47-year-old lina is a kind, friendly woman.  she is the mother of three children, who are 24, 21 and 16 years old, and her children live with her in her own home.  lina's business is designing and making clothing.  she also repairs clothing that her customers bring to her, restoring them to a perfect condition. lina has a small workshop in her home and she has been doing this work for 18 years.  it has allowed her to feed her family and provide her children with a good education.  lina works alone and is very happy because her business is going well even though her number of customers decreases at certain times of year.
