when she started sewing for a living, lina experienced a number of problems stemming from a lack of experience such as inaccurately cutting her fabric or not picking the right fabric for each garment.  however, she learned from experience and also from the training that she sought out and received to improve her skills.

on this occasion, lina is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles.  she is very grateful to be receiving this financial support and pledges to make her repayments on time.  she will use the sum she has requested to buy materials so that she can continue working.  she will buy elastic, fabric, buttons, patches, lace, colored threads and other products.

nancy is a seamstress who lives in the city of barranquilla. she's a native of bucaramanga and arrived with her husband and brother-in-law to this city to start her clothing shop. this partnership was unsuccessful and her spouse and brother-in-law decided to look for other jobs. however, nancy had faith that with persistence she could reach her goal so she continued with the business.

today, this extraordinary woman has an established business which produces large volumes of garments to order for her customers who are mostly located in the city of santa marta, the municipality of soledad and stores in the center of barranquilla.
her working day starts at 7 a.m. and ends at 8 p.m. and while she works she also tends to her two young sons aged 9 and 2 years old.

she's currently requesting her first kiva loan, through mario santo domingo foundation, to buy raw materials and inputs for dressmaking at wholesale, including fabrics, threads, zippers, liners, and buttons.

with this investment, she will be able to take care of her customers and attract new ones. support this woman; do it now!

seema baji is the wife of l. a. and lives in a city named kasur, pakistan. kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and holy places. she is the mother of six children: two daughters and four sons. her daughters and her younger son are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. she has been living in this city for the last 40 years. seema baji’s husband manufactures clothes and sells them to different markets. he has been in this business for the last 26 years. seema baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. she is applying for a loan to buy thread to manufacture more clothes to sell in market.

marifel is 39 years old and married with two children. with both children in school, marifel works very hard to provide for them.

marifel runs a general store in the philippines. she has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items.

marifel requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk food and other groceries.

in the future, marifel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

liza s. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of central lopez, sagay city. she is married and has one school-age child. to make a living, liza owns and operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in her community. liza has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 philippine pesos (php) a month. in 2003, liza joined nwtf to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 php from nwtf. liza is now requesting a new loan of 17,000 php which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. this will be her 7th loan from nwtf. liza plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house. about nwtf: in a world full of challenges, negros women for tomorrow foundation, inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to realities surpassing their dreams. they have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. this is project dungganon.

adjo is a 49-year-old woman.  she is married to a pastor.  she has two children, age 14 and 11, who both attend school.

she has been reselling condiments and general food products since 2005.  she stocks up in lomé and sells in a shop.

she has requested her second loan from wages in order to buy general food products such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil etc.  she wants to reinvest in her activity.

in the coming years, adjo would like to increase her stock of merchandise.  she says that with the profits, she plans to offer a better education to her children.

nicolas is a 55-year-old married father to 5 children. he sells foodstuffs from his home. his commercial activity is a substantial asset in meeting his family's day-to-day needs and supporting his children's education.

nicolas is a hard-working merchant who wishes to further invest in his business. he is seeking this loan to bolster his stock of foodstuffs to sell.

rebecca t. is a 42-year-old mother of six. her husband rudy is a fisherman. she sells fish caught by her husband to support the needs of the family. the family resides in the central town of the province where opportunities are rare for those who have no education. 

the couple was able to survive the challenges of life with their six children by their industry and courage to continue what they are doing. rebecca was challenged when ashi (ahon sa hirap, inc.) entered in their village, bringing a doorstep of hope for mothers like her, with dreams of getting out of poverty if given the chance. she did not think twice about getting a loan to start up a new venture. she applied for this loan to buy one pig for fattening, buy and re-sell fish, and make foods for snacks.

rebecca hopes that with the new businesses, she will be able to support the daily needs of her children. she hopes that in the future, she can establish a restaurant.

this loan of $600.00 will be offered to jose to send his daughter, berta, to university. he is very supportive of his daughter because he hopes his daughter will have a brighter future. he will use the loan to pay for registration fees and all school materials. jose loves his daughter very much and he hopes his daughter's future will be successful. his daughter is not in this photo because she is in school in another capital.

mr. akossi is married to a farmer. he is the father of seven children aged 2 to 18, five of whom go to school. born in 1984, he has been a farmer since 2000. he appreciates his work and is fully dedicated to it as a means of capitalizing on what the land has to offer.  six people assist him with his work. he usually gets his supplies in sokode (central region). 

he is seeking this third loan to buy farming equipment, which will help to improve his yield and satisfy customer demand. 

he is the representative of the group lanso consisting of three men who grow maize, rice and other crops. they wish to expand their farmable area, support their children’s education, and build homes.

linlin is 34 years old and married with six children. with four children in school, linlin works very hard to provide for them.

linlin runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 10000 loan through nwtf to purchase additional items to sell like rice, bread, canned goods, and other groceries.

linlin has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

in the future, linlin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

abdulhakim is married with four children. he sells men's clothes and shoes at the market, and e takes his entire inventory with him by car and provides local customers with the clothing they need. abdulhakim has been in this business for 6 years; he is a hard-working person. his goal is to fix up his house and take good care of his children. he wants to borrow 6000 somoni to purchase seasonal inventory. the loan would help abdulhakim to increase his sales and reach his goals faster.   

                                                                  
more about tajikistan and imon international

tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the silk road and the end of alexander the great's rule. it has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including rudaki, avicenna, ferdowsi, omar khayyam, jomi, and rumi. the country is home to communities that still speak the ancient sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium bc. and, even today, it is a complex mixture of the islamic faith, soviet culture, new west culture and central asian traditions.

but tajikistan is also the poorest of the former soviet republics. the civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the u.s.s.r., further damaged the already weak economy. in addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. these conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly russia. while the people of tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

imon's history

since december 2007, imon international has worked closely with kiva and kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. funds raised through kiva have already been distributed to thousands of imon international's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. to learn more about imon international's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

in the photo are the members of the “developed women” group. they are small scale businesswomen based in bo, is the second largest city in sierra leone (after freetown) and the largest city in the southern province.

with this loan, they will be able to expand their individual businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. the featured leader of this group is catherine. she is age 40; she is married to a civil servant and the couple has 4 children. catherine is a hair dresser, and she has been in this business for just one year.

after her training from one of the cosmetic training centers, one of her biggest successes is being able to build a house for her family . with her share of this loan, she is going to buy dozens of weavons and wigs to add to her current stock. on the left hand side of this photograph she stands with her child in her arms.

rugare is a 50-year-old married woman from zimbabwe with five children aged 28, 23, 21, 20 and 13 years old. four of them are still going to school. \r\n\r\nshe is into the agriculture business of poultry. the business has operated for 15 years. she has requested a loan of $400 to buy day-old chicks and feed. with the extra income from this loan, rugare will be able to diversify into keeping layers and start another business selling eggs. the loan will also improve the standard of living of her family. she says the challenges faced are the unavailability of stock feed and in some cases, day-old chicks. she is planning to own a grocery shop in the masvingo central business district where she will sell both groceries and chicken meat.

theary’s group live in a rural village in takeo province in cambodia. theary makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. in their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

mary cris is single and lives in cabgan, tambulig zamboanga del sur. she owns a fishing boat and uses it for fishing. mary cris has been doing this business for years to earn a living.\r\n\r\nshe borrowed a loan from gdmpc micro credit in an amount of 5,000 philippines pesos (php) to purchase new fishing nets. she plans to expand her business by having more fishing boats.

this is fely, fifty years old and a resident of quezon city, philippines. she is married to felicisimo, an electrician, and is the mother of five children. by the grace of god, fely has managed to support her children's schooling. this is a dream for most poor filipino parents like fela, as she is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

fely is a sugar retailer. she buys sacks of sugar from wholesalers, repacks them and sells them in 1/4, 1/2, and 1 kilo sizes to individuals, general store owners and the local community. she earns a minimum of 1,500 php in sales every day.

to help her continue operations, fely is requesting a 50,000 php loan to buy more stocks of sugar to expand her inventory. she expects a boost in income from this expansion. 

fely dreams of giving all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. she also hopes to have a store in the community market. she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of god.

higidia, 40, is a member of the “cristo asención de rumichaca” communal bank which is located in urubamba district belonging to urubamba province, cusco department.

she is married and has three children. she alternates her daily chores with a dressmaking shop.   she makes pants, blouses and three-piece suits to order for the general public.  she works from 8am until 6pm and earnings from the business allow her to support her children.  she wants to expand the workshop and is asking for a loan to buy supplies like fabric, thread and closures.

she is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

bok is a villager from the mongkul borey district of banteay meanchhey province. she is a married mother and blessed with three children. the grocery and coconut businesses are the main sources for her to earn an income to feed the family. she has had the businesses for ages. this business has earned her 15,000 khr per day. bok has never been with visionfund (kiva’s partner) before and she is the leader of a group consisting of two borrowers. she and her co-borrower are applying for 1,000,000 khr each. as the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy more grocery items to sell. she hopes to earn better income so that she will be able to renovate her house.

milagros works hard to support her family. milagros is married and has a fish vending business in the philippines.

milagros requested a php 14,000 loan through nwtf to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

milagros has been in this business for 32 years now.

milagros would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

even though gladys grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. currently, gladys is an entrepreneur. she sells cooked rice in bogyano (near cape coast). her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. she uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. \r\n\r\ngladys has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice to sell. with the new profits from her expanded business, gladys wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

esmeralda has been growing and harvesting bananas to sell in town and has been farming  for more than five years, and this is the primary source of income for the family. 

with her generated income, she was able to  successfully repay her previous loan, used for farming inputs. 

esmeralda  took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides to improve the farm. she is planning to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her children's lives.

john memusi is 30 years  old.  he is married and has three children. he has been in the livestock trading business for the last two years.

john was introduced to kadet ltd by kadet staff in his area of residence.  he is applying for his first loan which he plans to use to purchase more animals for sale. he intends to use the returns from this loan to reinvest in his business and to repay the loan.

his dreams are to become a famous businessman in the area and to educate his children to higher levels of education. he an assiduous man despite  his age who struggles to achieve his goals when funded.

born in 1967 in tsévié, married and the mother of 3 children, mrs. félicité a. is a charming woman who, since her youth, has had a taste for commerce. thus, when the occasion presented itself, mrs. a. did not hesitate to take up selling shoes and women's handbags with determination, in her local market.

thanks to her clairvoyance, she has been managing this business well, with the collaboration of her husband who does not have a steady job. she is requesting a loan to rent a big store, vary her assortment of products, and expand her shelving. the profit from her business contributes to regular renewal of her inventory and to improving living conditions for her family.

translated from french by teresa kramer, kiva volunteer

mr. s., 30, has a skill in carving statues that he learned from his grandfather. he carves pieces of wood into statues and sells them to people who want to decorate or adorn their home. mr. s. is married to mrs. srey, age 23, who is a homemaker. she takes care of her five school-aged children. mr. s. is requesting a kiva loan to increase his business capital. this will assist him in making more profit and gaining valued customers.

rose ann is 34 years old. she is married with three young children ages 1, 8 and 10. her husband is a fisherman. and for the last six years fishing has been her livelihood too. she is asking for a loan of 15000 php to buy an engine and a fishing net. its a relief for rose ann that she can request a loan and looks forward to its impact on their business. 

in the future, she hope to have another fishing boat and to buy more sturdy and new fishing nets to expand her business. 

her income will be used for food and school fees.

mrs. lon r. (48) and her husband, mr. choeun reach (58), who live about seventeen kilometers from phnom penh, were married in 1975 and have nine children: four sons and five daughters. one of their children is married and lives outside the family home. five of their children work in a garment factory and the other three children study in a local school.

mrs. lon and her husband have been farming since 1979. they grow many types of fruits, vegetables, and crops in their farm not so far from home. they sell the produce to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell at market. the couple lacks the money to purchase a motorcycle for their children drive to their work in phnom penh. therefore, lon is requesting a loan of $500 to go towards the purchase of a motorbike which their children can use to get to work.

luzmila is a member of mar del plata communal bank. luzmila is married, 43, with two children 20 and 15. the younger is still in school, the elder is in secondary school. luzmila's business is selling clothing and shoes, she takes orders for the various articles. a street vendor, with her first loan she bought wool and knit articles that she then sold. \r\n\r\nfor the upcoming summer, she wants to sell sandals and seasonal clothing. luzmila needs a loan of $200 to purchase various articles (sandals, shoes, and clothing). luzmila currently has a health problem, a difficulty with her spine. luzmila, as soon as she receives her funds, has been able to purchase merchandise, but she wants to increase her loan because she has many orders for clothing and shoes. luzmila dreams of having her own shop, so she will no longer have to be a street vendor.

translated from spanish by susan sanford, kiva volunteer

nusrat is 53 years old and lives in rawalpindi, pakistan with her spouse and three children. nusrat, as a member of three person lending group, has requested a loan from kiva partner brac pakistan to purchase accessories for her husband’s shop.

nusrat wants the financing to buy supplies/accessories like cell phone batteries, chargers, casings, head phones, cell phone bags, etc. for her husband’s cell phone accessories shop.  as this shop is the only source of income for their family, she wants to expand it through this financing and make her life happy. 

her husband is very experienced and professional in his dealings and has been operating his business for the past four years.  nusrat is confident that the loan will greatly contribute towards a substantial increase in their monthly income.

this is nerene, 33 years old, and a resident of tanza, cavite, philippines. she is married to william, her business partner, and they have children. she, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. at this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for her everyday expenses.

nerene operates a repacking business. what she basically does is buy different products from wholesalers, repacks them, and sells them at a profit. her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. she earns a minimum of 500 philippine pesos (php) in sales every day.

to help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a php 20,000 loan. she will use the loan to buy different products such as peppers, bay leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products for repacking.

nerene hopes to be successful in business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of god.

* all cct community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. a fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. the fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of god, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

the mother of two children, nana is a 36-year-old married woman living in agoè. nana is a seamstress who works at home. she buys supplies from the market twice a month. nana is requesting this loan to buy pieces of traditional west african cloth, liners, and boxes of thread. with the resulting profit margin, nana will be able to respond to the numerous requests from her customers and cover her family's daily living costs.

razia is a 40-year-old married woman. her husband (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a small general store for about six years. he has retained many customers over the years and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

razia is a mother of six children, and one of her babies is also shown in the photo. for the improvement of her husband's business, she has availed herself of a murabaha loan of 30,000 pkr to buy stock of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet customers’ demand time after time for increasing revenues.

mach is 29 years old and is a married woman with three children. she sells groceries and beverages. her husband works as a motor repairer. mach has been running this business for 3 years. fluctuations in the price of materials and more competitors are her major challenges.

she will use this loan to purchase more groceries and repair her store. by running this business she can get more money to buy more stock and improve her business. she wants to renovate her current house to be bigger.

madelaine is 42 years old and a modest cheerful mother. she lives in her own home with her husband teodoro, age 47, and their three young children who are the reason behind all her efforts. madelaine and her husband work together to grow potatoes and peas and have strived to make their land productive. with each harvest, they have achieved good quality crops that are in high demand at the wholesale market in the city. what she enjoys most about her work is caring for her crops and protecting them from pests that can impact her harvest. madelaine has been farming for five years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the market in tarma where they are sold. in the future, she wants to buy additional land so that she can increase her production. \r\n

\r\nthis is her fourth loan with mfp. she feels these funds will be a great help in developing her business. madelaine is one of the most responsible members of her communal bank, a distinction of which she is very proud. the loan of 1500 pen that she is requesting will be used to buy more compost to improve the productivity of her land.

translated from spanish by ronan reodica, kiva volunteer

akouavi is a 51-year old divorced woman. she lives in the adidogomé neighborhood and has two dependent children. akouavi works as an itinerant vendor selling eggs. she stocks up with farmers once a month.

akouavi is seeking this loan in order to buy trays of eggs. she plans to make her business profitable and earn revenues allowing her to end her precarious financial situation and provide for everyday family needs.

cristina is 21 years old, married with two children.

cristina works hard to provide for her family. she runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 12,000 loan through nwtf in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

cristina has borrowed and paid 7 loans from nwtf before this loan. she has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

cristina aspires to save money to expand her business.

abida khanum, age 28, is a married woman. she is a hardworking and brave wife who is helping her husband by providing tailoring services in her community. being a responsible wife, she wants to provide better facilities for her family and this is the reason for her working extremely hard - to keep her family smiling.

when she observed that her husband couldn't generate sufficient income to cover the household expenses, she decided to start tailoring work at home and since then, she has been sewing garments for her community. she wants to enhance the beauty of her craft so she would like to buy a juki sewing machine. the professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance.

her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community. she has requested a loan to buy a new juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

abida khanum is very thankful to kiva and its field partner, brac pakistan.

anda yolanda is 56 years old and has her own small grocery store.  she has a lot of experience managing her store and she has had previous loans.  thanks to the support that she has received, she has been able to keep her store profitable because she is constantly investing.  with this financing she will buy daily consumer products such as bread, butter, eggs, milk, curd, tiste, rice, sugar, and beans.

lucena r. is a dynamic member of hspfi (a kiva partner). she lives in baluarte, lumbia cagayan de oro city, philippines. she is married and a responsible mother of her five children. her husband is a laborer. they help each other so that they could sustain the needs of their children who are primarily dependent on them.

lucena is engaged in the buying and selling of fruits. at first, she used her own savings for the purchase of fruits (bananas) she intend to sell. later, she noticed that her business is doing great. she'd like to have more supply to meet the demand of her customers, whom she termed as her "suki," meaning her frequent customers who usually buy her products.

she decided to pledge with hspfi for the loan opportunity they offered. then she performed her business with higher income compared to her previous activity. she is very much grateful to the organization who lends support to her business. from that, she gains extra income which she uses to pay her debts and helps support the tuition of her children whom she sends to school. as of this time, lucena is requesting a loan of php 8,000.00 for purchase of additional fruits intended for selling.

this is luvuno. her previous loan was a big help in her business. she was able to buy more kiosk shop items. she has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. \r\n\r\nshe would like to apply for another loan, this time to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, and sugar. she joined yehu to boost her business.

frumencia is a 59-year-old married woman with four children.

frumencia sells fish in the philippines. frumencia has been in this business for 11 years. she is a very hard working entrepreneur. !

frumencia requested a php 12,000 loan amount through nwtf to buy more fish to sell and other supplies needed in her business.

in the future, frumencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

jemma is married with four children and is a member of negros women for tomorrow foundation, inc.  
 
jemma supports the family through her general store business in the philippines.

she took an educational loan for her daughter ninia angela, who is 19 years old and the first of four children in the family. she is studying for her bachelor of science in accountancy and is currently in the fourth year of this four-year course.

jemma is borrowing 9,200 php to pay for tuition fees for her daughter ninia angela for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

ninia angela plans, when she graduates, to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister to college.

dolores is spending her time taking care of her three kids. while doing that, she also manages her retail business. dolores sells a variety of grocery items in her village. she put up her sari-sari (variety) store business five years ago.

dolores is requesting a loan of php 25,000. she will use it to buy soft drinks, breads, condiments, toothpaste, and many more goods. she hopes to maintain her business and develop it to improve her children's future.

mr. odom k. (pictured here), 41, and his wife, mrs. set un, 38, live in a small village along national road number three about twenty kilometers from phnom penh city. they have been married for almost 20 years and have four children, one son and three daughters. one of their children works in a garment factory and the other three are in school.   
 
odom is a security guard. he does not have his own transportation, so he spends a lot of money on traveling costs. facing this, he decided to apply for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

luz is married with four children. she is a very hard working entrepreneur. luz is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

luz has a food vending business in the philippines. luz requested a php 18000 loan amount through nwtf to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

luz has been in this business for six years. in the future, luz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

maria is the owner of a variety business and a small store located in the neighborhood when she lives, in the city of cartagena.  she lives with her husband and their children, who are ages 3 to 9 years old.  she started her business with seed capital awarded by the mayor\'s office.  she put all of her energy into the business to make it grow and generate more income each day, to benefit her family.  initially, she sold few products.  but with her discipline, she has re-invested her profits, and now she offers a variety of products for sale, such as: food, supplies, sodas, women\'s articles, household accessories, paper products etc.  her greatest challenge is having sufficient capital and work to meet the growing demand that exceeds her expectations daily. this is the reason she requested her credikiva, her first loan with fundación mario santo domingo.  with the loan she will purchase "family shopping basket" items and varied merchandise, like women\'s accessories.  her investment will be successful because she sells her merchandise on credit.  she would be able to offer better prices to her customers for items purchased in greater volume.  her goal down the road is to fix up her home and achieve full prosperity from her business in order to assure her family\'s well-being.

zyra is 27 years old and single with one child. she works very hard to provide for her family.

zyra runs a general store in the philippines, and she requested a php 6,000 loan through nwtf to purchase additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, biscuits, etc. to sell in her store.

she has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items.

in the future, zyra would like to save money to expand her business.

y p. is a 52-year-old single mother who currently lives in the dangkor district of phnom penh in cambodia. her husband died of senility years ago. she is the mother of four children. two of her children are married, and the other two are single. she has a life partner who works in different jobs, and they have a regular salary per month.
y p. is a housewife. she always works on daily activities such as caring for her children, making food, cleaning her house, and managing other property in her house. besides working at home, y p. buys animals from villagers, fattens them for a while, and then sells them for a profit. since the animal-selling business is the main source of income for the family, y p. has requested a loan as capital to buy an extra cow to sell.

karen is 34 years old and married with six children. with five children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. she runs a general store in the philippines and has requested a php 5,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

karen has been in this business for two years. in the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

this member belongs to the communal bank "nueva fe de patria" (new faith of the homeland).

member francisca is 52 years old. she is single and has two children. in addition to her daily tasks, she has a business of selling meat. she has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. she continues selling her merchandise to her customers, who come to her. she wants to be able to continue working in this business so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

she is applying for the loan for the purchase of meat.

the members in general are grateful for the loan granted and promise to make their established payments.

the member who is shown in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late for the meeting because of work reasons.

greetings from makutano star group in western kenya! irene is the facilitator of the makutano star group. this group joined one acre fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

irene takes care of eight children at home. she joined one acre fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. in the recent 2011 season, irene had a good maize yield harvesting nine bags on one acre of land. before joining one acre fund, irene was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

with this loan, one acre fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to irene and her group during kenya’s next planting season in february 2012. the distribution of farming inputs is part of one acre fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

with income from her maize sales, irene will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

in 2012, the members of makutano star group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

lovelyn raises hogs. she is 48 years old and has been doing this kind of work for over six years. she sells the grown animal whenever it reaches maturity. she needs additional capital to sustain her hogs. she is requesting a loan of php15,000 to buy feed, medicines, and vitamins for the hogs' sustainability. she believes that, with proper growth and nutrition, the hogs will be marketed at a higher price and increase her profits. \r\n\r\nlovelyn has two grownup children, but she doesn't want to rely on their remittances and so she hopes to further develop the business and achieve financial independence.

meredith is 42 years old and has three children.  she is married and has one child who is in school. she is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the philippines. meredith requested a php 30,000 loan through nwtf to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

meredith has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from nwtf to sustain her business.

in the future, meredith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

roona, aged forty-seven, is a married woman. she is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services with the help of some appointed ladies of her hometown. she sews garments with mutual efforts and sells garments to the boutique.

due to household expenses and increments in basic needs; she wants to increase her production. for this purpose she is require cloth and sewing material such as zippers, laces, spools, threads etc. she does not have enough cash in hand because she spend a lot of money upon household expenses on daily basis.

this is the reason roona has requested a kiva loan from kiva's field partner brac pakistan, so she can increase production ultimately turnover.

roona is very thankful to kiva and its field partner, brac pakistan.

nabovatkhon is 42 years old. she lives in a small village with her husband, three children and mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension.

nabovatkhon requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

the only source of income for the family is from their agricultural activities. in particular, they have a milking cow, a calf and two buffaloes. besides this they have 0.5 hectares of agricultural land, where apricot trees are grown. it is hardly enough food for the family.

she is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to enlarge her business. she awaits your mercy and support.

adoracion is 59 years old and married with 4 children. she earns a living by raising pigs in the philippines. adoracion has requested a loan of 10,000 philippine pesos (php) through nwtf to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.\r\n\r\nadoracion has been raising pigs for 11 years.  she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

narciso is 24 years old. he lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his wife and children in the small village of naranjitos in a rural area of the pomahuaca district. it is a community with a warm climate. its population makes its living growing and selling fruits. it is situated in the jaén province, which belongs to the cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of peru.

he makes his living in farming, specifically growing coffee. he has experience in this line of work. his wife supports him in the harvesting work, cooking to provide food to her husband and day laborers who are working.

he has applied for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy compost for the upkeep of his coffee crop, so that he can get good output to offer his clients, generating better earnings for his family.

katerin lives in the town of barranquilla. she is a single woman, who yearns to study for a professional career and achieve financial stability. currently, she earns a living selling various items which is a job she learned from her mother who is an expert businesswoman.

her main customers are friends, neighbours and acquaintances to whom she offers a wide range of products for personal use: perfumes, deodorant, talcum powder, make-up, shampoo and also items of clothing. generally she gives them an easy way to pay, but some prefer to pay it off immediately.

at the moment, katerin needs to make an investment in merchandise in order to increase her sales. this is why she is applying for a kiva loan so she can buy make-up, perfume and items of clothing.

in the future her dreams are to have a lot more customers and more types of funding.

lucidia is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children, who are studying in school and depend on her.

lucidia has 15 years of experience working in a store and breeding pigs. she had previously been working in stores and it was thus that she acquired knowledge of the business. she learned pig breeding from her parents and her husband and two children are who take part in the work.

she needs this loan in order to buy merchandise to stock up her store, such as: bread, condiments, detergent, lollipops, drinks, soap, grains, sugar, oil, etc. in this way she will be able to offer a greater variety of products to her clients.

she has planned to save and put another store in another small village, all this with the goal of growing the profits and providing education to her children.

mrs. itohan e. a 33 years old started her food items business 4 years ago. she joined lapo two years after she started her business with her little savings, lives in a semi-urban area of benin city, edo state of nigeria. she is eager to get the above amount for her business growth.

nabeela is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor in her street. she is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry etc. she is a well-known beautician in her town. nabeela is a responsible mother of 2 children. her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed so she is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses.

she has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of kashf foundation. now she has requested a loan of 50000 pkr to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently to earn good amount of income for bearing her everyday expenditures.

gazala is a 39-year-old, married woman and a mother of three. she has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. she purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. she has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community.

gazala requested a loan of pkr 20,000 from kashf foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. in this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. she hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. she dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

lugwe is 49 years old and has six children. he is married to mgumba, who works as a farmer.

to support their family, lugwe started a goat-meat business at home with just two goats. he sells at the market, mostly to the people who buy for slaughter in the slaughterhouses. he has gained a respectable number of customers through friends and relatives in the past four years.

he requires a loan to increase the number of goats to meet the growing demand. in the future, he wants to further expand his business, which will enable him to support the needs of his family.

mwanajuma is a single mother with three children, all of whom graduated from school and are employed. they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. her greatest monthly expense is food.

she has operated a vegetable stall for the past four years, selling from home to her neighboring community. mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality during the months of january to may when the number of customers in her food stall is low, while over the holiday season the number of customers is high. she dreams of building a permanent stall in the future.

with the kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes. mwanajuma decided to join yehu microfinance to access loans to expand her business.

robina, age 45, is a married woman. for the past five years, she has been running a business of cloth sales. she buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. she has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

she is requesting a loan of 50,000 pkr (pakistani rupees) from the kashf foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. she expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

regina is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. she owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

regina operates a grocery and vegetable selling stall. she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. she faces a challenge of seasonality in her business.

with the kes 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

hasanali lives in the hamadoni region. this region has very good conditions for animal husbandry work. many residents of this region receive a good income from this work.

hasanali is 55 years old and he has raised 3 wonderful children. he is a very caring father and family man. hasanali has been practicing animal husbandry for 5 years. he is thankful to his father, who helped him with his work. hasanali has a large amount of experience in this sphere. his wife helps him with his work and sells milk herself, which they get from their cows.

hasanali loves his work and therefore has decided to expand his business. he has two cows and a calf. hasanali needs a loan to buy another couple head of livestock.

rose a. is her group's representative. she is thirty-four years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. she also has three other dependents.\r\n\r\nrose runs a restaurant; she has done so for over three years. she will use this loan to purchase food (rice, bananas, meat, fish, chicken, vegetables, et cetera) and drinks (sodas, juice, water, et cetera) in order to meet different tastes. since she is buying a greater variety of items to meet demand, more customers will be attracted to her restaurant. eventually, she wants to expand her restaurant.

a $1000.00 is offered to maria to improve her business. she has a small kiosk and she is requesting this loan from tuba rai metin because she wants to add to her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as noodles, biscuits, soaps, sugar, salts, coffee, shampoo, candles, candies and other things to sell. \r\n\r\nshe has been involving herself in business activities since 2013, with her own working capital of $400.00. she feels so comfortable to run her business because she can increase her income.  running a business has made maria independent because she can be responsible for her family. she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

astry is a 24 year old young woman, who is single and lives with her dear parents in a community in the sololá department.

to obtain an income and provide for her family astry works as a business agent for a private company. she has been doing this for five years, but she is a youngster with many goals in life, so to improve her income she also grows tomatoes. astry is lucky enough to live in a very productive area, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land where she can continue increasing her tomato crops and thus increase her income.

astry wishes to obtain this loan so that she can buy the land.

yawa is a 35-year-old married mother to six children who lives in agoè. yawa earns a living selling wood charcoal which she purchases monthly from market then resells out of her own house and to various retailers.

yawa needs this loan to purchase sacks of wood charcoal so she can earn a greater profit and support her husband with their household expenses, thereby allowing their children to receive a good education.

sunnah is 40 years old, married, and has five children who attend school. she lives in montrserrado county, which has the highest production of fish on the liberian market. over the past five years, she has been selling oil, rice, chicken, etc. in her community. she started this business by helping her mother. \r\n\r\nsunnah is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more oil, rice, chicken, etc., for her business. she hopes to build a house.

nicolau salvador c., 26, was born in the district of marracuense, province of maputo. he lives in boane with his partner and two year-old daughter, in a house they own but that is still under construction. he's currently enrolled at the pedagogical university of maputo. nicolau got his elementary teaching credentials from the magistério primário de chibututuine. since 2004 he has been teaching at "casa do gaiato", an orphanage and arts & crafts school in boane, where he himself studied and finished middle-school. between his salary from casa do gaiato and the money he makes from teaching at another institution, nicolau's monthly salary is 9.775,00 mt, which allows him to support his family, pay for college and also save some money. nicolau heard about hluvuku-adsema thorugh friends. he plans to use his first loan to buy construction material to finish his house. he expects to pay it back without difficulties, and intends to apply for other loans in the future, to furnish his house. his hopes and dreams include finishing building his house, graduating from college and getting married.

translated from portuguese by aline pereira, kiva volunteer

nickson is a 22-year old entrepreneur living in the mukuru informal settlement of nairobi, kenya. he recently moved out of his family's home to live on his own, but he has found that the going has not been easy due to unemployment. nickson has tried out several small businesses as a means to fend for his food and a place to stay, but the money he earns is not enough to take care of all his needs. however, nickson discovered fresh life toilets, and believes this business will pay for his living expenses.\r\n\r\nnickson seeks a loan to help him purchase two fresh life toilets, which he intends to run himself. he hopes that the business will generate enough to improve his living standards and create more employment opportunities for other youth.

ma. janine is a 42-year-old woman from concepcion, iloilo. she is married and has four children ages 15, 12, 5 and 3 years old.

ma. janine's husband is a fisherman and she helps her husband in doing this livelihood. they have been fishing for their livelihood for many years. she and her husband work hard together to earn a living and to support their family.

ma. janine is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and bobo (a kind of fish trap) materials, such as bamboo and plastic screen. ma janine wishes to improve their business and become more productive.

ibrahim sells purified water in the town of makeni.  with his previous loan, he increased his stock.  lack of a clean drinking water supply is a big problem in the town and ibrahim is trying to provide the service to those who can’t afford to buy.  due to lack of sufficient capital, ibrahim could not meet the demand of his customers especially during the dry season.  he is therefore requesting a loan of le.3, 500,000 to increase the stock and sell wholesale.

mwanaj. is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. she owns a house that has electricity and piped water. her greatest monthly expense is school fees. for over one year, she has operated a tailoring business and also sells clothes from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

mwanaj. faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. with the kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase materials for her tailoring business. she dreams of expanding, and supplying clothes in large scale to meet her customers' needs. mwanaj. decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

lorena lives in las orquídeas (the orchids). she is 37 years old. she is a widow and has three grown children. as a result of becoming a widow, she decided to look for work so that she could continue paying for the education of her children. since she was not offered work by any of the businesses where she looked, she decided to save up money to be able to open her own small store. her business has grown little by little and now has the necessary clientele. lorena works everyday, starting in the morning. she will use the loan to buy sodas, lettuce and other things. her goals are to continue working and to make improvements on her home. \r\n\r\n

twenty-year-old bob wants a loan to construct a commercial house for income generation. he is married with two children. he is in the motorcycle transport business. he lives in kyenjojo, uganda. he owns a semi-permanent house in which he lives. he dreams of building a permanent house, educating his children, and acquiring a motor vehicle for his transport business.

jonathan, age 44, is a milk vendor. he started his business six years ago and earns a monthly income of kes 24,000. jonathan and his wife janet are blessed with four children, aged 12, 14, 16, and 18. 

jonathan would like to purchase more milk to offer for sale in one of the secondary schools in his region. he has requested his sixth loan in the amount of kes 90,000. 

the profit he makes from his business will aid him to repay the loan, to become financially stable, and to offer his family a better life.

alfredo is a responsible, humble, and hardworking man.  at 34 years old, he lives with his wife and his two children, for whom he struggles tirelessly in order to get them ahead.

during his working life, he has done various jobs in different sewing businesses.  with the goal of generating a better income, he made the decision to work for himself and open his own workshop in the comfort of his own home.  because of this, he is asking for the support of a loan, with which he will buy an industrial sewing machine, a coverstitch machine, a lamp, and supplies such as fabric and thread.  in this way, he will have the chance to begin this fruitful plan.  he can make sure that he has contacts with some suppliers from whom he can get cuts of fabric for production.

alfredo shares that his greatest desire is to be completely independent and be able to position his business favorably, getting a lot of contracts and, in this way, ensuring financial stability for his family.  this will allow him to give his children a good education and improve the quality of life of his entire family group.

sandra is 49 years old and married with two children.

she earns a living by raising pigs in the philippines. sandra is borrowing php 12,000 through nwtf in order to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

sandra has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

the aníbal san andré communal bank meets every 15 days in the montecristi (portoviejo) canton, which is well known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its nationally and internationally recognized artisanship. it is famous for its straw hats. this is where cristhian lives. he is a very hardworking young man, age 20 and single. he hopes to continue working in order to someday be able to start his own family. 

he sells fish, making runs around the city on his own tricycle cart, which he acquired with one of the loans that he took out through the communal bank. he works between three and four days a week from 5:00 am to 2:00 in the afternoon. he goes down to the city of manta to buy fish straight from the fishermen on the coast. he has been in this business for two years and it's going well enough for him. on his off days, he does masonry work. he will use this loan to buy more fish for sale. this is his fifth loan with fundación espoir [kiva field partner], which he appreciates it for the help it provides through its loans. 

his dreams are to keep on growing his business and in his personal life.

romeo is 71 years old. he works in agriculture and livestock. he went to school up the sixth grade and was raised by his parents who taught him these activities. he is married and his wife helps him with the housework.

romeo has been working in agriculture for several years. he gets up at 4:00 a.m. to go to his land where he works all morning, while his wife works in the home and cares for the cows they own.

romeo needs the loan to buy agricultural materials  for his crops, such as pesticide, seed and fertilizer. this way, he will ensure a good harvest. 

romeo dreams of have more dairy cattle to increase milk production.

ruth is a 51-year-old business lady and married to john a business man. they are blessed with three children. she has been a tailor for the past ten years with the monthly income of 20,000 kes. which she uses to support her family. she is applying for her 1st loan term with kadet ltd after being introduced to a credit officer.  

ruth will use the loan to buy more stock of textile materials and a sewing machine. with the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop and improve the family's living standard.

aminata is 24 years old and married. she has been selling oil for the past three years and needs a loan to buy containers of oil for resale. she has a good location for her business in the market.

animata is known for her experience and is also respectful and welcoming to customers. furthermore, the oil she offers to her customers is good quality, and all of this means that her business is doing well. she will have a profit after sales which will enable her to make savings, take care of her family and also expand her business. she is on her first loan contract with acfime and is committed to making the repayments on time.

this is 71 year-old margaret (center) from gweru, the capital of midlands province in zimbabwe. she is widowed with five children and also cares for four dependents. margaret runs a flea market business selling clothes and footwear. the business has been in operation for two years. she says the main challenges faced are shortage of working capital and clients who do not pay on time. margaret has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothing and footwear to sell. she says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay her dependents' school fees. in the future margaret plans to buy a business car.

ma. socorro is a married woman with five children. she is a very hard working entrepreneur. ma. socorro is now 55-years-old. 

ma. socorro has a buy-and-sell cosmetic products business in the philippines. she has requested a php 10,000 loan amount through nwtf to buy items to sell like lotion and soap. 

ma. socorro has been in this business for 10 years. in the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

gloria z. t. is 41 years old. she lives in the era district of the city of tegucigalpa. she works making and selling corn tortillas. she has many years of experience making tortillas. she has steady customers who are close neighbors and also various businesses, cafeterias and shops.

right now, she can’t cope with all the work that she has. she is making very little, and therefore needs a loan to buy more raw materials to make her tortillas.

this is a season of high demand, and she wants to meet all the needs of her customers.

her goal is to sort out her home so that it is very comfortable for her children.

translated from spanish by rebecca towle, kiva volunteer

greetings from peru!

the “sagitario” (sagittarius) communal bank has 7 members who are starting their 8th cycle.  one of the members is antonia who raises pigs.  antonia has vast experience in this line of work; she started 19 years ago.

the area she lives in is rural and there are many ‘chancherías’ there.  chancherías are places where pigs are raised.  because antonia does not have enough space at home, she rents space in a chanchería to raise her pigs in.  she sells them after three or four months.

antonia will use her loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her pits and she’s very happy to have gotten it.  antonia is married and lives with her husband and son.  she is the woman who speaks in the video.  she’s in the center of the first row.  antonia is grateful for the support provided.

gulnora is a lighthearted woman. she was born in the northern part of tajikistan in 1972. she is married and has four children. she is working at a medical clinic. she has a daughter that has health problems. she worries about her and wishes for her daughter to be healed. in order to be treated, she needs to have a surgical operation. gulnora and family members love her very much. she is asking for a loan to pay for the surgery for her daughter. this loan will help her to stabilize her daughter’s health.

filipinos are known to be hardworking entrepreneurs. like evelyn, a 45 years old business woman is currently selling frozen products and selling per kilo of rice. she is married to a driver named alex and they’re helping each other to earn a living since providing their family’s needs and raising three children is very challenging nowadays. evelyn aims to earn more and expand her current business.

she decided to apply for a php 10, 000 loan since she needs additional capital for her business to increase revenue. she plans to buy packs of frozen products like sausages, ham, hotdogs etc.

evelyn believes that if you want success to come in, you need god to be your greatest foundation. she is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for cct partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of god’s love, pay micro finance loans and hear god’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

maria is the coordinator of her group renovacion las aguilas 3 (eagles renewal). she makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. she says that her dream is to have her own house. 

maria is excited to be taking her fourth loan with esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. she has had her business for amost 2 years, starting with her first esperanza loan. she plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different products like clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to sell. 

maria began with us because she wants to progress and have a business. her  story is representative of her group and of esperanza's haitian and dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the dr from haiti. her group is located in santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the dominican republic. this area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the dominican republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water—none of which is potable.

cerla is a 49-year-old married mother of 6 children from concepcion, iloilo in the philippines. she and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for almost 3 years now. 

cerla is a hardworking woman. she wishes to improve their fishing business but lacks the capital to do so. with this goal in mind, she joined community economic ventures, inc. in order to gain access to loans offered to micro entrepreneurs like her.

cerla is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. with this loan, cerla and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus providing them with more fish to sell.

in the future, cerla hopes to make their fishing business a success.

edeliza u. is from the village of toril, aloran. she is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by kiva partner, pmpc. while each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
edeliza is 46 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. to make a living, she owns and operates a snack-vending business making and selling food. the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. edeliza is just starting this business.
in 2004, edeliza joined pmpc to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. she has successfully repaid a previous loan from pmpc. edeliza is requesting a new loan of 2,000 php, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. this loan will be her tenth from pmpc. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

about pmpc
paglaum multi-purpose cooperative (pmpc) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern mindanao. it reaches out to the rural poor using the grameen model.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva. given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

josé noel c. núñez tiene 37 años, su actividad economía es la venta de cocteles y ceviches, el tiene 4 hijos a su cargo que todavía asisten a clases. su negocio consiste en comprar pescado, conchas, camarones para preparar los diferentes platillos para ofrecerlos a sus diferentes clientes. hace más de 5 años que inicio este negocio,  ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer sus servicios como obrero, pero al no sufragar los suficientes gastos de su familia decidió dedicarse a la venta de estos platillos, con el tiempo ha logrado obtener los suficientes clientes que le han proporcionado la estabilidad en su negocio. el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos. su deseo es comprar un medio de transporte para ofrecer sus productos de una manera mucho mas rápida.

thelma is a married woman with three children. she is a very hard working entrepreneur. thelma is 53 years old.

thelma has a beverage business in the philippines. thelma requested a php 25,000 loan through nwtf to buy more beverages to sell and other supplies needed in her business. thelma has been in this business for 5 years.

in the future, thelma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

after graduating from middle school, georgina decided to set up her own provision business in mpohor (near  takoradi). with over 10 years’ of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. unfortunately, she is limited by a lack of funding. this loan will be used to help her buy more provisions for resale. she aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a miner) with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their five children are able to experience a better life.

rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the philippines.

she is borrowing 10,000 php through nwtf to buy ingredients like spices, egg, flour, cooking oil, etc., for her food vending business.

rebecca has been in this business for 1 year, and she earns more income from raising pigs.

she has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from nwtf. rebecca dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

joy a. is 40 years old and runs a retail clothing business. she also sells some mobile phones from her shop which is located along the main street in jinja town. her business has been in existence for a period of 5 years. she is requesting this loan to purchase additional supplies of dresses, ladies suits, gents shirts and trousers including some mobile phones in preparation for the anticipated increase in demand of these products during the upcoming festive season.

the income from this business enables her to care for her 4 children, pay her lady shop assistant, settle the shop rent and utility bills. her great dream is to accumulate enough capital  to enable her to operate a clothes wholesale business instead of the present retail shop.

amina is a married woman with  six children, three of  whom attend school. she owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

amina operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. she faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

with the kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

phan, who is originally from \tkampong thom province, is 61 years old and she is married. she is blessed with nine children, three of whom depend on her. rice growing is the business which earns the main income to support this family’s living. sometimes, phan spends her spare time to work for others for a fee in order to add more income. she earns about usd10 per day and can save about usd2 each day after daily expenses. she is now requesting a loan from visionfund to buy solar system to use. she believes that it will standardize her living and she will have energy to brighten her house at night time.

pedro is married and his wife works in agriculture.

from a very young age, pedro has worked in agriculture which he learned about from his father, and it has served him to earn a living. he gets up very early to go to the fields where he grows corn for family consumption and another part to sell. the land is 1 kilometer from his house. he also likes to raise cattle which is another source of income from the milk and dairy products he sells.

pedro is in need of a loan to buy farm supplies for his basic grain crops. he used his previous kiva loan to continue working and paying back debt on time.

pedro's dream is to repair his house since it is damaged.

maría félix lives in the city of managua, where she works as a salesperson in the marketplace of the capital.  she is a responsible person with great dreams of success in her work as well as in her personal life.\r\n\r\nmaría asked for this loan at our institution to continue growing her business.  with the money she is loaned she plans to buy sweet peppers to grow her business and make better profits at her work.  the improvements that this lady will make are to fence in the back part of her property.

barotjon is 41 years old. he is an honest, hardworking and responsible person. he loves his family and takes care of them. he is married and has a child. his wife is a housekeeper. he has a very friendly family. he loves his family and tries to provide them with all necessary things. he deals in construction. he has been working for more than seven years in this sphere.

his wife was ill, and she needed treatment. in order to treat his wife, he applied for a loan from imon international bank in the hopes of paying for his wife's treatment. he used his loan for his wife's treatment.

he is a repeat client of this bank and has a good credit story. he lacks financial support. he must buy medicines for his wife's treatment. he is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni with this aim.

marcelina manages a boarding house business in front of the university school. while waiting for her boarders’ monthly payment, she also runs a barbeque business. she prepares the food early in the afternoon so that she can start to sell at 3 o’clock in the afternoon until 8 o’clock in the evening. marcelina sells grilled hot dogs, meat, chicken intestines, and liver. 

marcelina wishes to earn a higher income because she wants to expand her boarding house. because of this, marcelina is asking for a loan of 25,000 php (philippine pesos) to buy more meats and other raw ingredients for her barbeque business. she hopes to obtain her desired loan to grow the business and will expand her boarding house soon.

mélanie, aged 34, is a married woman living in tokoin. with no children to support, she is a retailer of plasticware and coolers (insulated containers). she gets her supplies twice a month from the market and resells the merchandise at her home and by circulating through nearby districts.

mélanie is requesting this loan to order units of coolers and plastic pails and black basins with the aim of doing better in her sales and then satisfying fully the expectations of her customer. she could then realize a good profit to help out her husband in meeting the familys day-to-day needs.

antonio is 38 years old and a single chef. he lives in housing which has been provided by the military since he comes from another district. he supports his mother by sending her money.

antonio says that this loan will go towards buying building materials such as cement, iron rods and plastic pipes to continue building a house in his home town.

this is antonio's first loan with hluvuku. he says that he will apply for more loans to cement his plans.

antonio's dream is to have a family and a minimart to supplement his income.

john, pictured above, has been a farmer for 5 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in kimilili district. he is 40 years old, is married and has 6 children.

john likes to think of himself as a very trustworthy person. he has been working alongside one acre fund since 2015 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. he says that being part of the one acre fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. john plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

in total, john’s group will receive inputs to cultivate 10.75 acres of land. given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

anastacia and her husband have 6 children. love has always united them and given them strength to confront difficult moments together. as a help to support her home and supplement her husband’s income, anastacia opened a convenience store in their home, with a little bit of merchandise to start, but is has been growing and she has noted how useful her store has been to her neighbors. her neighbors see her as a just person, one who doesn’t take advantage of the needs of others and she always charges a fair price. for this reason anastacia has seen her work not only as an economic means but also as a service to her community. therefore, she is here asking for a loan that will be used to expand her store, she would like to improve the lighting and buy a greater variety of merchandise to meet her customer’s needs. she promises to be faithful and responsible in her payments, as she is an honored and honorable woman.

translated from spanish by cindy kendall, kiva volunteer

anastacia y su esposo tienen 6 hijos, el amor que siempre los ha unido le ha dado fuerza para afrontar juntos los momentos difíciles. como una ayuda para el sustento de su hogar y complemento del trabajo de su esposo, anastacia puso una bodega en su casa, con poca mercadería para comenzar, pero ha ido creciendo la demanda y ella se ha dado cuenta lo útil que su bodega es para sus vecinos, ya que ven en ella una persona justa, que no se aprovecha de su necesidad y siempre les cobra el precio justo. por esta razón anastacia ha visto en su trabajo no sólo un medio de ganancia económicas, sino también un servicio a favor de su comunidad.debido a ello, se presenta aquí solicitando un préstamo que utilizará para la ampliación de su bodega, quiere ambientarla mejor y comprar mayor y variada mercadería para seguir complaciendo a sus clientes. ella promete ser fiel y responsable en sus pagos, ya que es una mujer honrada y honorable.

vincent is a 25 years old father who has two children. he has engaged himself in reselling ukay-ukay (used clothing) within the public market for almost five years. being a father, he is responsible to support his family and give them a better living. he aims to improve his business and generate sufficient income so that he can sustain the daily needs of his family.

due to capital insufficiency, he would like to ask for an additional amount of php 10,000.00 to buy additional stocks of ukay-ukay (used clothing) to resell. having this financial assistance, he believes that he will further improve the business someday.

adelina is 51 years old and sells sacks of grain. she is known as a very industrious and generous woman in her community, so her business grows accordingly. as she stated "a man who is productive and hard working will become prosperous ". with her loving personality, she gains a lot of clients as her loyal customers. somehow, with her perseverance she improved upon her family's poor standard of living. in fact, she already has fulfilled her responsibility to see her two children finish their studies. 

she refuses to go back to their former lifestyle, this leads her to ask for a loan of 25,000 philippine pesos (php) to buy additional sacks of grain to sell and to pay her hired help. she hopes, alalay sa kaunlaran inc. would not weary to helped them in their businesses in order to lift their poor lifestyle.

naisim, a 30-year-old citizen of kampong cham province, is a mother of one schoolboy. to tackle the daily cost of living, she farms rice crops and her husband makes concrete rings. the current business earns her about 30,000 khr.  \r\n\r\nnaisim has just joined visionfund this cycle. she is seeking 2,000,000 khr in order to buy cement, sand, and gravel for supporting her husband's business. she hopes her husband can make more concrete rings so they can earn more profit to sustain their living.

luzviminda is 61 years old, married, and has five children.
