luzviminda works hard to provide for her family.

she runs a general store in the philippines. she has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

luzviminda requested a php 18,000 loan through nwtf to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

luzviminda has borrowed and paid five loans from nwtf before this loan.

luzviminda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

rhodora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an egg retail business in the philippines. she has successfully repaid her previous loan.

rhodora is requesting a 40,000 php loan through nwtf to buy more eggs to sell. she will use her loan to build and expand her business. nwtf is re-listing rhodora's business profile to support her efforts to secure her family's future.

evelyn is 44 years old and is married with seven children. she earns a living by farming vegetables in the philippines.

evelyn is borrowing 10,000 php through negros women for tomorrow foundation in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

evelyn has been farming vegetables for twenty years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

mrs. thai h., aged 50, grows rice on a plot of land and earns about $1 a day selling her crops at the local market.  a widow, she supports her four children with this business.  two of her children are students, while the other two are employed at a garment factory and make about $70 each a month.  she would like to request a loan of $500 to purchase more seeds to increase crop yields.  in the future she would like to reinvest the additional earnings generated by this loan  back into her business and purchase a hand-tractor to increase the efficiency of her rice cultivation.  she plans to use the increased income to help fund her children’s education.

rasolovao is a 41-year-old married woman. her husband is a shopkeeper, as is she. the couple have six children; two are already married and four are still in their charge. only two of these four children are in school. 

she is involved in retail, trading several useful household appliances. she started this business in 2010 and she would like to develop it in order to save more money. her aim is to be able to build her own house one day to avoid paying rent.

this is martha. she has a business in the municipality of arjona. because of her experience as a cook and her passion for food, she started her own food business in her home. as the mother of three children and her responsibility for the household, she decided to be an independent business owner so she could spend more time with her family and increase her income.

martha acquired the necessary clothing and began her business with great results. her main customers are her neighbours. they arrive around noon to enjoy the traditional meals that she prepares.

martha's dream is to have premises and be able to guarantee having sufficient resources to pay for her children's education. this is why she is taking measures to improve her income. she is now seeking her first loan with kiva through the mario santo domingo foundation to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients such as rice, vegetables, meat, greens, fruit etc.

this investment will be a success. please help martha with her kiva loan!

narcisa works hard to support one children. she is married and has a general store business in the philippines.

narcisa requested a php 8000 loan through nwtf to buy a sanitary toilet.

she is getting the sanitary toilet because she wants to give her family a safe and clean way of living.

narcisa is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

david is 40 years old, married and supports a happy family of three. he has run a clothes shop for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 35,000 kes. 

this is his third loan of 70,000 kes from kadet.  he plans to restock his shop with new and used clothes for sale, a variety of clothes for men, women and children that will meet the demands of his growing clients. 

the anticipated profits will be used to purchase used clothes that are cheaper to buy. his future dreams is to expand his business and employ more workers.

\nafricano is 37-year-old client. he is married with four children; three are in school. he operates a butchery at a trading centre near his residence. he has been taking loans from ugafode, which has enabled him to sustain his business and meet his family’s financial needs.

africano applied for a loan of ugx 4,000,000 to buy cows for slaughter at the butchery. africano thanks ugafode for the financial assistance, which has enabled him to build his house and pay fees for his children without affecting his business.\nhe appreciates the ugafode and kiva partnership and is working hard to pay well in order to maintain the partnership.

edmundo m. is the father of five children. he is 62 years old and still plowing with the carabao, a farm animal typically used by filipinos to plow fields. currently, he owns a 1-hectare farm that he bought from his little savings when he was younger. 

he needs a loan to support the needs in his rice field. a loan of php 14,000 will help him buy sacks of rice seeds and pay the laborers who helped prepare the land for planting. 

he said this is his fifth loan from cevi. he has stayed this long in the program because he likes the services and the staff is very friendly as well.

forty-six-year-old hortensia is a single mother with two young children. she is from sauce, a place located in the northern zone of the region. hortensia is a hard-working, responsible person with a desire to succeed. unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, she could not pursue an education and found herself obligated to work from an early age in order to help with household expenses. 

thanks to her desire to get ahead, she sells dairy products like milk, curd, cheese, cream, etc. her business is located in the house she lives in, and the buyers are regular clients. 

she works some eight hours a day at her business, offering her products. the goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and purchase some cows to produce milk to satisfy the demand of her clients.

hortensia appreciates the support that kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries like nicaragua so that they have a dignified means of work.

leonidas didn't have the opportunity to study in school. he is single and has no children. leonidas has a lot of experience in current agriculture harvesting beans and vegetables which he learned from his father.

leonidas will use the loan to purchase fertilizer to cultivate his beans. he dreams of having an abundant crop and increasing his income.

dalmas is a married man with 5 children, all of whom attend school. he lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. his greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. he has operated a goat meat business for the past 5 years. his potential customers are community members and butchers.

with the 20,000 kes he is requesting, dalmas wants to purchase 10 goats to sell for meat. dalmas decided to work with yehu to access loans to boost his business.

helen works hard to support her family. helen is married and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the philippines.

helen requested a php 15000 loan through nwtf to buy additional items to sell.

helen has been in this business for 10 years now.

helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

iris resides in albur, bohol with her family. she is 35 years old, married, and has two children. she sells fish for a living. her husband goes out to the sea to catch fish and she sells all his catch at the market. sometimes, she walks around her home to sell fish. she prays that god will continue to strengthen her and her husband so that they will be able to provide for their family’s needs.\r\n\r\niris is a new member of cevi. she said that she joined because of its low interest rate. she applied for a loan of php 5,000 that she will use to buy fishnets and other fishing materials.

josefina p. is from the village of miaray, dangcagan, bukidnon. she is 38 years old. josefina is married and has 5 school-aged children. to make a living, josefina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, and toothpaste in the local community. josefina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 php a month from these activities.

in 2010, josefina joined hspfi to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 php from hspfi. this previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

josefina is requesting a new loan of 10000 php, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as snack foods and canned goods. this loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by josefina from hspfi. she plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

about hspfi:

hspfi is one of accredited partners of opportunity international in the philippines. it is based in cagayan de oro city and is reaching out to the poor households of northern mindanao.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

myrna is 43 years old and married with three children.

she earns a living by raising pigs in the philippines. myrna is borrowing php 15,000 through nwtf to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

myrna has been raising pigs for three years.

she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

monica is a happily married lady, aged 40 years and a mother of 3 children. her husband is a businessman and they support one another to meet the family\'s needs.

she is a shop keeper who delights in her business very much especially when serving her customers."food business is lucrative" she says, as people have to eat despite the prevailing circumstances.

to grow her business and offer better service, she is requesting for a loan from eclof kenya to add stock of maize flour. this is her second loan cycle and she pays well in time.

her dream is to further grow her shop.

in 2011, laureta learned about paglaum multi purpose cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. laureta tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. she feels she owes her fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. laureta has borrowed another loan to buy two sacks of fertilizers. this will help give her farming income a big boost. \r\n\r\nlaureta looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

yessenia e., 30, lives near the 8 kilometer marker along the guasaule highway in a village called, jacalito choluteca. she sells tortillas that she manufactures at home. she has two children who are 2 and 4 years of age. yessenia is dedicated to her family; she rises every day at 5am to make her delicious tortillas in order to go out and sell them among her neighbors. she will use the funds to buy more ingredients for tortilla making because she needs to increase her sales; she needs the profits to cover her children’s and her home’s expenses.

translated from spanish by michael bujazan, kiva volunteer

meena is 45 years old. many years ago she established her vegetable farming business. she has already received and successfully repaid one loan from patan bpw, and she used her most recent loan to buy seeds. in the future, she plans to improve the economic condition of her family. she thanks you for your support.

florencia is 64 years old and has thirteen children. she is a married woman. she is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the philippines.

florencia requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf. she planned to use it to buy feed and other supplies for raising her pigs. florencia has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

in the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

wilfredo is 24 years old and has a ninth-grade education. he is single and his only responsibility is to help his parents with household costs. wilfredo did not want to continue in education.

wilfredo works in farming and cattle-raising as that is what his family has always done.

wilfredo will use this loan in order to buy cattle. he has always worked in farming and cattle-raising.

wilfredo dreams of having much more cattle and of starting a family.

the member belongs to the community bank "los solidarios." the bank is located in the district urubamba, belonging to the province of urubamba and department of cusco.

the member juan is a construction worker. the member is a responsible and persevering person. the member desires to be able to continue working in order to in this way move forward. the member spent years dedicating himself to working on the different projects that request his services.

the member feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments on his schedule, feeling that in this way he will move his family forward. the member applies for the loan to buy tools such as sledge hammers, among others.

dear kiva lenders, ann is a happily married woman. she lives in the kerugoya area of kenya and has lovely children. kerugoya is a place that has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, including a good climate, good soils, a transportation system, and a market. ann's family is the greatest thing in her life and something that makes her feel accomplished.

although ann has only farmed for the past five years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. though she has faced many obstacles, that has not been a setback because she has been making great profits in farming. ann has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is a lack of funds to get the business off the ground.

ann is requesting a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. through juhudi kilimo, she will be able to secure a loan. with your loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers, and potatoes. this loan will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. you can help ann accomplish all these dreams with a loan, so do it now, and get her closer to her goals.

ann is making a passionate plea for a loan!

pictured above is everlyne, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. she is 36 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 14 farmers in kakamega north district, kenya.  she is married and has 3 children.

everlyne is returning this season to work with one acre fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. everlyne says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. everlyne will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

the group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres. given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

mamela is 43 years old, married, and she has five children, of whom three are in school. she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. she has a furniture-making business in the philippines. 

mamela requested a php 16,000 loan amount through nwtf, to purchase additional materials for building furniture. she has been in this business for 20 years.

she would like to save money, so she could expand her business in the future.

the group is made up of three small business women, one of whom is katherine.  katherine is 20 years old and married.  for the past two years, she has had a business selling plantain chips and other fried snacks.  she is seeking a loan to purchase baskets of plantains, oil, bags, wood, cabbage, carrots, vinegar and paper.  \r\n\r\nxiomara is 23 years old and has a business selling used children's clothing.  irma is 47 years old and has a business selling tortillas and pinol.

ma. josephine is 43 years old, married, and she has five children. three of them are currently in school.

ma. josephine is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the philippines. she requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. she has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

in the future, ma. josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

paul is 53 years old. he is married with seven adult children. for the past six years, he had run a shop and hotel business. paul is also a farmer. he earns 50,000 kes each month. 

paul is requesting a loan to add more stock such as sugar, milk, rice, soap, and flour to sell and also use in his hotel business. he will use the anticipated profit from his loan to expand his hotel by buying more utensils and chairs. this is his sixth loan with kadet ltd. in future, paul hopes to install electricity in his home compound.

charles is a 45 year old married man with 10 children living in fort portal uganda. he has a business of poultry farming and at the same time grows seasonal crops like tomatoes, onions,cabbages and also does carpentry works that boosts his income. he is faced with challenges of making losses when the birds do not lay eggs and price fluctuations of agricultural products. \r\n\r\ncharles requests a loan to buy poultry feeds for the chicken.

the maría auxiliadora communal bank meets in sequita parrish, which is in the canton of montecristi, in the prosperous manabí province. the area is full of hardworking people who are proud of the roots. sequita is a parrish where the residents are honest people who only know how to work and take care of their families. rosa has been in the communal bank since it started and she is its president. she has has managed this position very well and likes the communal bank because she has always received her loans on time and also because of the extra benefits offered by fundación espoir. she is 46, married and has three children who are studying higher education. her husband is a bricklayer. she is a housewife but began raising pigs to help out her husband. she started with small quantities but the business grew and now she raises up to 30 pigs per season. she buys them when they are small, feeds them and cares for them for three to four months. when they are well developed she delivers them to traders who come to her house to buy them. she works every day without any set hours and gives them a lot of care so they do not get sick. sometimes her children help out. with this loan she will build another pen so that she can have more pigs as well as buy feed and medicines. her goal is for her children to become professionals and succeed.

translated from spanish by molly puglisi, kiva volunteer

clemencia m. is from the village of olingan. she is 58 years old. clemencia is married and has 3 grown-up children. to make a living, clemencia runs a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community, and she is also engaged in rice retailing. clemencia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 php a month for these activities.

in 2006, clemencia joined pmpc to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. clemencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 php from pmpc. clemencia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 php which will be used to invest in expanding the business which is the rice retailing. this loan will be the 7th loan taken out by clemencia from pmpc. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

about pmpc:

paglaum multi-purpose cooperative (pmpc is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern mindanao. it reaches out to the rural poor using the grameen model.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

marleny is 36 years old and is a housewife. she completed high school and is a feisty and enterprising woman, who has helped her two children to get ahead. marleny was a widow but found a new partner three years ago. her partner grows basic grains and her children are in school.

part of this loan will be used to improve marleny's home; the rest will be used to bring the basic grains harvest, which marleny owns with her partner.

in the future, marleny would like her children to finish their studies and, with the support of her partner, to instil good values in them, so that they can prosper and become good people.

fredrick is a 51 year-old farmer, married to jane (shown here). they have three children. fredrick has run a quarry business for the past nine years and also raises pigs as a secondary business. his monthly income is kshs 8,000.

fredrick has never borrowed from any mfi (microfinance institution) before and was introduced to kadet ltd through a kadet credit officer. he has applied for his first loan to purchase quarry tools like a mallet, hammer, and wheelbarrow as well as piglet feed. with the anticipated profit from the business he intends to start poultry farming.

fredrick's hope is to see his family stable, and educate his children so they can achieve their dreams and goals in life.

eunice a. is a 28-year-old mother of three children. she is married to a businessman who sells second hand belts. she has a small boutique just outside of the main downtown area in kisumu. she buys her clothing stock from busia, which is on the border with uganda. this is her first loan.

in this video, you can hear the interviewer greet eunice saying "idhi nade" -- which is luo for "how are you?" eunice responds, "adhi maber," meaning "very good." most people living in kisumu descend from the luo tribe, the same tribe as obama's father. at the end, the interviewer fluctuates between kiswahili and luo saying "asante sana" in kiswahili, meaning "thank you," and "erokamano," which in luo means "thank you." the voices in the background are coming for a weekly k-met borrower meeting. to see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/


k-met, the ngo giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional mfi. rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in kenya. to read more about k-met’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutpartner?id=24

as a married mother of four children, ritchell works hard to support her family.

she has a fish vending business in the philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice, pig fattening, and selling bananas.
ritchell is borrowing php 20,000 through nwtf to purchase additional boxes of fresh fish to sell.

she successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

ritchell has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from nwtf. she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

zulfiy lives in the region named dangara. this place is in the south-eastern part of tajikistan. she is 41 years old and the mother of 2 children. her eldest daughter goes to medical college. the other one is in high school. zulfiy does not have higher education. 

the family income depends on her business, which she has had for four years. zulfiy has a sales point at a market in dangara. there she sells different types of clothing. she would like to increase her turnover and expand her business. 

zulfiy needs a loan which will allow her to increase her family's capital. sheneeds your help very much. please help!

zita has signed up for her membership with pmpc and requested the needed capital to start a sari-sari store business. she is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time borrower like her.

zita is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. she wants to take advantage of the good fortune. recently, she requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

in the future, she hopes to have a decent home for the family.

kelly, 47, is a cheerful, enthusiastic woman.  she’s a teacher by profession and currently is exercising it.  however, she also sells cosmetics.   

she lives in her own house with her parents, two brothers and her adult son.  for her, selling cosmetics is very enjoyable.  she uses catalogues to offer products to her friends and acquaintances personally and offers up to 15 days credit.  she’s been in this business for three years and does very well because of the demand her products have.  

she likes her work because it provides extra income and she improves her economy this way.  it gives her free time and it has made her well-known in the social circle she belongs to.  she plans to grow and to open a locale to sell perfume and cosmetics so she is grateful to mfp for the loan granted and once again promises to be punctual with this latest loan.  on the other hand, she feels good and satisfied with her group in the communal bank.  she considers it to be a responsible group that’s concerned for the wellbeing of its members and with the punctuality of their payments.  

she will use the requested 2,000 new soles to buy cosmetics and perfumes in a variety of presentations in larger amounts to have on hand when her customers require them.

this gentleman is single and a very hard worker. in order to provide for himself he learned the upholstery trade, which he practices today. he builds furniture, beds and cushions which he sells to his clients. as he has run out of materials necessary for his business, he is requesting a loan from wages to purchase foam and fabric.

translated from french by allana carlyle, kiva volunteer

rosa has been a member of the "damas responsables" loan group for seven years, during which time she has become good friends with other group members.  together their mutual goal is to improve their income and move forward with their families.  rosa lives in the area surrounding cuenca, a city with natural and architectural beauty.  it has been a world heritage site since december 1999 and the city's food pleases the palate of all who visit.

rosa is 45 years old, married and has five children, aged 23, 24, 17, 10 and 4 years old.  the two eldest work and support the household financially.  rosa's third daughter is in high school, while the youngest two are in one of the city's primary schools.  rosa's husband is an employee with a private business.  the family lives in their own house.

rosa has had a grocery shop for fifteen years, working seven days a week with no fixed timetable.  she also sells fast food and make-up.

rosa will invest her loan in buying supplies for her shop and thus will continue to expand it.

rosa's dream is to have no debts and to have her own capital.

hajaratu i. is a palm oil extractor at abura. she has received junior high education. hajaratu is married to a farmer and has eight dependents. she helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. her loan will be used to purchase more palm fruits to process oil to meet the demand of her customers. she hopes to use the new profit to educate her dependents.

suryia is a working woman. she is the mother of 5 children and lives with her family in the town of sialkot, pakistan.

she has been providing the service of cloth stitching in her locality for the last 10 years. she is quite popular for her skills in stitching. her work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. over the years, she has established a good clientele.

she now wants to acquire some raw materials like needles, thread, buttons and cloth, so that she will gain some additional revenue from it. unfortunately, she lacks the financing to do so. therefore, she has requested a loan from jws pakistan, a field partner of kiva.

suryia and her family are very appreciative to kiva and jws pakistan.

the nyomo jormo group is a group of two energetic and hardworking women who work hard to improve their standard of living. the group members live in the localities of teshie.

patience, the group representative, is a 32-year-old married woman with two children. she has been in the market business since 2010. they anticipate sustainable income flow and potential growth for the business because there is a ready market for her products. 

patience deals in the purchasing and supplying of yams. she therefore seeks a loan to buy more yams to sell. she and her counterpart manage their individual business strategically through the training that id ghana offers.

they are very grateful for the love and generosity id ghana offers through loans.

agnes is 34 years old, married and blessed with seven children who are in primary and secondary school. she joined hand in hand eastern africa (hih-ea) in the year 2014 and has been trained on enterprise development and financial management.

she does maize, kale, tomato and french bean farming. she is borrowing a kiva loan to buy more seedlings and fertilizer so as to improve on production. she hopes this will increase her income, which she will use to pay school fees for her children and provide clothes for her family.

she is grateful to kiva and its lenders for the support and promises to repay promptly.

chorn (pictured here) is 40 years. she lives in posen chey district, phnom penh, cambodia. she had been married since 1994.  she has three daughters and they are still young.

chorn is a garment factory worker with three years experience, while her husband is a farmer with a long time of experience.

she would like to apply for a loan to buy more cows to raise.  she hopes that in the next year she can get some money for the cows.

halifatu is 22 years old and lives with her mother in the west gonja district. she is a retailer of women’s footwear and underwear and is requesting a loan in order to purchase her products in bulk. she plans to use the profits earned to take care of her siblings and save for further education.

she also volunteers as a camfed learner guide, helping local high-school students find their own strengths and leading discussion groups about how they can create a better world. halifatu's dream is to become a professional nurse.

gloria still belongs to the "inti" communal bank of asociación arariwa, located in cusco, perú.this communal bank is three years old, and things are going well for all of the members. ("inti" is a quechua word meaning "sun").
gloria still lives in the historical city of cusco, in the department of cusco, peru. the majority of people in cusco run different businesses, mostly related to tourism.
gloria is still selling coffee, cocoa and honey. she transports her products from the city of quillabamba, cusco department. with her previous loan, gloria was very successful and her income increased. gloria needs this loan to buy honey.
gloria is grateful for this opportunity and promises to repay her quotas as scheduled.

lorna is a 31-year-old married woman with six children, five of whom are still in school. she is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the philippines.

she requested a php 5,000 loan amount through nwtf to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, meat and spices, and other supplies needed in her business.

lorna has been in this business for two years. in the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

aneela is a 25-year-old woman living with her spouse in the area of multan, pakistan. she is a mother of one child. her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family but aneela has been running an embroidery business for five years to meet other expenses. aneela's native language is punjabi which she speaks with her family and she speaks urdu culturally and for her business. they live in their own house made of brick that has drinking water, electricity and plumbing.

aneela's embroidery business is very famous in the area and that is the reason her business runs well. due to good relations her business has increased. aneela wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. this is why she wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins and pearls of various colors in advance, to have in stock. she requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand. the challenge aneela is facing is to have sufficient capital to run the business and to be able support her family in its present form.

therefore, aneela humbly requested a loan from brac pakistan. through this loan, she will be able to buy the thread, fancy cloth, sequins and pearls of various colors that she needs.

aneela and her family are thankful to kiva, its lenders and field partner brac pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

asteria is a 43-year-old married woman from talibon, bohol. she has 3 children. 

asteria earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. she has operated her store for more than 3 years now. 

asteria would like a loan to buy more inventory to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and biscuits, condiments and cooking oil. 

this loan will enable asteria to increase her inventory thus attracting more buyers to her store.

in the future, asteria dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

hajara, a babban gona maize farmer, is married and lives in a modest mud house with her family in the village of kanawa, nigeria. she is an expert farmer who has invested time and resources in her farm and like every parent, hopes to send her children to better schools.

thanks to previous loans from kiva's field partner babban gona, hajara was able to buy additional farmland. she now has decided to apply for a 164,101 ngn loan to get access to high-quality seeds that are locally adapted and widely accepted in her local community. she will also have the recommended pesticides and fertilizers based on the results of her field’s assessment.

this assessment plus better inputs will enable hajara to optimize her farmland, where she can attain yields of up to 3.8 metric tons per hectare, two times the national average in nigeria. this will not only increase her income to 2.8 times the national average but also ensure that she can continue to provide for her family.

hajara says being able to buy additional farmland has been her greatest benefit as a babban gona member. she looks forward to using her additional income to send her children to better schools and overall to a brighter future with babban gona as she, too, has joined the fight against poverty.

vilma is a member of the alondras community bank. she is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and her son. vilma and her husband are artisans who both make weavings and sell them in the city market. vilma needs a loan of 1500 soles that she will invest in wool and warp threads. vilma dreams of building her own home and of increasing her production. \r\n

translated from spanish by rachel crouch, kiva volunteer

mercy has been practicing farming for the last five years in ndunyu njeru town. she is a 30-year-old single lady with five children.

she was introduced to kadet by a credit officer from kadet. this will be her first loan. she plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizers, seedlings and cater for the labour.

in the future, mercy hopes to increase farm production by practicing large-scale farming

avargasaihan is a 46-year-old man who lives with his wife and a son in the capital city of mongolia. his son is employed. his wife is a retiree. he has been running a taxi service business since 2001. during these years, he has raised the family income significantly. 

he has been driving his van for 11 years. he is an experienced driver who has a further plan to expand the business, but now his van needs to be repaired. avargasaihan is an honest and hardworking man who says, "i would like to expand the business activity by having my car repaired so that i could continue my business successfully." the total amount he is requesting is 1,550,000 mnt to buy spare parts for his car.

wesal is a 42-year-old married woman from al aqaba, jordan and a mother of six children.

wesal has a small shop selling home products and she is requesting a loan of 500 jd to purchase more products for business purposes.

wesal is looking to establish a bigger shop for her business so that she can enlarge her customer base and increase her income.

virginia has already repaid her first loan, and she is happy with it since her business is doing fine and having many customers. she wants to take the second loan to restock her shop with a variety of products like washing detergents, cooking fat and other stock.\r\n\r\nvirginia's shop was very attractive after adding some stock to her shop, and it attracted so many customers. her family has succeeded in life, and their two children are educated to higher levels.

loeuth’s group live in a rural village in siem reap province in cambodia. loeuth makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. in their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

the borrower belongs to the sirenachayoc communal bank. this bank is located in the district, province, and department of cusco.

the borrower, carlos, is a person with desire to get ahead. the borrower works as a stevedore at a company. it is going very well for him since it is a secure job and he works hard to bring his family the best quality of life. through this work, the borrower gets his family ahead. the borrower asks for the loan to purchase a sound system for his house.

the borrower thanks the kiva investors and promises to make the established payments.

antonia del carmen v. makes and sells tortillas. doñatoña, as she is affectionately called in her neighborhood, has to get up very early in the morning to make the tortillas so that they will be nice and hot before her customers go off to their work sites. this business is very good in the area because most of the inhabitants eat tortillas; just imagine that there are people who are incapable of eating even a small bite of food if they can't do it with a tortilla. doña toña's work as a mother has ended; however, she has two granchildren under her care because her daughter works outside the home. she needs funding to buy tortilla raw materials.

translated from spanish by michael bujazan, kiva volunteer

moisés did not have the opportunity to study. he is single and has no children. he lives with his mother, siblings and nieces and nephews.

moisés earns a living growing corn and beans and has 10 years of experience in this field. he gets up at 4 am to go to work.

he will use this loan to buy fertilisers for his bean crops and also to pay for labour.

él sueña con comprar un terreno para hacer su casa y tener un mejor negocio para mejorar su vida.

jamila khanum baji is married to m. r., and they have been living in borewala, pakistan, since past 10 years. her husband is a painter by profession, who goes to people’s houses to paint when they place an order with him. jamila baji helps him by sewing clothes. she takes orders from her neighbors and relatives. she does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. she is applying for a loan to buy material (paint brushes, big paint drums) for her husband’s painting business.

she is the group leader of two other women from her locality. bushran baji wants a loan to buy cds for her cd shop. nasira baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

this is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. the members mutually guarantee one another's loans. if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

fatuma is married and has two school-going children. they live in their own house, which doesn't have electricity or piped water. fatuma's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

fatuma has operated a business selling khangas (wrap cloths for women). she sells these to passersby from her home and door-to-door to her neighbors. 

a major challenge she faces is the lack of capital to expand her business.  therefore, she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.
currently, she is requesting a 50,000 kes loan to purchase bales of khangas to resell.

martha learned dressmaking when she was very young, thanks to her mother, who was a dressmaker all her life.

she is an enterprising, warm woman, who is always attentive to her customers. she is very grateful for all that she has been able to achieve thanks to the support of interactuar.

she gets up very early each day and works for about 9 hours. she is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine. she has lots of plans for her business, and hopes to have a larger workshop where she will be able to employ people and increase her customer base.

to find out more about the entrepreneurs and loans at interactuar, join the “friends of interactuar colombia” lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia.

duglas lives with his wife, three children and his mother. one of his children is studying and his wife is a homemaker.

duglas has worked in agriculture for the past 15 years. his father introduced the work to him as a child. duglas has land where he plants maize and sorghum and works each day from very early until late.

he needs the help of a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to apply them to his cultivation of maize and achieve an excellent crop.

he dreams of having an excellent irrigation system to be able to work with leafy vegetables in the summer since his passion is to work in agriculture, and also he dreams that one day his children will succeed in life.

monica n. lives in the mulago neighborhood of the city of kampala, uganda. she is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. she also takes care of her sister’s children. she lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. her major monthly expenses include rent, medication and feeding the family.

monica has a business selling bitenge (african wear: a single piece of cloth worn like a sarong). she has been in this business for seven years, and she works six days a week. monica sells this african attire in a shop which she rents for 40,000 ugandan shillings per month. she mostly sells retail. she also generates additional income through poultry farming.

monica has requested a loan of 300,000 ugandan shillings from mcdt sacco, which she will use to buy more bitenge. the main business challenges for monica include seasonality and transportation.

monica’s goal and aspiration is to construct her own house.

maria didn’t have the opportunity to go to school. she is married, and her children are independent. from the time she was young, maria learned to make bed mats. it is a beautiful artisan occupation that allows her to cover the household needs.

thanks to her previous loan, she was able to invest in her work, and she has already paid off the debt. she needs a new loan to purchase more tule reeds in order to continue making bet mats. in the future, she dreams of having a formal business that generates more income for her.

the members of the group santa madalena met each other 8 years ago. they are friends and they work in the same neighborhood. they have already asked for 9 loans from banco do povo crédito solidário (bpcs). patricia sells cosmetics, maria elizeuda is a hairdresser and noeme owns a hair salon. maria is the group leader and she is 53 years old. she is single, she lives with her elderly father and she doesn't have children. she lives with her family in diadema, são paulo. she is an honest, hardworking person very devoted to her work.
maria sells bedding products, table cloths and bathroom towels. she works in her community door to door to support her family. she has 5 years of experience in the business. she started working in this area because she needed to help support her family as her father is old and her mother passed away. this activity is special for her because she really likes it and she has great relatiopships with her clients.
maria needs this loan to buy winter clothes, bedding, table cloths and bathroom towels. in the future, she plans to expand and include more products and increase her client pool.
she is proud of her activity because she can plan for the future and remain close to her family to take care of her dad. in the future, she would like to buy a car. maria would like to tell her investors that she understands how important they are and she is happy with their contributions.

jaquelin, 37, lives in the southwest part of barranquilla  with her husband and 2 children, 19- and 21-years old.  she operates a business selling clothing and other merchandise.  she buys the products she sells from local stores and wholesalers.  she pays cash for the merchandise and sells to her customer--neighbors, often--on credit.  she started the business in july 2010, spurred on by a friend who had long had a similar business.  jaquelin had very little to start with, but she was disciplined and worked hard and her efforts paid off.  the business has expanded in the 4 years since she started it and jaquelin is ambitious for its future.  she wants to grow the business and open her own shop.  for now, jaquelin is applying to fundacion mario santo domingo for a kiva loan that she will use to stock her business with the merchandise--pants, shirts, purses--that she needs to carry on the business.

feliz is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.  he lives in his own home in tambogrande, an agricultural area located in piura region, more than four hours from the city of chiclayo, capital of lambayeque region.

feliz has been farming for 10 years.  he grows cacao, lemon and banana plants which he harvests every two weeks.  he also raises sheep.  he takes them at a young age and when they have reached a good level of development he sells them in the local market.  feliz has a small plot of land near his home where he carries out these activities.  he has requested a loan for 1,500 peruvian soles to buy organic manures and fertilizers for his crops.  he hopes to be able to improve the quality and quantity of his fruits so that he can increase his sales and income.

feliz is a father who is committed to his family and he is always looking out for their well-being and development.  people who know him have a lot of respect and affection for him.

isiyaku, a babban gona maize farmer, is married and lives in a modest mud house with his family in fulani gimba village. isiyaku is a meticulous farmer who has invested time and resources on his farm and like every parent, hopes to see his four children work twice as hard and become successful in the future.

owing to his inner zeal and enthusiasm, isiyaku is able to ensure that his family eats three square meals a day. in order for isiyaku to keep improving his yield and as a result feed his family; he needs access to high quality inputs, such as fertilizers, herbicides and better-yielding seeds. luckily, as a babban gona member, isiyaku will be provided with a full suite of the best inputs to optimize his farm and increase his yields up to 3.5 metric tonnes per hectare; 2.3 times the national average.

with increased yields and income of up to 3.5 times the national average, isiyaku looks forward to using his additional income to pay his children's school fees. isiyaku is a happy babban gona farmer and holds when he had a good harvest as his best memory as a babban gona member. isiyaku looks forward to a brighter future with babban gona as he too has joined the fight against poverty

thanks to her perseverance and courage, jentrix and her household can lead a respectable life. jentrix is a humble, honest, and very hardworking mother on this planet earth. she has a lovely family that she really adores very much.

she never had the opportunity to advance her education, but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. jentrix started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. throughout those years, she has gathered much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips.

jentrix practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success.”

she is seeking a loan of 50,000 kes to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil, and a ready market for horticulture products, jentrix wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

jentrix hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions. through an improved income level, she will be able to assure her children of a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm which will also have an impact on society.

cheoun, 22, is a young farmer living in kampong cham province and she has two dependent children who are all in school. growing cassava and rice farming are the primary sources of her family’s income for four years. she is able to earn around 11usd per day. recently, the price of crop is decreasing, which is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family’s living.

due to lack of money to upgrade her family’s living, she decides to take a kiva’s loan in order to buy a decent latrine for her family’s uses to improve the health and protect her children from illness. this is cheoun’s first time with visionfund. she hopes that this loan will help her to reduce the cost of health care service, which able her to save more money to future needs and keep sending her children to school.

magdalena owns a basic goods store. she learned her work through observation and started her business two years ago. magdalena's schedule is from six in the morning to six in the evening, monday to saturday. magdalena's advantage is that her store is in front of their house. she lives with her husband and has seven children.

the loan that she has requested will allow her to have the economic availability to improve her business by buying snack foods, canned goods, and spices. she hopes to earn better profits to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

she aspires to grow her business and improve her family's quality of life.

minu is 51 years old. in 2013, she established her grocery store business.

minu has already received and successfully repaid two loans from patan bpw, and she used her most recent loan to buy groceries for her business.

in the future, she plans to uplift her family's economic condition. she thanks you for your support.

greetings from uganda! this is edward. he is the head teacher of st. francis junior school a mixed school in the peri-urban area of budo, wakiso district with 700 students. st. francis junior has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a uv water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. the school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. the loan will enable the school to purchase a uv water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

st. francis junior will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. this will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. edward ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

consuelo is 73 years old and married with 12 children. she works very hard to provide for them.

consuelo runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

she has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

in the future, consuelo would like to save enough money to expand her business.

nancy, 58, is a merchant who sells colognes, makeup, jewelry and other goods. she joined a multilevel company and over time has expanded her customer base. but now she does not have enough capital to satisfy the needs of her customers so she is requesting a loan. it is her first credikiva loan through the mario santo domingo foundation. this is to fill orders for creams, colognes, makeup and accessories.

with this loan she hopes to offer more credit to her customers so they will buy more products which will increase her profits. her goal for the future is to increase her capital and buy a house.

nargis is a 51-year-old woman who lives with her spouse in the area of multan, pakistan. her native language is punjabi, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks urdu culturally and for her business. she is a mother of four children. they live in their own house made of brick that has drinking water, electricity, and plumbing.

her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family, but nargis has been running an embroidery business for five years to meet other expenses. her embroidery business is very famous in the area, and that is the reason her business runs well. due to good relations, her business has increased.

nargis wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. that is why she wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance to have in stock. she requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand.

the challenge nargis is facing is to have sufficient capital to run the business and to be able support her family in its present form. therefore, nargis humbly requested a loan from brac pakistan. through this loan, she will be able to buy the thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors that she needs.

nargis and her family will be thankful to kiva, its lenders, and field partner brac pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

kimsong's group lives in a rural village in kandal province in cambodia. kimsong works as a farmer and construction worker to support his family. in his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help kimsong safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

dear kiva community!

maria is a hardworking mother from a remote village in the kenyenya area of kenya. thanks to her daily efforts, she has managed to give her children a good start by providing them with a good quality education.

maria has a farm where she grows crops and raises livestock; she also earns some income from a personal business. she never had a formal education and is content with the farming lifestyle. the kenyenya area is a favorable one for farming, so she is seeking a 30,000 kes loan through kiva's field partner juhudi kilimo to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to enable her to grow more vegetables, reap maximum profits, and increase her business.

being a woman and accessing funds in kenya, especially around kenyenya, is very challenging, but maria feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as kiva that help enterprising women like herself. she is always working to improve her family’s living conditions, but her biggest dreams are to become independent and support her family by herself, secure her children’s future, and to buy a home.

lourdes is a member of the communal bank "mas que vencedoras," and this is her third loan.  she lives in the city of azogues, a city that, due to its geography, sits astride a slope.  here the people are kind, gentle, and tenacious.  the most intriguing aspect of the town is its church, which is located at one of the highest points of the city.

lourdes, 28, is married and has 2 children aged 2 and 2 months.  her husband is a tailor.  they don't own a home, so they live in a rented dwelling.  

lourdes works in her own business alongside her husband.  she makes sports clothes and other garments, a trade that she learned on the job.  she works mondays through saturdays.  she will invest this loan in the purchase of fabric and threads.  her dream is to have her own house.

jaime arturo is an entrepreneur who has his own business where he sells snacks, coffee, and cell phone minutes. jaime's work schedule runs from 7:30am to 7:00pm, monday through saturday. although jaime arturo has difficulty walking due to an illness he had when he was a child, he works very hard to earn his own income. jaime arturo needs to purchase supplies such as snacks, sweets, and cookies that will allow him to increase his sales and thus his income, and improve his quality of life. jaime arturo's dream is to be able to have his own house.

in the highlands of guatemala, there is a town called vasconselos that is populated by indigenous maya “kaqchiquel”. the men mainly work in the fields cultivating corn and the women create beautiful traditional textiles. specifically, the textiles are made in the “ikat”or “jaspe” manner when the yarn is resist dyed. hanks of yarn are tightly tied and then dipped into dye. the tied portions resist the dye. once the yarn is dried, weavers, like the ones in vasconselos, make it into cloth with various designs incorporated into it. the cloth is then transformed into elaborate blouses and skirts that are representative of the area.

the friendship bridge trust bank “xejuyú” is located in vasconcelos. five of the seven members of the trust bank work in producing textiles. they are requesting a new loan in order to introduce new designs, be more competitive and increase production. matea is a 40 year old member of the trust bank. she is the hard-working mother of six children and tries her very best to meet their needs. because she is recently separated from her husband, matea has to work two jobs to support her children. she has requested a loan from friendship bridge that she will use to purchase additional thread, dye and paraffin in hopes of increasing her business. matea sets a good example by her strong work ethic and perseverance. she looks happily looks forward to the next chapter of her life, realizing positive changes and being able to move forward.

like the other clients in friendship bridge, matea has high hopes for her children. she realizes that education is a key to a successful future. her biggest dream is that she will be able to watch her six year old son complete his education. her other children were not able to go to school because they had to work to support their big family. matea looks forward to the monthly educational trainings that the friendship bridge loan officer presents on topics like effective business administration and budgeting, nutrition and health, as well as women’s rights and self esteem. other relevant topics are covered as well and the information is of great use to matea and the ladies. all realize that education is essential for them to improve conditions in their lives and move ahead!

the friendship bridge trust bank “xejuyú” appreciates the kindness and generosity of kiva investors. the women are committed to working hard to repay the loans. they are committed to achieving success in their businesses and empowering themselves. they will create a more prosperous and successful life for themselves, their families and their community of vasconcelos!

luis, a man of the country, full of dreams and aspirations in life, wants to support his family with the sweat of his brow. therefore, he started his pig rearing business, a common profession in san pedro de los milagros municipality, where not only the price but also the quality of the pigs raised there stand out.

luis requests a loan in order to buy pigs, food and medicines for them, and materials to make into pens. with his sole objective to take care of his family and help them get ahead, which is what elevates his fighting and thriving spirit.

he works hard every day for 7 hours in various trades. he is a resourceful and restless man.

benson is a 28 year old father of one. he runs a retail shop in nairobi kenya dealing with foodstuff and beverages. he has been running this business for ten years and terms it as favorable. he has requested for a loan of kes. 40,000 to add stock of unga (maize and wheat flour) and beverages. he hopes to expand his customer base and desires to be a prosperous businessman with high returns. he describes himself as focused and industrious.\r\n

lucinda is 46 years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of lagunas, a community dedicated to agriculture, livestock farming and trade, located in the province of morropon in the piura region on the north coast of peru.

she has been raising and selling small farm animals for 10 years. her business is located at the back of her home. she has requested a loan of 1000 soles to buy feed for fattening her animals so that she can offer them at a better price.

greetings from sierra leone.

this is 42-year-old katie from aberdeen branch. she is single with two children between the ages of 6 and 10 years. both of her children are currently attending school.

katie established a cotton business in a busy market area. she sells wax, wooding, lace and other kinds of cotton. she has been in this business since 2008. her business is the only source of income she has. katie says that the main challenge to her business is fewer sales during the rainy season.

she requested this loan through brac sierra leone to purchase more cotton to increase her business. katie says that the extra income from this loan will help to educate her children. in the future, she would like to see her business to grow into a big shop. she thanks you for your support.

musarat is a 32-year-old woman, and a mother of four children. she lives in rawalpindi, pakistan. her husband is a vegetable seller by profession, he sells vegetables e.g. tomatoes, onions, potatoes and etc. he is alone responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

musarat's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. but due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a suitable condition to purchase vegetables for his business purposes.

therefore musarat has applied for a kiva loan from its field partner brac pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

she is very thankful to kiva and brac pakistan.

33-year old marcelina is a loving and affectionate mother. she lives in her own home with her 45-year old husband mariano and their two children, yesenia (14 years) and rolando (3 years). the children are the reason for all their hard work. a year ago, with the savings marcelina had managed to accumulate from her restaurant, she was able to buy a bus which she put to work immediately as local transport. although the bus generates a good income, marcelina knows that she can't set aside the restaurant which has also helped her improve her quality of life. so she still continues to please her customers with the delicious food she prepares. what she most enjoys about her work is the cooking which she does with much care. she’s been doing this work for six years. the most difficult part is finding the time to serve her customers as the restaurant is almost always full. in the future she hopes to better equip the restaurant as she wants to provide her customers with better service. this is marcelina’s third loan with kiva partner mfp. she knows that she has to make all her repayments on time if she doesn’t want to cause problems for the members of the community bank. she is well-like there for her happy approach to life. with the s/. 1500 she plans to buy more ingredients for the tasty lunches she cooks.

translated from spanish by jane agg, kiva volunteer

sofia is 57 years old.  she is a member of the association of women who sell food in a touristy spot on weekends.  sofia is a single mother and lives alone because her four children are all grown up and live independently.  

she says that it is going well for her in regards to her sales but that, in order to be able to finish the food that she has prepared, she stays in her stall until 11 p.m. in order to finish her sales.  sofia has hired a young woman to help her give good service to her customers.  

she will invest her loan in the purchase of products to offer in her food stall.  sofia hopes to fix up her business so that it is more attractive and attention-grabbing.

in the la paz region in portoviejo city, known from colonial times as the royal city of the tamarindos, every 15 days the members of the de crédito 5 de septiembre group meets.

19 year old leonardo lives in this place, where he is in a civil union but doesn't have any children yet. his wife is a housewife. leonardo is a young man who has always like to work honorably to get ahead. he has a position in the local market where he sells cheese and during certain seasons seasonal fruit, particularly fruits from the mountains such as apples, grapes, pears, peaches and other fruits.

when the cheese is scare and he doesn't have many sales, he sells fruit and when the cheese sales are good he sells only cheese. he does this because he has to seek a way to earn money every day and in this way provide a better future. he works every day and thanks to this he is successfully supporting his home.

this loan is to buy cheese as the sales are very good and he wants to take advantage of buying in large quantities. he has been in the grupo de crédito 2 years and he likes it because the loans enable him to finance his business. his dreams are to have his own home as now he lives in his parent's house.

evaline, pictured above, has nine children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. evaline is representing her group of 11 farmers in kakamega south district and is happy to be working with one acre fund for the first time this year.

evaline has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the one acre fund program this season. her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have an overall improved quality of life. with the profits from this coming season, evaline is planning to invest in a business.

a total of 5 acres will be planted by evaline's group, and among them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights.

rodgers is a married man with six children. he describes himself as loyal. he operates a retail business where he sells drinks.

he has been involved in this business for five years. it's in a good location and his primary customers are locals. he says his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

rodgers will use the kes 35,000 loan to buy more drinks. his business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

previous loans were repaid successfully. he will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

evangeline helps her husband in their farm. she earns well from this and successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. she works with patience just to earn a better source of income.

she took a new loan recently from gdmpc to purchase seeds and cover the cost for land preparation. she wants to supply her farm produce in the market to gain more income.
she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

philip is a 29-year-old farmer in voi, kenya. he is married and blessed with one son. his wife provides additional income for the family.

phillip is a farmer, a business he has done for the last one year and he loves it. this marks his first loan from visonfund kenya to finance his farming business. he will use the money to purchase fertiliser and seeds, and the anticipated profit to service his loan and pay for produce transportation. 

he hopes his business will continue to flourish in the near future.

peter is 42 years old, married to mary, and they have two children, ages 16 and 10 years old. 

he has practiced farming in ndunyu njeru for six years and has applied for his seventh loan from kadet ltd to enable him to buy fertilizer and spraying chemicals. he plans to boost his farming business with the anticipated profit.

peter hopes to apply for a bigger loan from kadet ltd to build a strong financial base in the near future.

elena is 42 years old and married with six children. with three of her children in school, elena works very hard to provide for them.

elena runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 8,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

elena has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

in the future, elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

marina, 65, is a good, kind and very responsible woman. she’s married and has children who are all independent adults now.  she owns her house where she lives with her husband spending cheerful days; they work hard because they want to give each other the best.

marina’s work consists in selling fast food.  she spoke with her neighbor and asked if she could sell from his house’s corner and they ceded the space to her.  now, she goes out nightly to sell salchipapas [fried potatoes with fried sausage], salchipollos [fried potatoes with fried chicken], and broaster-style chicken and other products.  she knows that any job will turn out well with effort.  her plan now is to make her food sales business grow.

this will be her 2nd mfp loan and she hopes for your collaboration so that her plans can gel.  she also promises to once again make her installment payments.  she will use the requested amount to buy ingredients like rice, chicken, potatoes and more as well as some kitchen tools to start her new project.

ynes is a member of the “brisas del lago” (lake breezes) communal bank in the district, province and department of puno.  she is 23 years old, single, and she has one child under her care.  she has a post high school eduction.

she has worked with the movimiento manuela ramos for one and a half years.  she used her first loan of 300 soles to invest in her business of selling handicrafts.  she currently devotes herself to selling clothes.

with this new loan for 1,000 soles she will buy merchandise like two dozen sweaters, jackets, and other items.  her daughter and her mother help her in the business.

she wishes to have a big store where she would be able to sell clothes for children and adults.

what she likes most about her communal bank is the support and the unity between the members.

mary is 41 years old. she is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. she lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called wiawso in the western region of ghana. wiawso is a commercial and farming town. 

mary is a trader. she trades in all kinds of underwear for both males and females. she sells at the local market and treks to other towns to sell as well. she also trades in cosmetics. mary buys her goods from nearby towns. she has been in business for one year and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

suleiman is a maize farmer, he is married and lives with his wife and children in a modest mud house in a small village in kaduna.

thanks to his last input loan from babban gona, he gained access to high-yielding seed and fertilizer, and now expects to double his harvest.

as a babban gona member, suleiman will now receive a harvest advance loan, providing him with a cash advance. he will use this loan to build a better house for his family. additionally, babban gona will support suleiman by storing the harvested maize to sell later in the year. now, he does not have to forfeit making a profit by selling his maize at low harvest prices.

suleiman can now generate earnings of up to four times the average nigerian farmer’s annual income. his happiest memory as a babban gona farmer has being buying more farmlands.

la joven karla patricia m. tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella al 100%.
ella se dedica a vender productos para uso personal como ser desodorantes, lociones, perfumes, talcos, aceites, shampoos, acondicionadores, esmaltes de uña, cremas para pies. etc.
karla tiene 3 años de tener su negocio, con el cual ha logrado traer a la mayoria de sus clientes por su buena atencion y la calidad de su producto.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor, tiene que viajar a la frontera entre honduras - el salvador para comprar dicha mercaderia ya que en ese sector es mas barato todo.

mao’s group lives in a rural village in battambang province in cambodia. mao does work as farmer to support his family.

in his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

having a water filter at home will help mao safeguard the health of his family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

madalena is requesting a loan of $ 600 to improve her business. she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as  children's shoes, adult shoes and children's bags.  she opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 350.  she is a hardworking woman and hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

the group sueños cumplidos meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of el palmar in the city of manta. the city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited throughout the year and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions. this area is currently affected by the earthquake of april 16th.

juana, 37, is married and from this relationship has two children of 14 and 16, who attend school. her husband is a taxi driver.
she works selling avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies accessories). she started this business to make some income on her own and help her husband with the house expenses. she sells from door to door during her free time and also sells on her house where her better known customers visit. 

she will give part of the loan to her husband who needs certain spare parts to fix his taxi. this taxi is his working tool and, when fixed, he will be able to provide a better service and be preferred by his customers.

she will use this loan to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics and spares parts for the taxi. she has been a member of the group for 6 years and she likes it because with the loans, she can take advantage of better offers.
she dreams with a new taxi for her husband.

decenia is married with two children; she runs a piggery for a living. she has been raising pigs and selling them in town to earn well for the family. she was also engaged with other businesses, like transportation services and nipa making. she always finds ways to augment their living. 

she borrowed a loan from gdmpc micro credit to purchase feed and do piggery maintenance. 

she is hopeful to improve her business; she earns a good income currently. she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

gregoria is a member of the “virgen de guadalupe de oropesa” communal bank, which is situated in the district of oropesa, in quispicanchis province and cusco department.
gregoria, who is a responsible and determined woman, is still hiring out trucks. she hopes to boost her income through her business so that she can continue to support her family. she has been running her business for some time and it is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day, as it is thanks to the business that she can support her family.
she is applying for the loan so that she can have one of her trucks repaired.
she is very grateful for the loan and promises to repay it back as agreed.

ekua is a representative of the onua-do group, located at teshie in the greater accra region of ghana. she sells clothes and braziers in a busy marketing area where there has been an increase in customer demand.

she is an experienced and well-focused businesswoman who is on her seventh cycle of seeking a loan to enlarge her business for her buyers' satisfaction. she works so hard to sustain her business and also to supply goods for her buyers.
