ekua will be very grateful if her needs are met due to her loyalty and attitude of repaying loans.

benford, 23, is a very passionate dairy farmer based near chuka, kenya. he is a young bachelor with an untamed ambition to make a difference. benford has been doing mixed farming for the last five years to fend for himself. his primary income sources are milk and tea. to make extra income, he is involved in other personal businesses.

he stated that the part he most enjoys is when he is collecting returns. his biggest challenge is lack of capital. 

benford is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. the additional milk will help fulfill the current demand. with the loan, he is going for a productive animal, which will on average produce 15 litres of milk per day. having understood the market requirements, he wants to expand the dairy farm in a modern manner with more animals so that he can diversify the farm’s products. 

your loan will help benford make enough money to afford the high farming expenses. he stated that the loan will benefit his family by providing him with the financial ability to improve their livelihood.

susan has owned a tailoring shop since 2011. in the past, susan would do clothes and pants repairs as well as sew ready-to-wear clothes. her quality of work has been good, and she is well-known in her community as well as those nearby.

soon, susan started getting orders for sportswear to include jerseys and sports jackets. susan is thankful for this, but she has difficulties fulfilling the demand. her husband has already retired from work and receives only a meager pension from the government. as such, susan is requesting a php 12,000 loan to buy 10 rolls of assorted fabrics, five rolls of garters and thread.

with this, susan is hoping to satisfy the orders of her customers and therefore establish a good business relationship with them. she knows that this will help her earn more and continuously support her family, especially two of her children who are already in high school.

vincentia is a member of the group called most holy and lives in dansoman. she is 38 years old, married, and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. she has been selling tilapia fish for 17 years. this is her fifth loan cycle with id-ghana. with the kiva loan that she receives, she will increase her capital and buy three big baskets of fresh tilapia fish to supply to her customers and earn more money. in the coming years, she would like to buy a taxi to earn more money and to see her children in school. she, together with seven others, need a total amount of ghs 6500 to increase their businesses. the colleagues are into the sale of cooking oil, wax-prints groundnut, second-hand clothing and bread.

narcisa is a 65-year-old married woman from bohol, philippines. 

she has been engaged in a sewing and dressmaking business for more than five years now. this is the source of her income.

narcisa is asking for a loan to buy more cloth, thread, needles and other materials for sewing. through this, she will be able to accept more requests from her customers and clients.

narcisa dreams of making her business a success. moreover, she wants to save money for reinvestment in the same business and savings for future use.

malohat was born in 1973 year. she is married and has three children who are the center of her life. 

malohat has a medical education, and she works in a pharmacy. she works successfully and has great experience in this field because she has worked in pharmacy more than 20 years. 

malohat always wanted to see her children as higher educated people and high specialists. now her son studies at the university, and she must pay for his tuition. 

malohat is asking for a loan of 800 usd with this aim. she awaits your mercy.

this is alicia, 52, resident of bacoor, cavite, philippines. she is married to avelino and they have two children who are both studying. she, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. at this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
alicia operates a food stall. in the philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. this is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. it is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  she earns a minimum of php 500 in sales every day.

to help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a php 15,000 loan. she will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

alicia dreams to have another stall and hopes to have a better living. she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of god she studies.

*all cct community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. a fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. the fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of god, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

a retailer of pagnes (brightly-printed west african clothing) and liqueurs at the hedzranawoe market since 2009, ama is the mother of two children. she is on her first loan cycle with wages and is seeking this loan to buy beverages and pagnes in order to respond to her customers' requests. her husband is an electronics engineer.

sarum is 58-year-old and is a mother of two children who lives in a rural area of the battambang province. the sources of her family’s income are from doing rice farming and working on other farm fee to earn extra income for eight years. because of her struggle life, sarum can make around 36,400khr per day to support her family. \r\n\r\nshe has been with visionfund for one cycle already and completely repaid back loan. as the group leader of two, she is applying for this new kiva loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming. she expects her business will provide her more income, which allows her to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

ma.lyn is 31 years old and has two children. ma.lyn is married and has two children who are presently in school.

ma.lyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the philippines. ma.lyn requested a php 6,000 loan through nwtf to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

ma.lyn has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

yvonne is a brave 37 year old woman. left by her husband, she raised her daughter alone, now 18 years old. she has a butcher's shop in the large market of the city on the high malagasy plateaux. 

yvonne has been a partner at vahatra for 6 years. this eleventh loan will allow her to buy new oxes and pigs and also to bolster the business' capital. 

thanks to the profits, yvonne has been able to ensure the education of her daughter who is still pursuing her studies today. additionally, she has already begun the construction of her own house and hopes to be able to complete the finishing touches very soon.

musu is a 50-year-old and is married with five children. musu runs a business where she sells dried meat. she has been running it for the past 42 years.

musu started this trade after receiving money from her partner, who also taught her how to sell. musu, who describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman, often spends 10 hours per day running her business.

in order to further her business, musu has applied for a loan with brac liberia. musu plans to use the loan to buy more dried meat and expand her business. musu hopes to increase her business.

she wishes a big thank you to all people helping her to expand her business.

greetings from uganda! this is swahib. he is the principal of kampala hill academy school, a mixed school in the urban area of kyebando in kampala with 180 students.

the school has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a uv water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. the school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

the loan will enable the school to purchase a uv water treatment system with a 450-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

kampala school will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. swahib ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

hello, kiva community! meet james, a hardworking, dairy and crop farmer in the heart of kerugoya. he has a small personal business. he is a devoted father who loves cooking for his family and providing for their basic needs. however, he has not been enjoying his cooking duties, due to his old, problematic stove (jiko). his jiko emits a lot of smoke and now takes more than a tin of charcoal, which has become quite costly, as has paraffin.

james is requesting a loan to buy an eco-friendly jiko to enjoy cooking for his family and save on costs of charcoal and paraffin. because it's eco-friendly, the jiko will also keep him from contracting any respiratory diseases that may be caused by the increased fumes emitted by his current stove. kindly lend to him!

ricardo is 30 years old. he is married and has two children. he offers motorcycle transport services to the people in his village, especially students within the city. he wants to continue offering safe travel to all passengers and achieve good profits from it. he is now asking for a loan of php 10,000 to buy oil and tires and pay the registration fee for his motorcycle.

in the future, ricardo hopes to manage his business well and save funds for education and his family's emergency purposes.

aurora is 55; she lives with one of her older daughters. some months ago, she installed a shop in her house, which is open practically all day, seven days a week. she sells staple items to her neighbors, who are her main customers.

because aurora provides a very good service to her customers, demand has grown for the merchandise she sells, including vegetables, groceries, candy and drinks. she receives deliveries of merchandise practically every day. the promotions that suppliers offer to sell a new product are particularly beneficial to her.

now she wants not only to continue selling staple items but to expand in the next few months to sell gifts items, stationery and writing supplies. this her first loan application to mfp; she was invited to join the community bank and support its development. the loan will be used to buy soft drinks and writing materials for sale.

translated from spanish by john rynne, kiva volunteer

zainab is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. she owns a house that has electricity and piped water. her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

zainab operates a grocery vegetables selling stall at the market, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. she faces a challenge of competition in her place of operation.

with the kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

blanca is 33 years old, and she lives with her husband and three children. in the last ten years she has worked selling groceries.

she is very happy with the support given to her through the loans. she is requesting her second loan to buy more products that will help her increase the sales volume.

in the future she wants to improve the conditions of her house. for now, she is investing in the growth of her business and in helping her family with their basic needs. blanca was never able to go to school and her biggest dream is that her children can keep studying.

cheroline works hard to support three children. she is widowed and has a fish vending business in the philippines.

cheroline requested a 5,000 php loan through nwtf to pay for materials and labor to construct a sanitary toilet for her family.

cheroline is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environment protection.

danelia del carmen is a single mother of three children who are in school: one is in college and the others are in middle school. she is a native of jicaral, a town that is located 30 kilometers from the city of el sauce. she makes a living as an elementary school teacher. as a result of her effort, sacrifice, and hard work, she has her own humble house. it is simple, but it was built with dignity. in addition, as a result of her humble work, she has moved her children forward by herself. today, she is very proud of them because they are well-behaved and studious kids. \r\n\r\ndanelia is seeking support from kiva and ceprodel once again because she needs to purchase school supplies as well as school shoes and uniforms for her children. things are increasingly more expensive in nicaragua, yet she is earning the same salary. she is also in a difficult situation because her oldest son will start college. she hopes that kiva and ceprodel will continue supporting her so that she can achieve her goals.

maría has been a cocoa producer for 30 years. now, at 50 years of age, she works with the same passion as when she began this work. although her farm has a total acre of 16.1 hectares, she only has 1.75 hectares of cocoa. the cocoa produced on her farm is of the highest quality. it is exported to europe thanks to the support the asociación pueblos en acción comunitaria provides her.

maría lives in the northern central zone of nicaragua, where the greatest problem is accessibility to her community. due to this difficulty, the production costs are high, obliging the producers to have diversified farms. she is asking for a loan to get tools which allow her to do her agricultural work more efficiently. in addition, she needs to purchase environmentally-friendly agricultural supplies, the most expensive in the market, since she maintains her farm with the certification seal of u.t.z. and organic.

the group "las flores" ["the flowers"] is made up of women who work in trade. they all have their own businesses, and they are women who know each other very well, since they live in the same community. the following sections describe the various activities they carry out each day: alejandrina maria d. works in trade, and her main activity is selling groceries. her business operates under the name "pulpería dinora" ["dinora general store"]. alejandrina has worked in this business for several years, and her excellent management during this time has been noteworthy. with the income from her business, she helps her husband with the expenses of their household and children. mrs. díaz' husband works in agriculture, since it is one of the most productive areas of all of the zone of el coyolar jutiapa. her business is one of the best-stocked in the community of coyolar, containing all of the basic necessities for daily life, such as sugar, rice, shortening, soap, coffee, sauces, spaghetti, meat, sausages, cheese, butter, etc. marta facunda m. has worked in her business for several years. her main activity is a small general store, which operates under the name of "pulpería m..” marta tells us that she began with just a few products in her store, but she has gradually been able to expand it. she has invested her earnings back into her business, and in this way she has been able to make it bigger and bigger. her business include the most necessary items for daily consumption, such as sugar, soap, shortening, rice, coffee, spaghetti, sauces, toilet paper, chicken, meat, sausages, etc. her store is located in the house where she lives, and with the profits she receives, she has helped her 2 children get ahead. her live-in partner, marco ruiz, is a beef butcher and farmer. she will use the loan to buy more merchandise on a wholesale basis and thus expand her store's inventory. mariana del carmen m. d. started her business two years ago. she works preparing and selling corn tortillas, a business that is going very well for her. mariana has a daily contract, from monday through friday, for at least l.180.00 worth of tortillas from the owner of the food stand at the multipurpose institute in the municipality of jutiapa, plus what she sells within the community where she lives. this represents at least 5 measures of ground corn each day. mariana tells us that because of the quantities she grinds, a sack of corn only lasts her 8 to 10 days. with the earnings from her tortilla business, she has worked together with her life partner donaldo rodríguez, a farmer, to pay their household expenses and educate their 2 children.

translated from spanish by patricia linderman, kiva volunteer

ehromkhon is 39 years old, married, and she works in retail, having started her own business in 2012.  she buys and sells children's toys and clothes for a shop.  a friend of hers helped her get started in this business.  she saw ehromkhon's difficult financial situation and invited her to work with her.  ehromkhon now efficiently runs her business and she even wants to increase it.  she plans to use her loan to buy a variety of children's clothes and toys to expand her retail activity.  at the moment, ehromkhon lives in khujand with her two children while her husband works in russia.  ehromkhon is a hardworking and dynamic woman.  she works hard to provide for her family and she wants to give her children a good future.

oliver is married with four children, two of whom attend school. she lives in kampala, uganda, and does not look after any additional family members. for the past ten years, oliver has sold charcoal from home. she works seven days a week and also manages rental houses as another source of income. oliver's challenges include seasonality and transportation. her family has access to both electricity and running water and her major monthly expenses include school fees. oliver joined mcdt because the staff members are friendly and it is cheap to become a member.

oliver is requesting a 600,000 ugx loan from mcdt- sacco to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. her dream is to expand her business to earn profits to build more rental houses and to buy a delivery van to improve transportation.

jackline is a 30-year-old mother who is an example of personal growth. she lives in one of the poorest areas of the nandihills area of kenya, an area not only affected by poverty, but also unemployment. in the face of all these issues, the idea of growing and bettering oneself emerged and this was when jackline started practicing mixed farming.

she is married to a fellow farmer. her family's main income source is milk from their dairy farm. however, they are involved in other agricultural activities such as growing bananas, vegetables, fruits and grains.

the biggest problem that farmers from nandihills face is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmer' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. juhudi kilimo partnered with kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around kenya. through these financial services, farmers from nandihills like jackline now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms.

jackline is seeking a 40,000 kes loan to buy farm inputs, such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. this intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and improve the quality of life for her family. jackline hopes to improve the conditions of her house.

help this mother to accomplish all her dreams with this loan!

mukaramhon is an active client of microinvest. cash flows thanks to the loans and her own money, which is why mukaramhon is pleased. she still travels to faraway wholesale markets to purchase goods. although her business isn't easy, she manages well. she dreams of the times when she would be able to save enough money for buying a small store. having paid off her recent loan, mukamarhon decided to apply for another loan, this time for increasing the assortment of light summer fabric.\r\n\r\n

translated from russian by oksana buranbaeva, kiva volunteer

rosame is married and works hard to support her family. she has an ice cream vending business in the philippines and has requested a php 12,000 loan through nwtf to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, ice cubes, etc.

rosame has been in this business for 10 years now. in the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

marilyn wants to increase her income, and plans to do that by getting a loan she can use to buy more groceries to sell. she faces many obstacles, including the high cost of commodities and the school fees she has to pay to make sure her children get a good education. her limited capital prevents her from buying more groceries without a loan, and that is why she has applied for a php 5,000 loan to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, beverages, snack foods, seasonings, laundry soap and soft drinks to resell. with this financial assistance, she believes that can improve both her business and her family's living standards.

akouavi is forty-five years old, married and mother to three children. she lives in baguida and sells haberdashery products from the shop in her home. she buys her stock three times a month from the market.

akouavi has requested this loan to buy rolls of lining fabric and lace fabric, and units of sewing thread. this will improve her profit levels and help her provide for the needs of her children.

john is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of el carmen de viboral. he has two sons who are his biggest motivation and the reason why he works so hard in his business. john has a farm that he inherited from his family seven years ago, and since then, he has been doing a really good job managing it. he dreams of paying for his children’s education so they can be great people, and to fulfill that goal, he wants to increase the number of clients he has at the moment.

john is asking for a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers and seeds to grow new products. support this farmer and loan now!

if you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from interactuar, you can join the lending team called: “friends of interactuar colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

marion is the true definition of a hard worker and a happy mother. she is a farmer in chuka, growing maize, raising poultry, and engaged in dairy farming. she produces milk and eggs for commercial purposes as opposed to many rural farmers who produce for subsistence. 

marion also grows maize for food and sales. these commercial activities place her in a better position to engage in other agricultural businesses which she does. marion is seeking a loan from kiva lenders via juhudi kilimo to construct a cow shed. this will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. 

she has been in the farming business for at least 10 years and has no plans to quit as she finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative. however, her biggest challenges are the poor road network and the lack of market. with your loan, marion will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when she scales up and introduces zero-grazing. 

the long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. the additional income from this development will go to her children’s education. kindly lend to a kenyan farmer with great dreams!

ruth is an elementary school teacher.  she has worked for 14 years for this ministry of education.

she didn't have a house to live in so she began to request loans with ceprodel to build her house little by little.  now she has her own house.  all she needs to do is plaster two rooms, which is why she's requesting this loan.

she's married and has two minor children.  her husband has two three-wheeled vehicles he uses for taxi service in the town.  they are hardworking people who have strived to come from behind and give their children better living conditions.

she's grateful for her loan because it's the only way they can enjoy having their own home today.

rosenel is 17 years old and is the second of three children in the family. her mother almavic supports the family through her food-vending business in the philippines.

rosenel is studying for a bachelor of science in business administration and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

almavic is borrowing php 5,700 to pay tuition fees for her daughter for the first semester of the 2016 school year.

rosenel plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

the main economic activity of mrs. karina is selling shoes for men and women. she started 4 years ago with a starting capital of c$5,000, acquiring merchandise to sell.

she started selling small quantities because nobody noticed her business. however, with time, after some months, she managed to become part of the chinandega market, getting a locale which improves her sales.

ceprodel has offered her unconditional support in a total of 3 loans, which have been paid back in time. these loans have been beneficial for her business, as they have allowed her to increase her shoes stock, and in the same way increase her profit, which in turn has allowed her to acquire better quality products.

translated from spanish by eliana colunga, kiva volunteer.

la principal actividad económica de la señora karina es la venta de calzado para ambos sexos. inició hace 4 años con un monto inicial de c$ 5,000 adquiriendo mercadería para iniciar su respectiva venta.

comienza vendiendo pocas cantidades de zapatos debido a que nadie se daba cuenta de su negocio, sin embargo a través del tiempo y el pasar de los meses logró incorporarse en el mercado de chinandega obteniendo un local donde le favorecen sus ventas.

ceprodel le ha brindado apoyo incondicional con un total de 3 créditos los cuales han sido cancelados oportunamente y el impacto que han tenido ha sido de mucho beneficio para su negocio ya que sus inventarios de los calzados han aumentado al igual que sus utilidades lo que la ha llevado a adquirir mejores productos y de mayor calidad.

zipporah is 30 years old,married and blessed with 3 children.she does farming and has been growing cash crops for sell. she will be using the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell. she plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

houn’s group live in a rural village in kandal province in cambodia. houn makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory worker to support his family. in their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

mr.togtasin is bachelor degree student who studies in a local public university. he has chosen his major as history and socialism. he is very interested in this area. his dream is to influence and create a better place to live around the province where he lives, then start impacting other provinces. he is a very hard-working student. \r\n\r\nthis loan will help togtasin to pay for tuition fees.

marilou is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. she is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. in addition to her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding pigs for commercial sale.

someday she hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

shamim is a 36 years old, married woman with 4 children. she, along with her husband, is running a business making crackers. she deliciously makes them at home and then sell to the people of their community and makes enough through this business. shamim has gradually improved her business with the support of kashf foundation.

she has requested a loan of 60000 pkr [pakistani rupees]. this will help her to purchase packs of oil, salt and flour to increase her sales. she hopes to have an increase in her net income and wants to spend part of it on the expansion of her business.

neneth operates a bakery business to earn an income. she has been engaged in this venture for four years and works hard to support her family. she is married and lives with her family in cadiz.

neneth has requested a loan in the amount of php 10,500 loan through nwtf. she will use her loan funds to buy ingredients for her baked food production business.
 
in the future, neneth would like to save enough money to start up a bakery at the public market.

putu murdani just completed her 1st dinari loan. she used that loan money to improve the flooring of her pig hut and also on the pig feed. at that time she was raising 4 piglets. from them she earned a total of usd 44.

at this moment she has only 1 piglet. she is planning to buy another 2 piglets. therefore she wants to participate in her 2nd dinari loan. she will use the money to buy more piglets and pig feed.

translated from indonesian by antonius gunadi, kiva volunteer

sada is a married woman and stays together with her husband and seven children. she owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

for the past seven years, she has operated a vegetable selling business. she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. she faces the major challenge of seasonality. she dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale grocery in the village. 

with the kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase a stock of tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

anita is married with three children. she is 35 years old and lives in migcanaway, tangub city. anita sells "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick) to earn a living and had this business for 7 years. every month she earns 4,000 php from it. she has requested a loan of 6,900 php to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal. in 2009, anita joined gdmpc. she hopes to increase her savings for the future needs of her family.

scovia aged 52 polite and hardworking, comes from kamwokya-kampala district. she is a widow having lost her husband in 2015, leaving behind 4 children aged between 14 and 28 years,  2 are still school going. she stays with 3 grandchildren. she intended to start her own business but didn’t have enough capital after trying to get some money from relatives and friends who had more problems and were not willing to help her out and the little she collected was not enough to start a poultry business she always wanted.

she heard about ugafode through a friend, joshua and became a member. she now wants a loan to buy more birds, now that the season is on because she dreams of getting a bigger business and investing in other businesses like transport in order to ease the transportation of her agricultural products which are also too seasonal and in addition they also face challenges like competition, price fluctuations and inflation.

scovia wants to extend her sincere gratitude and appreciation to the funders for this great support that is improving and changing lives in the city surburbs.
the extra person etreme left behind is the group chairperson who has a different loan term. he signed the waiver form.

ana maría has been reading tarot cards for 25 years. but for the past 15 years she has prepared ‘flourishing baths’ (a ritual flower bath meant to bring good luck), worked with candles, passed the egg and the guinea pig (a treatment meant to heal illness), and done spiritual cleansing.

her former husband was the one who taught her and even today she is dedicated to this activity. ana maría has clients from all parts of the country that come to her humble house for a consultation. she has clients abroad, to whom she reads the tarot by telephone. she has even traveled to other provinces to do spiritual cleaning. she attends to 10 people in her house daily.

the loans that she has requested will allow her to implement her candles, perfumes and essences. ana maría would like to have her own doctor's office in another zone of lima.

translated from spanish by b, kiva volunteer.

ana maría se encarga de la lectura de cartas del tarot desde hace 25 años. pero desde hace 15 hace baños de florecimiento, trabaja con velas, pasa el huevo y el cuy, y limpia espiritualmente.

su ex esposo fue quién le enseñó y hasta el día de hoy ella se dedica a esta actividad. ana maría tiene clientes de todas partes del país que llegan por una consulta a su humilde casa. tiene clientes en el extranjero, a quienes les lee las cartas por teléfono. incluso ha viajado a provincia para hacer limpieza espiritual. al día, atiende en su casa a 10 personas.

los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para implementar sus velas, perfumes y esencias. ana maría quisiera tener un consultorio propio en otra zona de lima.

alexander, 21, works as an agricultural laborer on a flower farm but in order to earn extra income he wants to start his own business and take advantage of an opportunity of buying a grocery and vegetable store being sold by one of his neighbors that’s presented itself to him.  with this he will be able to increase his income level to contribute to the support of his parents’ home.  

alexander is an energetic, active, driven young man who very much wants to make progress.  because of this, he’s motivated to request the loan that will be used to buy the business to start working in his free time.  he will also hire a family member to help him out the rest of the time because in the near future he’d like to leave his current job because he says the work days are very demanding and the salary isn’t commensurate with all the effort he puts into it.

alexander dreams with seeing his business grow becoming very well-known in the sector that will make it possible for him to earn good income to get ahead and to improve his family’s quality of life.

fotima lives in the rudaki district.  in tajikistan, many streets, districts and cities are named in honor of famous writers and scientists of the tajik people (rudaki is the name of a famous 9th-century persian poet).  fotima has been providing sewing services at home for the past two years.  she is only 21 years old.  she is married and she has two children: a son who is 2 and a little girl who is five months old.  her husband works as a baker in a bakery.  in order to help her husband, fotima takes orders to sew clothes at home and also takes care of her young children.  at the moment, she really needs a new sewing machine.  her old machine will soon break down and fotima has applied for a loan to buy a new machine, so that she doesn't have to lose her source of income.

\nrebecca, aged 26, is an orphan. she and her sister lost their parents at a tender age and she was forced into early parenting of her sister and fending for all their needs, in addition to paying her school fees. she resorted to selling cooked food to earn a living. her dream is to educate her sister up to university level and also build a bigger venue for her business. currently her makeshift restaurant is so small and she wishes to expand it to increase her customer base. with the encouragement from the group chairperson to join the group and acquire loans, she envisions her dreams becoming reality.

38 year old ni ketut sodi is married. her husband works in a private company. ni ketut sodi is highly motivated, ni ketut sodi has 2 children, one of which has been married and the other in college. ni ketut sodi is thankful that her child obtained scholarship from the mayor's office because he is very smart. ni ketut sodi has owned her kiosk for a while. she plans to use the $550 loan to purchase equipments for her kiosk. she sells various snacks and balinese traditional cakes. every day ni ketut sodi purchases her merchandise from negara market. she leaves at 4 am and since the market is close to her home, she is usually back by 5 am. ni ketut sodi immediately prepares her merchandise in the kitchen. she usually opens her kiosk at 6 am. as many people stops by to buy snacks, coffee and tea on the way to school and work. each day she earns about $440 in sales and $55 profit. ni ketut sodi is hopeful that dinari loan can improve her kiosk and increase its profitability.

translated from bahasa indonesia by kresna hartandi, kiva volunteer

ni ketut sodi berumur 38 tahun dan suaminya bekerja disebuah perusahaan swasta. ni ketut sodi memiliki semangat hidup sangat tinggi. ni ketut sodi memiliki 2 orang anak, 1 anaknya sudah berumah tangga dan 1 masih kuliah. ni ketut sodi sangat bersyukur karena anaknya mendapat beasiswa dari bupati karena pintar. ni ketut sodi menekuni usaha warungnya sudah lama.dengan modal yang didapat dari dinari rp.5.000.000,- dipergunakan untuk membeli semua kebutuhan warungnya.adapun dagangan yang dijual adalah berbagai macam makanan ringan dan aneka jenis kue tradisional bali. setiap hari ni ketut sodi berbelanja di pasar negara pukul 04.00 pagi sudah berangkat ke pasar, jarak pasar dengan tepat tinggalnya sangat dekat. sampai dirumah pukul 5.00 pagi ni ketut sodi langsung mempersiapkan dan memasak semua keperluan warung dan rumah tangganya. ni ketut sodi mulai berjualan jam 6.00 pagi karena pagi-pagi banyak yang membeli jajan, kopi, dan teh. setiap hari penghasilan kotor yang didapat rp.400,000,-dan keuntungan bersih tiap hari rp.50,000,-. ni ketut sodi bersyukur mendapat pinjaman dana dari dinari sehingga warungnya menjadi ramai.

razia is 51 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. she has had a business of hand embroidery for the past five years. two of her  daughters (seen in the photo) assist her in making beautiful patterns. razia is zealous about her work and client demand is strong. 

business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate razia nearly every day. her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support the family. razia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

razia is requesting a loan for 20,000 pkr, which she will use to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers. she dreams of running a training center for girls in her village. she would like to teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business and also earn money for themselves. she is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

albert is a forty-three-year-old married man with four children living in kasese, uganda. he is a teacher and has been in service for eighteen years. he has dreams of educating his children to attain high levels of education and of buying land for farming. albert intends to use this money to buy land.

the july 22nd community bank meets every two weeks in the parish of picoaza in the city of portoviejo. it is an area well known for its commerce, for its traditional festivals of st. pedro and st. pablo, and for its happy people.

32-year old nancy lives here. she is married and has a 12-year old son who goes to high school. her husband works overseas.

nancy sells avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories). she works four days a week, from 8:30 am to noon. she says that she loves selling things. the best-selling items are perfume and make-up.

the loan will be used to buy more avon products such as perfume, lotions, and make-up. nancy has been with the community bank for four years and likes the speed with which the loans are made and the lack of paperwork. her dream is to have a permanent place where she can open a business selling clothes.

martha erling t. e. is employed by a cigar factory in greater condega. she is asking ceprodel for a loan to pay for clinical tests that she’ll have done because she’s ill and to pay for medicines thus improving her health. when she finished secondary school she started working in the cigar factory in order to earn family income to contribute to the daily support of the household. she has been working in that firm for about 8 years. she works from 7am until 5pm monday through friday. she hopes the loan will make the lab tests possible so that she can buy the treatment she needs because her income is insufficient by itself to afford the total cost. she is single and has a school age daughter. her daughter is still in elementary school and she must cover all her educational expenses. this is the 10th loan she’s had in a span of 7 years. the impact has been positive since the loans have made it possible for her to buy some of the household utensils she owns.

translated from spanish by michael bujazan, kiva volunteer

alma is a married woman with three children. she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. alma is 34 years old.

alma has a business making hollow blocks in the philippines. alma requested a php 30,000 loan amount through nwtf to to purchase additional materials like sand, cement, etc.

alma has been in this business for seven years. in the future, alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

joel is a 22-year-old young man. he completed 9th grade thanks to the opportunity to study that was given to him by his parents. he's single and doesn't have any children. he currently lives with his parents, and he helps them pay for household expenses.

joel grows 7,000 square meters of corn and beans. he has been in this line of work since he has 15 and he learned it from his father. his father has been a farmer all his life and he taught his son to work and above all to be responsible and honest. besides, thanks to his father he learned to do farm work using animal traction, specifically oxen. they are his source of employment and his means of livelihood, and he needs to keep on renewing them, because they face a great deal of weariness each year from doing this type of work. that's in addition to his work on growing corn.

the loan will be used to purchase farming supplies so that he can have the opportunity to continue working on his corn and bean crops. with the loan he'll purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to be used as a preventive measure for pest and disease control.

joel dreams of moving forward with his college education. for that purpose he needs to keep on working hard, as he has done so far. that way he'll be able to help his family improve their living conditions. he plans to save part of the profits he makes from growing corn and beans in order to pay for college and cover his additional expenses with food and transportation. he also plans to use another part of the profits to repay the loan he has requested.

carmen rosa is 44 years old and is both father and mother to her two children. she was born in the province of anta, in the department of cusco but she now lives in the beautiful city of cusco. carmen rosa has a small coffee shop in one of the bus stations of the city of cusco. carmen rosa sells juices, mate, coffee, cakes, tortas and hot and cold drinks in her coffee shop. on this occasion carmen rosa needs a loan to buy products such as tortas, cakes, sodas and other items.\r\n\r\nthe communal bank "nueva esperanza" consists of responsible, hard-working people who help their families get ahead. the majority of its members live in the city of cusco, where they carry out their business activities. cusco is renowned for being a tourist and commercial area, for its traditional celebration of inti raymi and because it is located near to one of the seven wonders of the world "machupicchu".

dear kiva community! this is ruth, a polite, devoted, responsible, and hardworking woman. she is 32 years old and raises animals and horticultural crops, work that she began from economic necessity.

ruth started practicing mixed farming five years ago, growing maize and keeping dairy cows. she has gained so much experience through these years of farming.

although ruth has been making profits, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mother. her farm has not been producing much of a harvest lately due to the presence of pests and diseases and a lack of fertilizer and good seeds. she is therefore seeking a loan to buy farm supplies and seeds in order to improve her farm.

with the loan, ruth will be assured of a good harvest, and this will translate into more profits and income. she wants what any mother would want for her children: a great future.

you can support ruth in making her dreams come true with a loan. she hopes to improve her family's living through her farm and is very thankful in advance for your support.

nancy is a petty trader who deals in the sale of smoked fish and yams in wegbe, hohoe. nancy has never received any formal education because her parent didn’t see a reason to send a girl child to school. she is married and has one child with her husband, who is into sand mining. nancy has been selling smoked fish since six years ago. she assists her husband with the feeding of the family. her loan will be used to buy a large quantity of fish and yams for resale. she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and increase her working capital.

sara is 44 years old and studied until sixth grade. she is the single mother of three children who are adults now.

sara has had a restaurant for many years. she decided to start the business because she was a single mother and she needed to get ahead with her children. she has shown herself to be very capable and she has also succeeded in getting ahead thanks to the support of 4 kiva loans. she paid all of them back.

she needs a new loan to buy supplies to sell breakfasts, lunches, and dinners at her restaurant.

sara's dream is for her children to study and she hopes to achieve it through hard work.

sarah is 21 years old. she lives in a sector in jordan called baqaa with her 6 siblings and her parents. sarah is studying for a bachelor's degree in biotechnology as a 3rd year student. \r\n\r\nshe is planning to continue her studies and work in her field of study after graduation in order to start helping her family financially. they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is preventing them to pay for her upcoming semester fees. for this reason, she has applied for this loan.

the city of manta is considered to be the most important, popular and visited spa of ecuador because of its beautiful and inviting beaches; it is the first port of deep waters of ecuador and south america. here, a while back, 12 women decided to unite and form the san josé de la 15 de abril village bank and with the help of the loans they've been able to improve their businesses and their quality of life.

one of the members of this group is rosa. she is 53, married and from this relationship they have 4 children, of age and independent. her husband is a security guard. rosa is a woman who likes to fend for herself and earn her own resources for the good of the family. she has a grocery store in her house; there she sells all types of staple products: legumes, vegetables, fruits, meats, water in drums, sodas, ice cream, bazaar items, among others. she started this business 5 years ago with the help of one of the loan. with the help of the loans that she's been receiving, she's gone improving until she has it well stocked and with very good clientele.

she is going to use this loan to stock her store more; she will buy food to continue improving her store. she has been in the village bank for more than 10 years and she likes it because the loans have permitted her to have her store, with which she earns a living. her dreams are to continue improving more and more.

titos, 38, is married and the father of 3 children. he also supports a nephew, who lives with him in a home he owns.

with this loan he plans to buy staple products such as: beans, flour, rice and sugar to resell from his stall.

his plans for the future are to increase the volume of his business by meeting the demands of his customers, to finish his house, and to acquire a means of personal transportation.

he states that his greatest challenges are the insufficiency of funds and the lack of a car to facilitate transportation. he will apply for more loans to realize his plans.

hannah c. is 40 years old. she is married and the mother of three children. currently all her children have completed junior high school. she has multiple businesses. she lives with her husband,a professional tailor, who sews all kinds of dresses.

hannah owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. in addition she also sells linen for sewing, charcoal, tomatoes etc in the community market.

she deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. with her ten years trading experience she wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. she hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children's education. hannah belongs to the village bank called ‘adom akyede’ meaning the gift of grace. she would be grateful for the assistance. she hopes to receive gh¢500 to restock her inventory.

ailina júlia parkin was born in the city of maputo, in the province of maputo. she is 26 years old and is a single mother of her 2 children, ages 3 and 1. she continued her studies through the 12th grade. she lives in her own home with her children and does not support anyone else. she left maputo for the city of boane with her parents. she has worked pumping gas at a galp gas station in boane for the past three years. she learned this job five years ago while working at a petromoc gas station. she works about 14 hours a day and earns a monthly salary of 3.000.00mt that she uses to pay her househould expenses and saves a small amount in the commercial bank bci. she has never had loans with other banks and she found out about hluvuku through friends that are also hluvuku clients. this is her second loan for 15.000.00mt that she will use to buy construction materials (cement, bricks, sand, and others) to continue working on her project. her previous loan was for 15.000.00mt that she used for the same purpose. in the future she would like to apply for more loans in order to finish her project and to build a retaining wall.

translated from portuguese by rachel crouch, kiva volunteer

monica is thirty-eight years old. she is married and has given birth to three children, all daughters who are still in school. she works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. she lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in oda in the eastern region of ghana.

monica is a trader, trading in cereals and other foodstuffs which she procures from nearby communities. she sells in her community and also supplies other food vendors. she has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy cereals in bulk to expand her business.

jeraldine is 28 years old and has four children. she is married and has three children who are in school.

jeraldine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the philippines. jeraldine requested a php 5,000 loan through nwtf in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

she has been raising pigs for three years.

in the future, jeraldine would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

neder is 23 years old and lives with his parents. he grew up in an agricultural family, working the fields. he is now his parents’ right hand because they are elderly, which means that he is the breadwinner of the household. neder is in charge of taking care of each one of his crops so that they can be sold at a good price. they also own cows that he looks after so that they can produce abundant amounts of good quality milk for him to sell. with these two jobs, neder earns a living for his family. this is his first loan with mfp. as such, being part of a microfinance institute is a new experience for him, but since he joined, he has vowed to be responsible with his payments and with the activities entrusted in him by his credit consultant. the money will be used to purchase fertilizer and other products for his crop fields. because these are expensive things, neder will have to pay for the rest of the costs with his own savings.

translated from spanish by elizabeth casian, kiva volunteer

rubelyn works hard to support seven children. she is married and has a fishing business in the philippines. she requested a php 8,400 loan through nwtf to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

rubelyn is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.

clotilde is 30 years old and a native of the district of santa rosa.  she is an extremely hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband teodoro, age 34, and their three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better life.  clotilde and her husband work together every day on their land.  through much effort, they have been able to make their land productive so that they can grow a little bit of everything.  they know that whatever they produce will be of quality.  clotilde grows primarily cacao, coffee, turmeric, and coca leaves.  these products are in great demand at the market.  what she enjoys most about her work is protecting her crops from plagues of insects that could negatively impact them.  on some occasions, she is not able to achieve a sufficient harvest and thereby earns less income.  clotilde has been farming for twelve years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the city of san francisco to be sold.  in the future, she hopes to save the necessary funds to buy additional farmland.\r\n\r\nthis is the fifth loan clotilde has received from mfp.  she feels that this loan will be a great help in developing her business.  clotilde is known in her communal bank for being a very responsible member, a distinction of which she is proud.  the loan she requested will be used to buy traps and insecticides for combating pests that are attacking her crops.

a. oscar is the leader of kyanzaire_hiv/aids tweyambe, bushenyi. he is 34 years old and married with one child. he is in the business of selling produce like beans, millet, and coffee. he operates from kasheshero town selling mostly to town dwellers and he is able to make 100,000/= as weekly profits. he has been in the business for five years after working for someone else until he fulfilled his dream of becoming self-employed. his dream is to be able to construct his own store so that he can stop renting. he needs a loan to be able to buy more produce (cereals) for resale.

nelson is 40 years old and lives in the municipality of fresno. for more than 5 years he has been running his own business; he cuts grass and works as a gardener, something he learned thanks to a friend and which he does because he loves working with nature.

this business is the only job he has to provide for his family: that’s why he wants to increase his profits. he also would love to see his business last in time. right now he wants to invest in his business so he’s asking for a loan to fix his scythe and to repair his chainsaw so that he can keep working.

nelson is a family man, so his dreams revolve around his family, and he wants to pay for his children's education so that they grow up to be good people. you can help nelson to achieve his goals: a loan will get him a lot closer.

rabia is a 25-year-old woman, living with her spouse in the area of muzzafargharh, pakistan. she is a mother of two children.

her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family, but rabia has been running an embroidery business for three years to meet other expenses. her native language is punjabi, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks urdu culturally and for her business. they live in their own house made of brick that has drinking water, electricity, and plumbing.

her embroidery business is very famous in the area, and that is the reason her business runs well. due to good relations her business has increased.

rabia wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. that is why she wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance, to have in stock. she requires some capital to buy the desired items, but does not have sufficient cash on hand.

the challenge rabia is facing is to have sufficient capital to run the business and to be able support her family in its present form.

therefore, rabia humbly requested a loan from brac pakistan. through this loan, she will be able to buy the thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors that she needs.

rabia and her family will be thankful to kiva, its lenders, and field partner brac pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

maribel, 34, is the mother of a very hard-working family. she lives with her husband and their three young children in a house that they own. she prepares and sells different types of food. every day, starting early in the morning, she prepares various typical peruvian dishes (chanfainita, chicken with rice, tallarines [noodles], hen chili, and seco a la huachana [beef stew flavored with cilantro], among others). she covers her pots well and uses her cart to transport them seven blocks from her house, to a traffic circle that is crowded with many people. her customers are the drivers of the buses and motorcars, who like the seasoning of her dishes. she started her business selling just one or two dishes, and now she sells many different foods, based on what her customers suggest that she prepare. she feels very pleased with her work, and now that she's been doing it for 11 years, she also commented that her greatest dream is to build her house from more sturdy materials, in order to improve the quality of life for her children. this is the eleventh loan that she has taken out through microfinanzas prisma. she promises to be punctual with her repayments, and in this way, she will not negatively affect the other members of her communal bank, who have supported her in her efforts. maribel has planned to invest the money she is requesting in the wholesale purchase of ingredients. she would also like to make repairs to her cart, which is indispensable for her business and therefore she wants to keep up on its maintenance.

translated from spanish by katie kavanagh, kiva volunteer

silver is a 39-year-old married man with three children living in bundibugyo, uganda. he has been a teacher for 10 years and he works eight hours a day. silver was inspired to join the service because of the love for the job. he has a dream of educating his children up to the university despite the low pay. silver intends to use the facility to pay school fees for his children.

dioneza is 32 years old, married, and has two children.

dioneza is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the philippines. she requested a php 20,000 loan through nwtf to buy feeds, piglets, and other supplies.

dioneza has been in this business for 4 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

in the future, dioneza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

carolyne is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy, sheep, poultry, and crop farming to make a living. she enjoys farming, for it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.

in the kenyenya area of kenya, where carolyne is from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. their biggest challenge is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be.

juhudi kilimo has partnered with kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around kenya. through these financial services, farmers in kenyenya now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms.

carolyne requested a loan which she will use to buy farm inputs such fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. this loan will enable her to improve her production through use of quality farm inputs. this intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

antonieta is 68 years old and lives in tabo-o, jimenez, misamis occidental. she is widowed with two children. 

antonieta is engaged in a fishing activity and earns approximately php 3,500 each month doing this type of work. she has requested a loan to be used in purchasing fishing tools and fishing nets for her livelihood. 

antonieta has been a member of pmpc for eight years. in the future, antonieta hopes to expand her business.

kiva lenders! meet jemima, one of the most hardworking women on planet earth. jemima, 53, has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. she has always had the strength to overcome it, however, and move forward with her six children. she is very hardworking and a go-getter.

jemima hails from rianyaundi, a remote village in the nyamira area of kenya. this area has harsh weather conditions. to survive, you must have tough skin, but jemima has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past 41 years.

jemima's primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. she also earns income through personal business. jemima is contented with the farming way of life. although she has never had a formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and assured her children and family a decent meal.

the nyamira area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, which is why she is seeking a loan for this purpose. because of good roads, a good climate and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. being a mature woman and accessing funds in africa is very challenging, but jemima is relieved that institutions such as kiva help enterprising women like herself.

jemima is well-disciplined with finances. with her accumulated profits, she plans to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children, who are in college. please help jemima so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

prossy is 22 years old and lives in the town of nasana in the kampala west region of uganda. for the past three years, prossy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

to help expand her business, prossy is requesting a loan for 200,000 ugandan shillings from brac uganda, which she will use to buy more commodities. the loan will help prossy generate increased profits, which she will use to take care of her siblings. prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

prossy is a member of brac's empowerment and livelihood for adolescents (ela) program. in addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. the ela program has increased prossy's future prospects by giving her a loan that has improved her business.

rosalina is 33 years old and single with three children. with two of her children still in school, rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

rosalina runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

rosalina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

in the future, rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

juan is a 34 year old farmer who has the privilege of working every day in a beautiful field where he has an enviable view, so spectacular that it makes him love nature more every day. he works in the fields since he was very young, and here he has a family formed by two children, ages 8 and 7 and his domestic partner. as a farmer he has a problem and that is the high cost of agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, manure, fumigants, etc. faced with this problem, juan wants to request a loan to buy fumigants to finish with the insect plague and keep away some rodents who damage his crops, because he does not have the capital to pay for the inputs needed to have the field in excellent condition. juan distributes avocados, and his main dream is to expand his crops so that he will wake up one day and see the majesty of his fields surrounded by beauty and by abundant crops with which he will be able to improve his family's quality of life.\r\n\r\n

gillem is 44 years old and married with four children.

gillem works hard to provide for her family. she runs a nipa (woven palm mats) retail business in the philippines and requested a php 20000 loan through nwtf to purchase more stocks to sell.

gillem has borrowed and paid three loans from nwtf before this loan. she has been running the nipa (woven palm mats) retail business for eight years and also earns an income from fish pond operations.

gillem aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

mrs. thorn d., 23, is married with one little kid and lives in a part of siem reap province, cambodia. to make her living, she works raising pigs and reselling them to her nearby butcher, making on average around $2 each day. her husband works charging various kinds of batteries for the people in his area, earning around $2 per day of profit. thorn d. would like to use this loan to expand her livestock of pigs in order to increase her income.

nolba maría is 41 years old and offers transport services. she has been doing this for more than 5 years and it is the only income she has to support her family. she began this business with help from her brother who had a car and gave her the idea to give rides to some of her friends, and in this way she at least could have the means to eat each day. it was also in this way that she decided to invest in her business in spite of the problems that she had faced. this loan is for working capital that she will use to buy tires, improve the seats, and other items. she want to buy plates for another taxi.\r\n\r\n

translated from spanish by alison hynd, kiva volunteer

maribel is 41 years old and married. she has five children.

maribel works hard to provide for her family. she runs a general store in the philippines. she has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending. 

maribel requested a php 5,000 loan through nwtf to purchase additional items like laundry soap, shampoo, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. to sell.

maribel has borrowed and repaid one loan from nwtf before this loan. 

maribel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

rosalie ann is from home stead ii, talavera, nueva ecija. she is 32 years old and happily married to robintino. they are blessed with three children who are still pursuing their studies.

she manages a variety store. she sells different kinds of shampoo, detergent, noodles and canned goods. she has been engaged in this business for five years. her monthly income is worth php 20,000.

she is a good client of alalay sa kaunlaran, inc. (aski) and has been granted a loan amounting to php 50,000. the loan will be used to buy canned goods, noodles and other snacks to sell in her store. her dream is to finish the education of her children and to have a house to live in. her dream for her business is to expand it to get more income. she believes that with aski her dream will come true.

john is a kiva borrower. he operates a bicycle transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. he describes his family challenge to be lack of water storage facilities. john will use the kes 10,000 loan to buy a water storage facility to store clean water for domestic use. this will benefit three family members. john hopes that in the future, he will socially and economically improve standards of living of his family. this is his first loan with smep dtm.

fior is the leader of sabanalamarinos unidos 1, which is a group looking to take out a group loan. they are from the town of sabana de la mar, a coastal town in the northern part of the dominican republic. this is fior´s twelfth loan.

fior has been selling women's underwear for more than seven years. her many years selling underwear have made it possible for her to find a good market to buy a bigger amount and a very good quality product. she sells in her house, by walking in different communities, and to other sellers. 

fior and her husband are raising their three children in this coastal town located in the city of hato mayor. her most important challenge now is to provide the best education for her children. 

fior dreams to have an underwear store and to sell for the wholesale market. her profits will be dedicated to provide for her family's needs and to save for her children's university. 

fior and everyone in the sabanalamarinos unidos 1 group are excited to receive your help. they can make an increase in their business capital with this loan.

lily, 50, spends a lot of time managing her rice farming business. she enjoys working on the farm because it provides food, shelter, and clothing for her family. lily is married to ruben and they have four children.

lily would like to continue working on her farm for the sustenance of her family but is limited as to financing the business. that’s why she joined community economic ventures, inc. to be able to obtain a loan intended for her business. she requested a loan of 14,000 php, enough to buy materials and supplies she needs for her farm.

a. madeleine was born in 1956 and has been living for forty years in ahito in allada, in atlantique county. she is a widow with six children, of whom three are in her care. some of them are in school. she lives alone with her children and provides for the family. madeleine has not gone to school. to provide for herself, she sells cowries, pearls, earthenware, fasteners, and a variety of other items, in allada. she stocks up in porto-novo, the administrative capital of benin. she has been running this business for forty years. she is a previous alidé client who repays her loans. with the aim of expanding her commerce and increasing her profitability, so she can cover all her expenses, madeleine is requesting a third loan from alidé.

translated from french by dan kuey, kiva volunteer

erick is a married man. he has 2 children. he describes himself to be committed. he operates a retail business where he makes metallic windows, chairs and other items to sell. he has been involved in this business for 5 years. his business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are of all types. he describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. he will use the kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of welding materials. his business goal is to be successful within 5 years. this is his second loan with smep microfinance bank.

medardo, 53, is a farmer who raises, fattens, and sells chickens. he has chicken sheds on the patio of the house he lives in, located in the municipality of chinu.

he learned animal husbandry from his family. with his drive and perseverance, he has managed to get ahead and improve his family's living conditions. at this time, medardo is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed and chickens. this will enable him to expand his production, which will lead to an increase in his sales and earnings.

if you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from interactuar, you can join the lending team called: “friends of interactuar colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

sokchan’s group live in a rural village in oddar meanchey province in cambodia. sokchan makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

in their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

milagros is a member of the "santa barbara" communal bank  in the tarapoto district, in the province and department of  san martin. she lives with her partner, is 31 years old and has 2 children, both dependent on her. milagros sells general groceries and her shop is located in her own home. 

she started her business with a first loan of 300 soles that the manuela ramos movement gave to her. with it she bought boxes of milk, canned food of different brands and soft drinks. she has a steady client base of friends, neighbours and people who live in surrounding communities. in her store she also sells beauty products that she buys through catalogue.  

with this loan of 1,000 soles she will buy groceries to stock up her business, such as bags of rice and sugar, boxes of milk and oil, packs of soft drinks of different sizes and flavours and household cleaning and personal hygiene products. this will meet the demands of her clients, who come to her store every day. 

she is very proud of her daily work. milagros is grateful to the manuela ramos movement for supporting women who, just like her, want to succeed in life.

pamela is a 43-year-old widow. she lives with her three children (2 in school) in nyamasaria kisumu kenya. she lost her husband due to hiv-related illness. pamela, who is living positively, is a symbol of hope to many. with support from kmet, pamela was able to acquire a popcorn fryer. she uses this to make popcorn, which she sells to the community, schools and also during events. due to high demand, especially in schools, she plans to purchase another fryer with us $700 she has applied for.

maría, 51 years old, did not study and is a single mother. she has three children who are now adults, are working and help her economically. 

maría has a small shop of goods of basic needs. her daughter manages the shop, while maría works at a house caring for an elderly person from monday to saturday. 

she needs the loan to purchase products such as oil, rice, and beans among others, because these are what her customers look for the most. through this purchase, she will obtain extra income to sustain her family. 

the dream of maría is to continue working and to have her children prosper and find good opportunities in life.

leang chhorn is 41 years old. she is married and a mother of four children, one of whom is in school.
growing cashew, cassava and beans have been the sources of her income for four years. she is able to generate an income of about 12.5 usd per day through these activities. due to the lack of working capital, leang chhorn is now leading this group to take out a loan to cover her farming expenses, such as buying seeds and fertilizer, which are expected to improve the grow her crops.
she hopes to earn more income that she can then save for future needs.

wilma is a 55-year-old married woman from albur, bohol. she has seven children; the oldest child is thirty-four while the youngest is seventeen years old. she has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for three years. she is requesting a loan of 4,000 php to purchase additional merchandise like canned goods, soap, toiletries, coffee and sugar. in the future, wilma would like to expand  her business to invest in other ventures and at the same time to provide quality education to her children.

sylvia is 25 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. she has two children and is married. as a group leader, sylvia is representing her group of eight farmers in teso district in kenya, and is very excited to be working with one acre fund for the first time this year.

the decision to join one acre fund was largely a result of sylvia's desire to earn enough to feed her family. in addition to receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan. she is excited to purchase the solar light, as she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. with the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

sylvia and her group will receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 3 acres.

fatuma is a married woman and she has three children, all of whom attend school. she owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

for the past two years, fatuma has owned a food stall business, where she serves neighbors and town dwellers. she faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

with this kes 20,000, fatuma wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking oil. she dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

jordy is a young man, 21 years old and single. he is currently in the fourth cycle of the business administration degree and at the same time working as a telemarketing phone operator in billing.

he chose this degree in order to have leadership capacity, and when he finishes his studies he would like to work in the area of banks and finances, and get a specialization in that.

he will invest the loan in paying for university pensions and enrollment.

his greatest wish is to attain economic stability for his family and finishing his studies is one of the most important goals for his personal success. he is thankful to the kiva investors for the loans provided.
