he’s planning to use the loan to purchase more spare parts to use to repair bicycles for his customers. he will use the profit to buy a shamba (a garden or farm). his hopes and dreams for the future are to build rental houses and educate his children.

\nvenensio is a well-known farmer, dealing mainly in tea farming in kataremwa village, kibazi parish. he started this project in 2005, and he has managed to sustain his family of seven children and his one wife. venensio is also into coffee farming, and this has helped him earn some good money to support his family. he also has a retail shop where he earns additional funds. he was born in 1983. his children are aged 15, 13, 11, 9, 7, 5 and 2 years old. of the seven children, five are in school.

this is venensio's first loan cycle from ugafode mdi, and he has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 ugx to buy fertilizers for manuring his tea shamba to increase the yields and family sustainability. he is an honest man at work, and he works for 8 hours a day. he sells to all coffee factories around bushenyi district. he faces a challenge of price fluctuations that affects the harvest. his vision is to buy a big chunks of land to expand his farming project.

as a married parent of eight children who are in school, clarissa works hard to support her family.

she has a fishing business in the philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  clarissa is borrowing php 15,000 through nwtf to buy fishing materials for her business.

clarissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from nwtf. she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

tati, her husband, and their two children live in ciamis, a small city in west java province.

to support the family, tati and her husband manage a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and electronic bill payments. she joined ruma because she wanted to try out the mobile airtime business. she feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

as the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from kiva in order to do more transactions on weekends. she thanks you for your support.

santos is 53 years old. he was only able to go to school up to the sixth grade due to the armed conflict there was in the country. also, because he had to leave his place of origin. now, he is married and his wife takes care of the home. he has six children but only 4 live at home. the other two have their own homes.

santos has worked on a broiler chicken farm for seven years. he learned this work from some trainings he took in an institution. he also raises cattle and farms. right now he is growing a hectare of corn and one hectare of beans. the place where he grows in twenty minutes from his house.  

he is asking for this loan from credicampo to buy broiler chickens, concentrate, vitamins, and immunizations to keep them. he will also buy a heifer and sell the chickens when they are grown. this way, he will obtain income for him and his family. 

he dreams of improving his home. it is made of adobe and brick. he would like to coat it with cement and sand. he also wants to work hard to support his children in their education and teach them different jobs so they can make their own businesses.

noel is a hardworking father to two young daughters from garcia hernandez, bohol.

he is a farmer who grows corn and vegetables like squash and eggplants.

to support his three-year-old farming, he is asking a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides to maintain his crops.

noel only hopes that his farming business will continue to flourish so that he can send his daughters to school.

josé managed to attend school until the ninth grade. he is in a relationship and his partner helps in the bakery. together they have two children.

josé has had a bakery for approximately nine years. he learned the job from a friend who had a bakery, but josé decided to work independently as he was motivated by the income. his partner helps him in his work, and they fight together to move forward.

he needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, etc., to make and sell bread. he also invested his prior loan in his business, and is paying it off punctually.

he plans to expand his business so that his bakery is one of the strongest in the community.

yuriki jhoana is 24 years old, single, and lives with her 3 year old daughter in the family home in a community located in the rural district of cayalti; she has good work references and personal references from her neighbors. her community is basically dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and selling. the aforementioned district is in the chiclayo province in the lambayeque region on peru's northern coast.\r\n\r\nyuriki jhoana works in raising and selling animals, such as pigs, ducks, and guinea pigs in the rear area of her own residence and has over 5 years of experience in this business. she's requesting a loan to purchase nutritionally balanced feed to fatten her animals. in this way she would continue to grow her business, which would allow her to boost her income in the short term, increase her profits and thus improve she and her family's quality of life.

lux s., 29, is married with a two-year-old child. she resides in siem reap province, cambodia, with her husband (pictured) and child. to make a living, she is employed at a private company. she provides the laundry services at that company, earning an income of us $2 per day in revenue. her husband works at a construction site. he paints the buildings both inside and outside, earning an income of us $5 per day. these sources of income from s. and her husband help to cover the family expenses. s. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. therefore, s. is asking for a loan of us $800 to purchase pigs to raise and wood to build a pig cage. this is her second loan from credit mfi, kiva’s partner.

john  is a married man. he has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years. he describes himself to be a humble man. he operates a motorcycle and a blacksmith business providing transportation and blacksmith services. he has been involved in this business for 10 years. his business is located within  a viable business area  and his primary customers are local residents. \r\n\r\njohn describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. he will use the kes 20,000 loan to buy metal for his blacksmith services. his business goal is to expand his business within five years. he hopes that in the future, his business will have been successful.

mary cris is 24 years old, from sikatuna, bohol. she is married with two children, ages 1 and 6. while her husband works as a sewer and also a welder, mary cris is also into selling prepaid loads. she has been in this business for three years now, earning an average income of 1000 php per month. 

she is asking for a loan to buy load and sim cards to sell. she hopes to improve her business and offer more service in the future for a better profit.

“buko” or young coconut has a lot of benefits to the human body. coconut water alone is a delicious thirst quencher, eliminates toxins in the body, and naturally flushes small kidney stones. while coconut meat is so versatile that it can be eaten raw, mixed in salad, shredded and juiced as main ingredient in many filipino dishes.

coconuts grow well in tropical countries like the philippines. but the crowded cities cannot accommodate this tall tree, so the supply of coconuts in the city comes from the provinces. virgilio, 56, saw this need many years ago, hence he decided to sell young coconuts in pasay city. it continues to be a booming business as people learn this healthy alternative to soda drinks. it serves as virgilio’s primary source of income that sustains his children’s needs and education. he’s already widowed, that’s why he tries his best to earn enough for their daily sustenance.

he is imploring your kindness to lend him additional capital of php 8,000. with this amount, he can buy more young coconuts to resell that will lead to his increased profit. he is praying that you would extend your hand to him. may bountiful blessings come your way.

virgilio meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and religion. *all cct community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. a fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. the fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of god, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

leonila is 47 years old, married with six children.

leonila works hard to provide for her family. she runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 30,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, drinks, spices and other snack foods.

leonila has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending.

leonila aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

aside from selling foods in the street and having a general store, maridel is also helping her husband in their fishing business. her husband does the fishing and she's the one who sells the fish at the local market.the business runs well and she was able to repay her previous loan. she decided to borrow a loan again to pay for the repair of her huisband's fishing boat. maridel's plan for the future is to buy a new fishing boat as a replacement for the old one for the safety of her husband.

conception e. is from the village of talakag, bukidnon. she is 56 years old, married, and has 2 adult-aged children. to make a living, conception owns & operates a specialized retail store. the main source of income for the business comes from selling bananas in the local community. conception has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 php a month.

in 2009, conception joined hspfi to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. conception is requesting a new loan of 5,000 php, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. this loan will be the 1st loan taken out by conception from hspfi. she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

about hspfi:

hspfi is an accredited partner of opportunity international in the philippines. it is based in cagayan de oro city and is reaching out to the poor households of northern mindanao.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

señor angel z., age 64, is married and has 5 children. he is engaged in the sale of popular consumer products. don angel lives in a community called llanos de langue.

every day, he leaves his house in order to operate his business, where he sells a variety of basic household items such as bulk grains, soft drinks, sweets, rope, and bags. he has been in this business several years and has been able to get ahead. he will use the loan to invest in merchandise in order to stock more in his shop.

translated from spanish by richard brown, kiva volunteer

moriayo sells clothes, shoes and underwear. she has been in this business for the past 6 years and she is very happy with the growing nature of her business. moriayo is 39 years old and married with 2 children. she lives in lagos state, nigeria. she needs the loan of n 80,000 to purchase more clothes, shoes and underwear to sell. she says thank you to kiva lenders.

nelson is 25 years old, lives with his life partner with whom he has two children in the municipality of jesus de otoro, close to taulabe.  he works in the production of coffee, he has been doing this activity for 5 years on his own.  he sells his product in the same area. the loan is his second cycle and is for 19,000 hnl for the group.  this money will be used to purchase fertilizer to maintain his coffee plantation and obtain more production and profits.  his objective is to improve income to get his family ahead.  the name of the group is concepcion and it’s formed by two members, they both work in the production of coffee and live in the same community.  the group loan is for 19,000 hnl to maintain their coffee plantation.  in the photo nelson is the one in the left and tiofilo the one in the right.

ma. elma is 48 years old and married with four children. she works very hard to provide for them.

ma. elma has a general store in the philippines and requested a php 23,000 loan through nwtf to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

she has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, school supplies and other groceries.

ma. elma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

jackson lives in the kitale area of kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. he has two children. he has operated a dairy business for six years. his primary income sources are milk and eggs. the loan of 62,400 kes from juhudi kilimo will help him buy and insure a dairy cow.

jackson says what is most enjoyable about farming is, "feeding cows!" his biggest challenges are "diseases and expensive dairy feed." animals on the farm have been given the names of "maua."

when jackson was asked why he chose juhudi kilimo for this loan, he replied: "because it gives loans to farmers to boost their production and improve their livelihoods." when asked what was learned during juhudi's required micro-finance training session, jackson replied, "the importance of directing funds to the intended projects."

his highest monthly expenses are his children's school fees. when asked how this loan will benefit his family, jackson replied, "my children will get a proper education and food."

as part of juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. jackson owns a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. juhudi kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. this borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, tv or dvd.

note: to create this loan profile, juhudi kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

samoeun’s group lives in a rural village in preah sihanouk province in cambodia. samoeun does work as farmer and seller to support her family. in her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. having a water filter at home will help samoeun safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

nasra's husband is a welder by profession. she has requested a loan from kiva's field partner brac pakistan to help her husband. as the stock of his welding material is not enough to work efficiently, he needs to purchase more products to offer better and more professional services to his customers. this will going to help him to attract more customers, and to get a good profit in the future.

nasra herself is a 55-year-old housewife. she always keeps smiling, even in the bad days of life. she strongly believe that ups and downs are a part of life, so there is no need to get worried; just keep yourself happy in every stage of life.

she wants to help her husband because he is the only earner for the family, and the income generated from his shop plays a very important role in meeting the daily household expenses. presently his net income is not enough to pay for the daily and monthly expenses, which include electricity bills, gas and water bills, food expenses, children's education expenses, etc. 

so nasra has requested a loan to improve her husband's business. the kiva loan would be helpful for him in purchasing a welding machine and a variety of welding tools.

nasra wants to thank all kiva lenders for their kind support. she says that the kiva lenders are like angels, and the blessing of god in her life.

giovanna is 33 years old and she is a very humble and hardworking woman. she lives in a house of her own together with her beloved 4-year old daughter, xiomara. she is ready to work very hard to improve the quality of their life. the immense dedication giovanna has to teaching has driven her to set up a school in the district of puente piedra in the city of lima. her educational institution provides basic and primary education, which is why she has numerous students. the parents trust this institution because she has made sure that the education that is imparted in her classrooms is the best. what she most enjoys about her work is being able to interact with the children. she loves their company. she has 10 years in the business and she considers the most difficult part to be keeping the children safe from harm. they are very active and there is always the chance they might get hurt. in time she wants to improve the school infrastructure to provide her students with a better quality of service. this is the seventh loan she has with mfp (kiva field partner). she knows that she must make her payments on time and she is ready to do so.  she is a very well liked member of her community bank. with the two thousand neuvos soles requested she will purchase more desks to improve her school.\r\n

the group has been together for one year. robinah has a market stall and sells raw foods. marx and rose are poultry farmers and want to use the loan to construct more poultry houses. oliver is a tailor and wants to use the loan to buy a bablock machine. agnes is a stone quarrier. with the extra business profits, robinah wants to pay school fees for the children.

this is a group loan. the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. the members mutually guarantee one another's loans. if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

e. is 34 years old. he is married with five children aged between 1 and 9 years old. e. owns a business selling breads. his business is open from 6am to 10pm every day. he has 5 years of experience in this business and currently employs 5 people to help him. e. has requested a loan from kiva lenders via vision finance company for the purpose of increasing his business by purchasing more breads to satisfy his customers.

this borrower continues to sell escabeche (dish of cooked, marinated meat or fish, served cold), a dish that has many ingredients and requires a lot of work to make.

she dreams of opening a restaurant as she is aware of the boom in gastronomy in her country. she would like to have all the conveniences a restaurant requires so that she can work comfortably and be more productive. the borrower belongs to banco renovacion and is asking for a loan so she can buy kitchen utensils, chicken, yucca, carrots, and onions which are all required to make her escabeche.

she is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on the dates agreed to in her contract.

andrea has been a member of the communal bank "pauteñitas" for some time.  she lives in the canton of paute which has a warm climate and fertile land where beautiful flowers and a wide variety of fruits are grown.  there are several businesses, especially those where one can enjoy the local cuisine.  its people still preserve their culture and traditions.

andrea is 19 years old.  she is a single mother of a 7-month-old girl and lives in her parents' home.  her father is a gardener and her mother is a homemaker.  

she cares for her daughter and the home but in order to contribute to the household economy, raises guinea pigs and sells them in the canton.  she enjoys her work because it allows her to spend time at home.

andrea used her previous loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed, which gave her a very good profit.  she is requesting a new loan to buy more guinea pigs and construction materials to build a bigger pen for them.

andrea likes her communal bank because of the solidarity and support among all the members.

sreyhum’s group lives in a rural village in siem reap province in cambodia. sreyhum works as a farmer and makes a living by cultivating rice to support her family. in her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

having a water filter at home will help sreyhum safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

the "unidos para el progreso" group is entering it's third cycle.  the group is made up of 6 members, all with different, prosperous businesses. 

paola, one of its members, is a single mother of 2 children.  she works selling grilled kebabs, steak and chicken.  her business is located in her home where she has a space with some tables and chairs for her customers.  the loan she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of cabinets and other equipment to improve her business.  

the group is very grateful for the kiva lenders.  paola is the first woman on the left, dressed in gray.  the adjacent picture is of maritza.

armando m. is 31 years old and runs his own motorcycle repair shop in el seybo, a medium-sized town in the eastern part of the dominican republic. with seventeen years of experience working with motorcycles, and three years in the motorcycle repair business, armando brings a wealth of skills and expertise to his trade. in a community where most people get around on their own motorcycle (here just called a "motor") or by hiring a motorcycle driver (called a "motoconcho"), armando's business has no want of customers. 

yet, armando is not quite like any of the other motorcycle repairmen in the city. at 8 months old, armando suffered a terrible fall off of a bed, and has since been unable to walk without the help of leg braces and prosthetics. despite these constraints, armando maintains a sunny outlook on life, which makes him very popular in the neighborhood of ginandiana where he lives and works. armando also has dreams for his business: he says that he hopes to expand his workshop over time, and he aspires to someday be a great businessman.

this is armando's first loan from kiva and esperanza international, and he intends to invest the loan in his business and buy additional motorcycle replacement parts for his shop. revenues from armando's workshop constitute his primary source of income. he currently lives with his mother and younger sister. here he is pictured in his workshop with some of his merchandise.

a resident of the battambang province, saroem has been a rice farmer for many years. she also uses her spare time to make khmer cakes to sell to supplement her income. she is a married mother of two children. through this business, she is able to earn just enough income to cover her family’s living expenses and save a little income for future needs.

since her rice farming was threatened by drought, she could not earn as much income as before. to save her business, she is now leading a group of two to apply for a loan in order to seed and pay for labor fees. this is expected to support her business. she hopes this useful loan will help her to gain more output and be able to increase her income.

ana is asking for a loan to buy firewood and corn to strengthen the business.  she wants to continue improving every day.  this is why she’s interested in repaying on time so that she can receive these credit benefits every time she needs to.  the loans have given her strength to improve sales and her family situation has improved also.\r\n\r\n

kennedy is 38 years old and has 5 children. he is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 9 farmers in sirisia district, kenya.

kennedy has been farming with one acre fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. this decision was largely as a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside one acre fund. kennedy also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

obtaining this loan means that kennedy \'s group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.75 acres."

62-year-old beatriz is a micro-entrepreneur from biñan, laguna, philippines. she works as hard as she can managing her 25-year-old variety store. this store has helped her send her children to school and pay their everyday expenses. her husband salvador works as a tricycle driver. aside from her variety store, she also has a piggery and sells snacks for additional sources of income.

to have additional income, she would like to ask for financial assistance that will be used to buy more quantities of toiletries, rice, soda, chips, canned goods, charcoal, and other grocery items. part of the loan will go to her piggery and will be used to buy snacks. she hopes that her family will will have a better future.

beatriz is a member of the center for community transformation and meets weekly with her fellowship partners to share her life’s testimony and business experience with her fellowship members. she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listening to the word of god. a fellowship group is composed of 15 to 20 members. the fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of god, build social relationship among partners, and pay micro finance loans.

maribel is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. maribel is 40 years old.

maribel has a food-vending business in the philippines. maribel requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

maribel has been in this business for 10 years. in the future, maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

jeannethe, 45, provides garaging services.   she’s been in this business more than 20 years.  she is a very hard working person who enjoys her work.  she is very dynamic because she has to be watchful of the cars that arrive to request this service.

the reason behind the loan request is to make some improvements to the booths the cars are located in to be able to offer more space.  she dreams with improving service every day.  she is a very responsible persona and she needs to make these improvements to obtain profits.

juana is a 55 year old woman, she lives in a rented home with her husband (58 year old donato) and her children (percy, age 20 and rudy, age 18), whom she loves very much and she wishes to provid. them an adequate university education. juana is a very dedicated mother; she has a firewood business and is sought after by her customers. juana has had this business for 9 years, and she wishes to increase the quantity of wood that she has to sell and in this way have enough money to pay for her children’s university tuition. she cares for her children with a lot of love and she always worries that they have what they need. she enjoys conversing with her customers and she always has a joke to share and create a good relationship with her customers. her principle selling strategy is to be happy in all that she does. she doesn’t like to be a bother and if she were to be a pest when she is selling she wouldn’t have any customers. this is her fifth loan with mfp, she feels very happy to have received it and she has promised to pay it with all the members of her community bank. the money she seeks, 1000 nuevos soles, will be invested in buying more firewood to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

translated from spanish by cindy kendall, kiva volunteer

jacqueline is 32 years old with three children living in masindi, uganda. jacqueline set up a spare parts shop in order to bring building materials nearer to her community and also earn income to support her family. since there are only three people dealing in the business in her village, she is assured of customers. she is faced with the challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and theft.\r\n\r\njacqueline never got a chance to go to the university but wishes to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and buy land to grow crops. she is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

phanice is 34 years old and has 5 children. she has been a farmer for 10 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. even though phanice is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 14 farmers in webuye district, kenya.

phanice started working alongside one acre fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. this year, she decided to represent her group because she likes being a leader.

phanice’s group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres of land. additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

mary jane is 34 years old and has five children. mary jane is married and has four children who are still in school.

mary jane is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the philippines. mary jane requested a php 10000 loan through nwtf to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

mary jane has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

in the future, mary jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

it really is important to have some cash around for relevant matters. \nvicenta lives in ozamiz and supports her family by building houses from the ground up. she has applied a loan, which she used to buy building material, paints, and to pay her workers. she wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

fatuma is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. she owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

for over fourteen years, she has operated a mat-weaving business, selling from home to her neighbours. in addition she also sells kerosene which contributes to her sources of income. fatuma faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. she hopes to establish a cereals shop in the future.

with the kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase palm leaves, materials used in weaving mats for sale. she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

godius is 40 years old and lives in the town of kasese in the fortportal region of uganda. he is married and has 4 children who attend school. 

for the past 4 years, godius has worked hard to manage his retail shop dealing in kitchen ware. he sells charcoal stoves, frying pans, sauce pans, and buckets. 

to help expand his business, godius requests 2,500,000 ugx from brac uganda. the loan will be used to buy more charcoal stoves, frying pans, sauce pans, and buckets, and will help godius to generate greater profits and increase his stock. godius hopes that in the future he will be able to have more income. 

godius is a member of brac's small enterprise program (sep).  the program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like godius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

sakovat is 33 years old.  she is married.  her husband left to work abroad.  while her husband is away from the family, sakovat is raising their two sons alone in the city of isfara and is concurrently involved in sewing.  sakovat worked at a market, selling children's clothing, several years ago.  she could no longer work when she had children and stopped that business.  today, her sons have grown up a bit - the oldest is 5 years old, and the youngest is 2 years old.  sakovat can work again, and her mother, who lives together with them, will look after the children in her absence.  sakovat decided to return to her old job and already found a place at the market, where she will sell children's clothing.  the entirety of the loan amount will be used to purchase seasonal children's clothing.  we wish sakovat luck, success and more clients.

lorgie works hard to support seven children. she is married and has a general store business in the philippines.

she requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

lorgie is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks for her family and neighbors, as well as promoting environmental protection.

maria is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the district of tate. she works in the plaza vea commercial center as a kitchen helper. her husband works as a masonry assistant. she is requesting the loan to finish some projects on her home so she can open her own cooking business out of it. maria is very thankful for the support you are providing her with through this loan.

nelson antonio, 31, is a single father of two children, ages 3 and 5.  he is from malpaisillo which is in the northern part of the country and known as a very productive agricultural and commercial area.  nelson sells crafts for a living and has been in business for six years.  he travels to costa rica where he sells nicaraguan crafts such as clay pots, piggy banks, bracelets, clay cookware jars and vases.  the challenges he faces are the high duty tariffs charged at the border.  \r\n\r\nhe learned the trade from his parents who ran the business before him.  he is in need of a loan to buy and sell the different craft articles.  nelson antonio is grateful to kiva lenders for helping low income earners in poor countries like nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

narcisa is a widowed woman with nine children. she is a very hard working entrepreneur. she is 61 years old and has two children who are still in school.

narcisa has a vegetable vending business in the philippines. she requested a php 15,000 loan amount through nwtf to buy variety of vegetables to sell.

narcisa has been in this business for 3 years. in the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

alice is 42 years old and a mother of two. she was born and raised in kakamega county and later moved to nairobi and settled in mukuru kayaba. she started a school in mukuru kayaba, which up to now has a population of 100 pupils.

she has been having problems of hygienic sanitation for her pupils, who have been seeking sanitation services from a public toilet that is a distance away from the school. she recently learned about fresh life toilets and got interested to install one for her pupils. she is hoping the fresh life toilet will provide hygienic sanitation to her pupils and will be closer to them. alice wants to acquire one fresh life toilet.

zakayo (pictured above with his last born), is a farmer with a big desire to achieve. he has big dreams in his life. he has laid out different strategies to get his family ahead with the sweat of his forehead.

zakayo started his farming business 10 years ago. he has been involved in mixed farming and dairy farming.

because of the immense knowledge he has of farming, farmers from his village seek technical advice from him on the best dairy farming techniques. he also does a motorbike business.

zakayo is the breadwinner for his family. he is motivated to work hard so that his children will have a bright future and his aging parents will have a comfortable life.

although he makes a profit from farming, he is not comfortable. he has always wanted to increase his income by selling cereals, so that is why he is seeking this loan to buy cereals.

kenya's bomet area, one of the country's most populated regions, has a high demand for cereals, which means that zakayo can increase his profits and satisfy the local demand.

accessing funds has been a challenge for zakayo. he was relieved to find that juhudi kilimo partners with kiva lenders to help hardworking farmers such as himself turn their dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

zakayo believes that this loan will be of much help to him and that he will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals.

he is very thankful for your support and empowerment.

livinston is 40 years old and is from waspam. he is married and has four school-aged children.  he has lived in a wooden stilt house for 14 years. he is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, cement and rebar and cover labor costs, with the aim of building a wooden dwelling with concrete lower walls. his dream is to provide his family with a proper home and to set up a business.

mampotseng is a 30-year-old married mother of three children. she lives in a two-bedroom house with four other family members. she is a farmer. she uses wood and paraffin for cooking and lighting. she also pays for mobile phone charging, as she has no electricity installed in her home.

mampotseng and seven other people from her village will benefit from the ace 1 cook-stove, as it has an led lamp, usb port, a phone charging system, and uses just small twigs and cow dung to make a fire. mampotseng will no longer have to walk long distances to collect wood, or buy candles and paraffin. the ace 1 clean cook-stove is biomass and solar powered.

for more information please visit, www.africancleanenergy.com

irene is 39 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are still in school.

irene is in the agricultural business pig-fattening in the philippines. irene requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to buy sacks of feeds, piglets and other supplies to raise her pig.

irene has been pig fattening for one year, and has borrowed eight times in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

in the future, irene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

resty d. is from the village of tumpagon, cagayan de oro city. he is 38 years old. resty is married and has 3 school-aged children. to make a living, resty owns & operates a business venture in a traditional mining activity called pamiling . while not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling gold dust in the local community. resty has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 php a month for these activities.

in 2008, resty joined hspfi to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. resty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 php from hspfi. this previous loan was used to to invest in renovating their house. resty is requesting a new loan of 16000 php which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. this loan will be the 5th loan taken out by resty from hspfi. he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

about hspfi:

hspfi is one of accredited partners of opportunity international in the philippines. it is based in cagayan de oro city and is reaching out to the poor households of northern mindanao.

*note: to maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by kiva.  given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in english while providing quality and accurate information to kiva lenders.

daniel is 25 years old. he is a hard-working youth who managed to complete secondary school and then went to work. he is in a relationship and has a son. his life companion does housework.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
daniel has been working for a poultry business and he also makes a living growing corn as he learned this activity from his father.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
he needs a loan to buy a calf to take advantage of the leftovers from his harvest to fatten it.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
his dream is to improve the condition of his house and he knows he can do it by saving and with the help of a loan.

valiree is 23 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. she works very hard to provide for her family. valiree runs a general store in the philippines. she has requested a 28,000 php loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, soft drinks, chips, eggs, etc.

valiree has been in this business for five years. in the future valiree would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

maría del socorro is a 32-year-old young woman, mother of two school-aged children. 

she is from the municipality of el sauce, a small place which is in the western part of nicaragua, hidden between rivers and flowering mountains. she was born in this small town and was raised by her mother, a small and humble businesswoman who earns her living selling food on a central corner of this town where her vigorón is famous for its deliciousness. this traditional nicaraguan dish is made of yucca with pork rinds.  maría del socorro is proud of her mother because, thanks to her, she studied to get a degree in education science and works as a health instructor in the hospital in the locality.   

currently, she has come for the first time to the ceprodel office because a friend recommended to her that this financing organization supports people of limited resources with the help of the kiva investors since her priority is to improve her mother's health and she wants to purchase medicines and have some medical tests done. they hope you will support them and will be eternally grateful.

lucy is a married mother and all of her children attend school. they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor running water. 

for years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. she faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. lucy dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

with the 50,000 kes loan, she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, rice, beans, maize flour and sugar for sale. she decided to join yehu to access loans to boost her business.

clemente is a native of the district of san antonio, on the outskirts of estelí. he is the father of two children, ages 20 and 22. his wife works as a teacher in a primary school. he began his business of planting coffee five years ago, since before that he planted corn and beans. but on noticing that the lands were suitable for growing coffee, he decided to establish an area of about 1.75 acres with a little money that he obtained from the sale of corn and beans. that is how he began this business, and little by little he has expanded his area of cultivation. the lands that he uses are his own. he would like to sell his product to other buyers of coffee who would pay him a better price for the product.

the expectations that he has from his business are to continue expanding the planting area and improving the production.

he is applying for the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay for labor to maintain about 7 acres of coffee in production. he expects that this loan will help him improve the yield of his harvests and obtain better income to improve the economic conditions of his family and the community, since he would also provide a source of employment to the people of his community. his future plans are to improve his house and his farm and buy materials and tools. his next goals are to increase his production in the agricultural cycle that is about to begin.

catalina, 57 years old, is married and has four children. for the past 2 years, catalina has been in the agricultural business, farming rice in the philippines. she has requested a php 6,000 loan through nwtf to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

catalina has previously borrowed 6 times from nwtf to sustain her business. in the future, catalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

shokirjon is a young man, not yet married. he has sold men's clothing and shoes at the spitamen regional clothing market for more than five years. his goods are in high demand, since he carries good quality, attractive and fashionable merchandise. twice a month, shokirjon goes on a buying trip to the wholesale market in istaravshan. with this new loan, he is thinking of expanding his selection of summer shirts, t-shirts and quality suits. shokirjon is pleased to be a credit customer of microinvest, and thanks the lenders.

translated from russian by joyce ., kiva volunteer

twenty-nine-year-old olivier is a blacksmith. he uses this talent to feed this family including his wife and their three boys. he started working as a blacksmith since he was 17 years old. currently, he is able to produce various tools such as knives, axes, spades and much more. he also repairs worn materials. his customers are mainly farmers.
with his profits, he was already able to acquire a bicycle and to expand into pig farming. olivier decided to join vahatra because he needs loans to buy raw materials. he would like to increase his output. this second loan will help him to buy iron as well as fuels. he sells his product at the big market. in the future he would like to reach financial autonomy.

mrs. martha b. espinosa is 38 years old and lives in the neighborhood francia n 2, located in the town of ticuantepe, with her husband, who supports her with the household expenses. they take care of their nine-year-old daughter. for ten years, mrs. martha works on agriculture. with her own effort, she has succeeded in establishing plots of pineapples. at this time, she doesn’t have the resources to apply the necessary supplies for her crops. as a result, with this loan, she will buy fertilizers so that she can produce more and will be able to sell at a better price.

translated from spanish by avni shah, kiva volunteer

naseem is a 42-year-old married woman. she has been successfully running a small general store in her community, and has two years of experience in this field. her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market since he has maintained many contacts over the years. \r\n\r\nshe is the mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. she wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of 50,000 pkr to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. with the loan she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. naseem wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

zonabou is a married mother of eight and is 44 years old. she sells fried food in her neighborhood and has been doing this for the past four years. she needs a loan to buy beans to a value of 100,000 francs, two containers of oil for 14,000 francs and tubers (yams, bananas and flour) for 45,000 francs; the balance of 16,000 francs will be use to load the gas, so she can sell her fried food.

zonabou is the only person to carry out this activity in her neighborhood so it works.well; furthermore she is very clean and her fried food has a very specific taste which her customers like. once she has sold her goods, she will have sufficient profit to save some money, take care of her family and continue her business. she has already had one loan and repaid acfime on time.

abdul jalil lives in district 6 of kabul, afghanistan. he is married with 2 sons and he lives with his own family. he has a metal shop and he has been involved in this business for more than 8 years. for 6 years of that time he was a student in a metal shop. this is the second year that he works alone.

he needs some machines so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines and complete his stock to attract more clients. he is happy that he has the opportunity to make a good income and help his family.

mary joy g. is from the town of banga. she is 33 years old.  she is married and has 3 children, aged 2, 4, and 10. to make a living, mary joy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. while not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. mary joy dreams for her children to be successful someday.\r\n\r\nmary joy joined community economic ventures, inc. (cevi) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. she has successfully repaid a previous loan from cevi and is requesting a new loan of 8000 philippine pesos (php), which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

sajida is a forty-two-year-old married woman, living in the area of lahore, pakistan. she is pictured with her son. he has been working in an embroidery firm and learning the art of stitching embroidery and bridal dresses.

now he has become very expert in his art and wants to set up his own small shop. he wants to buy his own initial raw material related to embroidery but is unable to do so due to a shortage of cash on hand.

therefore, sajida humbly requested a loan from brac pakistan. through this loan her son will be able to buy the initial stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

sajida is very glad and thankful for brac pakistan.

mrs. bum-ayush is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in her old house, which has thin wooden walls, in ulaanbaatar, the capital of mongolia. she works as a vendor in the largest informal market in the city, usually selling sports boots. she has been renting a counter there for three years. before entering this business, she was a seamstress. \r\nher husband is a taxi driver, and his working days begin at six o’clock in the morning, when he takes his wife and children to their schools and the market. bum-ayush told us that standing at the counter is hard work for a woman, especially in the winter, but it is more profitable than her previous job. every month she needs to go to the closest border with china, about two days away by train, to buy goods. her old house is in incredibly bad condition. every winter, she must burn 10 tons of coal to stay warm, while other families use only 2-4 tons. burning more coal burning releases more harmful gas and dust into the atmosphere. bum-ayush, like every mother, loves her children, so she is planning to thicken her house walls, using materials such as cement, bricks, and glass-wool insulation, in order to stop the heat loss through the walls. so, bum-ayush is requesting 5,000,000 mnt to thicken her house walls.

diosa is 46 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school.

diosa is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the philippines. she requested a 12,500 php loan through nwtf to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. diosa has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

in the future, diosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

luzviminda is 51 years old and married with one child in school. she works very hard to provide for her family.

luzviminda runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 10,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

luzviminda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

in the future, luzviminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

zikrillo is a careful father. he was born in southern part of tajikistan in 1980. he is married and has four children. he is living in a city of beautiful nature scenes and well-mannered residents. for almost nine years he has been dealing with buying and selling spare part for cars.

he has a son who studies at the presidency lyceum. zikrillo wants to ensure his children receive an education and appealed to imon, asking for a loan to pay for his son’s education. he is hoping to be supported by kiva lenders. he wishes to educate his son in school, in order that he could enter university in the future.

limay is 33 years old, married and has two children attending school. she is married to joel, a hog raiser in their village. limay got involved in a direct selling business. she sells personal products, perfumes, soap and cosmetics. she has been in her business for three years now. limay would like to increase her income so she wants to offer more products. from this, she is now borrowing a loan of php 11,000 to buy shampoo, soap, cosmetics and perfumes to sell and increase her sales.\r\n\r\nin the future, limay would like to establish a stall to conveniently offer her products and be able to give the best education to her children.

melagrosa is married and has three adult children. she is  from cpp, bohol, melagrosa and is engaged in the fishing business together with her husband, which she has been doing for seven years.\r\n\r\nmelagrosa is requesting  a loan, which she will use to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. with this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. melagrosa hopes to expand their business in the future and makes it a success.

meet 35-year-old isatu, from the aberdeen area of freetown. she is married, with two children. one of her children is currently attending school. 

some years ago, isatu established her cookery business. she began her business because she wanted get her daily bread. she works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. she says that the main challenge to her business is an increase in the price of commodities.

isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning, to expand her cookery business. she hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and to increase her business. 

in the future, isatu plans to open a restaurant. she thanks you for your support.

mary is a 44-year-old woman, married to patrick and a mother of three children. she lives in kangemi on the outskirts of nairobi. she sells secondhand clothes. she has been in this business for fifteen years and gets a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

this will be mary’s first loan with kadet ltd. she plans to use the entire loan to buy more bales of used clothing for resale. 

in the future, she would like to expand her business so that she can educate her children.

grace d. sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, milo, milk, and so forth at the elmina market. grace has received a university education.  she is single and has no children. grace has been selling groceries since 2007. she is responsible for paying utility bills and other financial expenses. her loan will be used to buy more rice, sugar, milo, milk, and other items. she hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the expansion of her business.

rogelio is a farmer from lasam. he has been raising corn since he married his wife elsie 23 years ago. rogelio also plants fruits and vegetables to provide an additional source of income. he harvests the produce and his wife sells it at the market. 

rogelio is requesting an 18,000 php loan to buy two bags of corn seed and fertilizer and pesticide to use on his farm. his loan will help him to maintain and preserve his farming business in good quality. rogelio would also like to develop his vegetable business to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

as a parent, joan mae works hard to support her family.

she has a motorcycle transport business in the philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. joan mae is borrowing php 7,000 through nwtf to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her motorcycle transport business.

joan mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from nwtf. she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

rosina is a 56-year-old woman, who is on the right side in the picture, and a group representative of el-shadai traders. she comes from twifo praso in the twifo atti-mokwa district in the central region of ghana. she is married with seven children who are now liiving on their own. rosina has been with the field partner since 2010, with an excellent repayment record for all her six loans. this is her seventh loan, but the first with kiva.

rosina sells baby diapers, soaps and toilet rolls in the local market. she has been in business for the past 25 years, and hence has gained rich experience. the business is her only source of income. due to continuous civic education on personal hygiene, demand for baby diapers, soaps and toilet rolls has increased. rosina has taken advantage of the opportunity and has decided to expand her store gradually with her profits. this allows her to buy in larger quantities to gain a larger discount to lower her costs in the future.

rosina is requesting a micro loan as working capital to finance the replenishment of her store with baby diapers, soaps and toilet rolls. she will use the profit from the store for expansion of her business. rosina thanks all her micro lenders for their support.

helen is 53 years old and married with five children. with one child still in school, helen works very hard to provide for them.

helen runs a general store in the philippines and requested a php 16,000 loan through nwtf to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries. she has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items.

in the future, helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

maria is 36 years old and is happily married with 6 children. her oldest 4 children help her by working in the countryside, and her other 2 children (8-year-old jordan and 5-year-old wilman) go to a free school.
maria and her husband work sowing a variety of products like blackberries, bananas, naranjilla and corn. after harvesting their crops they go to the local market to sell their products.
she wants to continue to cultivate the land because she likes carrying out this activity and it allows her to cover their home expenses. she would be delighted to receive support to continue to buy more seeds and fertilizers and increase her crops by using more hectares of land.

genalyn works hard to support her family. genalyn is married and has a general store business in the philippines.

genalyn requested a php 15,000 loan through nwtf to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

genalyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

in the future, genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

raul is single without children. he is 42 years old and lives in poblacion 4, clarin.

raul sells a variety of products to earn a living, and has had this business for ten years. each month, he earns php 20,000 doing this type of work. he has requested a loan of php 50,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

raul has been a member of pmpc for a month. in the future, he hopes to save in case of emergencies.

margelyn is 33 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are still in school.

margelyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the philippines. margelyn requested a php 15,000 loan through nwtf to buy sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

margelyn has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from nwtf to sustain it.

in the future, margelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

it is very common for a balinese woman to work as a farmer to supplement her family's income. ni kadek ayu s. works as a pig farmer to help her husband who sells potted plants for a living. she started with 1 breeding pig that she bought for about $60 that gave birth to 5 piglets in 4 months. one month and a half later, these piglets were sold for $15 each. so ni kadek ayu s. earned $75. in one year, ni kadek ayu s. managed to sell $225 worth of piglets, with net profit of $150. these earnings were used to supplement her family's income. mrs. kadek ayu s. will use $140 loan from dinari to buy more breeder pigs and repair their sty. she expects that with one more breeder pig, she can earn 2x what she earns currently.

translated from indonesian by kresna hartandi, kiva volunteer

bagi perempuan bali, pekerjaan sebagai petani atau peternak itu sudah umum. hal ini dilakukan sebagai usaha sampingan untuk menambah pendapatan keluarga. tidak cukup membantu suami sebagai penjual pot tanaman disela waktunya ni kadek ayu s. juga mencoba usaha beternak babi. mulai dari 1 ekor penginduk ibu ni kadek ayu s. mengawali usaha beternaknya. induk babi yang ni kadek ayu s. beli dengan harga rp.600.000,- setelah empat bulan sudah melahirkan 5 ekor anak. satu setengah bulan berikutnya anak babi ini dijual dengan harga rp.150,000,- perekor. jadi ni kadek ayu s. mendapat uang rp 750.000,-. selama satu tahun ni kadek ayu s. berhasil menjual bibit babi seharga rp.2.250.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih kira-kira rp. 1.500.000,-. meskipun kecil beternak babi juga mendapatkan keuntungan tambahan. ibu kadek ayu s. mendapat modal dari dinari sebesar rp.1.400.000,- yang digunakan untuk menambah induk babi dan memperbaiki kandangnya. dengan tambahan 1 ekor induk babi lagi akan mendapat keuntungan 2 kali lipat dari semula

sonnie is 34 years old and lives in montserrado county, the largest free port and the number-one commercial county in liberia. a single mother of two children, aged 1 and 13 years old, in school and living at home, sonnie has been operating a shop selling used clothes for the past nine years. she learned this business from her mother, and started it with help from her boyfriend. her favorite part is the profit she makes everyday as her customer base continues to grow.

\r\n\r\nsonnie is requesting this loan to purchase more used clothes to sell. she appreciates the support of brac, and she promises to pay back her loan on time. in the future, she wants to build a house.

solphiline is a 26 year old married woman. she has 2 children. she describes herself to be ambitious. she operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, sugar, maize flour and other items. she has been involved in this business for 2 years. her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are of all types. she describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock to sell. she will use the kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of soap, sugar, bread and other items for resale. her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. she will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further.

celsa is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. her oldest child is 19 years old and her youngest is five. celsa's husband works as a farmer and carpenter. for the past four years, celsa has been farming rice. she also raises pigs in her backyard. celsa sells her rice harvest and pigs at the market in her town. 

celsa is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. in the future, she hopes to be able to pay her children's tuition fees.

greetings from sierra leone! this is 46 year-old mabinty from kandeh bo. she is married. 

mabinty runs a cookery business and sells cooked food.  she has run her business for 10 years.  mabinty works throughout the week, from 4:30am to11:00 am.  her business is her only source of income.

mabinty has requested a loan to purchase fish, rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.  the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and change her living conditions.  in the future, mabinty plans to open a big restaurant.  she thanks you for your support!

diana is a smallholder farmer who resides in the remote area of kericho county. she is visionary, honest and hard-working. diana is married to an energetic man, and the union has been blessed with children.

at her young age, 23 years, diana can be said to be a catalyst of societal growth. she distributes milk and eggs to her neighbors, enabling them feed their children with nutritious food. diana also grows crops that she sells to her neighbors and the local market. her motive is to earn profit, which she she will save and use to educate her children. diana gets the satisfaction of working independently and of the profits she earns.

she wants to buy seeds and fertilizers for horticultural farming. she will plant a variety of vegetables including tomatoes, onions and carrots.

her friends have disclosed to her that kiva lenders are interested in supporting hardworking women like her. diana is excited and has applied for this loan, which she anticipates will create a turning point in her life. she has thanked her lenders for their good will.

clauvis is a young cameroonian age 33. he is married with six children - the oldest is eleven and in secondary school and the youngest is six and in primary school. 

he has been in his business for the past three years, which makes him very experienced and stable. his business is successful because it is located in an urban area where they bake bread, which makes the demand for firewood very high. 

he is likely to succeed because the demand for firewood is very high where his business is located. this loan will help him increase his revenue from 120,000 xaf to 397,000 xaf and his profit will increase by 25% per month. 

his standard of living will increase as well.

yuri yasser u. m. works as a route collector in the managua wholesale market. he has worked with ceprodel for three years, and in this time he has managed to improve the condition of his house with the three loans he has received from ceprodel. he is married, with two school-age children. the requested loan is for the purchase of bricks for his house so he can give a better quality of life to his children, who so greatly need their father's support.

translated from spanish by danielle maxson, kiva volunteer

danny, 27 years old, is a talented young man. he learned about textile artisanry from his sister yenny, who gladly and patiently taught him her useful skills. danny and yenny together own a small workshop where they make woven goods. the workshop also provides jobs for three young workers. together with their employees, they make the perfect team for this work. recently their output has increased, requiring various wools to fulfill orders placed by their clients, who are always satisfied with their work. this young brother-and-sister team would like to purchase greater quantities of wool and expand their workshop, which will provide their employees with a more comfortable work environment.\r\n

translated from spanish by todd m. anderson

\r\ndanny es un talentoso joven de 27 años de edad, aprendió la bella labor de la artesanía textil de su querida hermana yenny, quien gustosa y pacientemente le enseñó sus valiosos conocimientos. actualmente, danny y yenny poseen en sociedad un pequeño taller de tejidos, donde brindan trabajo a otros 3 jóvenes con quienes hacen un equipo perfecto para esta labor, por estas temporadas el volumen de producción de sus trabajos se ha incrementado, requiriendo variedad de lanas para cumplir cada uno de las solicitudes de sus clientes, clientes quienes quedan muy satisfechos con su trabajo. el deseo de estos jóvenes hermanos es adquirir mayor cantidad de lana y ampliar su taller, para brindar mejor comodidad a sus colaboradores.

amina is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. she owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. her greatest monthly expense is food.

she has operated a fuel selling business for the past three years, selling to the neighbors. she mentions lack of capital as a major challenge in her business.

with the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of fuel for resale. she decided to join yehu to access loans and boost her business.

marissa is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of seven young children from san jose, talibon, bohol, philippines. marissa has been engaged in the hog-raising business for more than ten years now.

marissa works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children. she will use the loan to buy feed and additional piglets to raise.

in the future, marissa hopes to expand her business to augment her income for the family's needs and expenses.

sonia is 59 years old and widowed with three children, one of whom is in school. she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

sonia has a personal product retail business in the philippines. sonia requested a php 8,000 loan amount through nwtf to purchase more personal products to sell. sonia has been in this business for one year. in the future, sonia would like to save money to expand her business.

every two weeks the members of the 'girasoles' (sunflowers) community bank meet in el progreso neighborhood, in the city of portoviejo.  this is a very densely populated, poor, urban area of the city which is known as 'sector de la cárcel' (the prison sector) because it is home to portoviejo's women's prison.

here we meet digna.  she is 21 years old and lives with her partner.  they do not have any children yet but she hopes that they will very soon.  her husband works in the town slaughterhouse.

in order to make her own money and cover her expenses, digna sells fruit and vegetables.  she has a stall in the town market and works there every day from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  in order to stock up with merchandise, she goes to the wholesale market very early in the morning and gets everything she needs for her customers.  she has been in this business for three years and it is going pretty well.

digna will use this loan to buy more fruit and vegetables so that she can have a well-stocked stall.  she has been a member of her community bank for six loan cycles and she likes it because of the credit facilities.

digna's dream is to own her own home as she currently rents.

sajida tabassum is aged 39, living with her husband and three children near lahore, pakistan and she is standing with her husband in the picture. her husband drives a moto rickshaw with a low earning power.

sajida tabassum supports her family by selling shoes and sandals at home and has established her business and has made it effective for her future income. she buys shoes from different manufacturing companies and sells them at home. she has been selling men, women and baby small shoes but now she wants to buy more stock of shoes and also new fashionable styles, according to customer demand but the major problem is the lack of a lump sum amount.

therefore, sajida tabassum requested a loan from kiva’s field partner brac pakistan, so she can buy more stock of shoes. she hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon.

sajida tabassum is very happy after taking this loan and says thank you to kiva’s field partner brac

gilda is a 57-year-old farmer who lives in the town of trento, agusan del sur. she is married and has six children.\r\n\r\ngilda primarily grows rice to sell. she works hard to keep her crops healthy. she requested a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. gilda hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

miarintsoa is a dynamic and hard-working young woman of 26 years old. she is married and her husband is a barber. they have two children together, 2 and 9 years old.

as a revenue generating activity, miarintsoa has been managing a butcher's shop for a very long time. since it was her parents' profession as well, she didn't have any difficulty mastering the skill.

she is requesting a loan to be able to develop her business, to increase the quantity of products for sale, and to propose other kinds of meat in order to improve her family's revenue.

her goal is to increase her savings, to build her own house one day, and to improve her family's standard of living.

as a way of generating income, imelda cooks and sells snack foods within her community. she is 44 years old and has four school-age children. \r\n\r\ndue to the high cost of school fees, imelda needs to earn a higher income in order to support her children's education she is therefore seeking a loan of php 7,000 to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, yeast and other ingredients for her business. she is hoping that she will improve her enterprise through the financial assistance she has requested.

humberto is grateful to investors for the loan, and he is happy for the support. he is 26 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which he has two children. he is a hardworking person who moves his family forward.

humberto continues to make his living in agriculture. he has various plots where he plants potatoes, corn, broad beans and barley. he also continues to raise small animals.

humberto continues to belong to the "miraflores" community bank. this time, he needs the loan to buy seeds and manure.

humberto was born in the community of callacancha, and lives in the same community where he was born. (the community of callacancha is located in the district of paucartambo in the paucartambo province within the department of cusco, peru.)

christine is 29 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with one child aged 3 years. christine does farming and has been in this business for four years. she also has a tailoring business and it has been profitable. 

she plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting on her farm. she will also buy textile materials for use in her tailoring business. she will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and give good health for her children. 

this is her first loan term from visionfund kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

lourdemiya is 40 years old and married. she has two children in school. for about ten years, she has been selling grocery items in a small shop she has fixed up in her home. thanks to this business, she manages to meet the needs of her family. she is asking for a micro-loan to stock up more often and in greater amounts. she hopes to improve her income and her living conditions.

lucila was born in ollantaytambo and lives in the neighborhood of san isidro. she has lived her entire life surrounded by cattle raising and agriculture. the majority of the residents in ollantaytambo today see tourism as a way to help improve their quality of life. in her home, lucila rents out a couple of rooms to both peruvian as well as foreign tourists. each room costs approximately 15 - 20 soles. her home is located in the main plaza of ollantaytambo. from the time she was young lucila learned how to harvest and plant. she has a small plot of land, alongside her house, where she grows corn, potatoes and onions. several years ago her husband died and left lucila with 5 children to support. she exudes the qualities of a kind and friendly woman. with her loan of approximately $150us, lucila would like to buy seeds and fertilizer. she is one of the founding members of the communal bank called "la amistad de ollantaytambo", or "the friendship of of ollantaytambo".

translated from spanish by emily charnes, kiva volunteer

evelyn is 35 years old and married with four children who are in school. she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

evelyn has a fishing business in the philippines. evelyn requested a php 19,000 loan through nwtf to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business.

evelyn has been in this business for 15 years. in the future, evelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

muntari, a babban gona maize farmer, is a married and lives in a modest mud house with his family, in damari village, kaduna. muntari is a meticulous farmer who has invested time and resources into his farm. like every parent, he hopes to see his three children work twice as hard and become successful in the future.

owing to his inner zeal and enthusiasm, muntari is able to ensure that his family eats three square meals a day. in order for muntari to keep improving his yield and as a result feed his family, he needs access to high quality inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and better yielding seeds. luckily, as a babban gona member, muntari will be provided with a full suite of the best inputs to optimize his farm and increase his yields up to 3.5 metric tonnes per hectare; 2.3 times the national average.

with increased yields and income of up to 3.5 times the national average, muntari looks forward to using his additional income to pay his children's school fees. muntari is a happy babban gona farmer and holds the memory of when he had a good harvest, as his best as a babban gona member. muntari looks forward to a brighter future with babban gona, as he too has joined the fight against poverty.

mr. batkhorloo is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two children in ulaanbaatar, the capital city of mongolia. the family resides in an apartment.  

his wife has been running a business, selling belts at a sales center by renting stalls for six years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience.  for the past year, he has been producing and selling vacuum insulated windows and, even though he has been in business for a short time, he has succeeded in attracting quite a number of permanent clients. 

the apartment they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair.  so, he is requesting a loan of 6,700,000 mnt in order to purchase construction and insulation materials such as gypsum, glass cottons and pressed board as well as to install a floor heating system.  as a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the chilling winds and frosts. the insulated and renovated apartment offers many benefits including not loosing heat.
